Ensign Alyx Morgan 10-Oct-19 12:32 PM

irishgaming1 16-Oct-19 08:18 PM

Ensign Alyx Morgan 16-Oct-19 08:21 PM
He went up to Kivat, looking up at him. "If you continue to speak to me in this way, I will detain you for insubordination and demote you. My reasons for denial are as follows. What you would like is irrelevant, I had to ask you what you wanted when you came in here, and on top of that, you failed to speak to me in a formal manner that of which is associated with me being your senior officer." He said, before backing up a foot. "I want you to leave this officer, re-enter, and ask your request with proper respect for me." He said firmly, without raising his voice at all. (edited)

Ensign Alyx Morgan 18-Oct-19 03:19 PM
He nodded, clearly confused as to why the Ensign was here
Captain Syrezeaju 18-Oct-19 03:25 PM
"Perhaps you should give us a moment, Cronos," she mentioned to him, sensing the awkwardness between the two.
Knightlife2 18-Oct-19 03:26 PM
"Oh. Yes, of course. I'll wait outside for you, Captain." He turned and left, wandering out into the hall.
Captain Syrezeaju 18-Oct-19 03:28 PM
Once he had left she looked to Zanmar. "Right, lieutenant; what can I do for you?"
Ensign Alyx Morgan 18-Oct-19 03:39 PM
"I had Lieutenant Eshlyp enter my office today. He did not speak until I asked him what he wanted, at which pointed he said that he would 'like to start training some of my personnel in small unit tactics. I denied this for multiple reasons, and asked him if he would like said reasons listing off. He responded with 'that is literally my speciality and a good idea for the times we beam into unknown places, like an enemy ship.' At which point I walked up to him and stated that if he continued to speak to me in that time, I would detain him for insubordination and demote him, before then stating my reasons of denying his 'request', which were the fact that what he would 'like' is irrelevant, the fact that he failed to introduce himself when entering as if he expected something from me, and the fact that he failed to speak to me in a formal manner of which I expect from all my subordinates. I then told him to leave, and re-enter my office and to ask his request with proper respect for me. He left, and never returned." He said, recalling everything as if he was some form of android with it all on record
Captain Syrezeaju 18-Oct-19 03:41 PM
"Wait wait wait, slow down for a minute, lieutenant. So... He required a reminder about how to address people formally, and you provided that. Him leaving and not coming back is a bit untoward; I could speak with him about it, if you'd like?"
Ensign Alyx Morgan 18-Oct-19 03:43 PM
"Yes please. And might I just state, sir, that if he speaks to me in such a manner again, I will go through with the detention and demotion. I will not tolerate insubordinate attitude from my crew, or any crew. You know my background, Captain, you know why." He said, sounding honestly as if he wished people would just get that and respect him for once.
Captain Syrezeaju 18-Oct-19 03:46 PM
"I don't think that demotion is entirely necessary, lieutenant. I understand your frustration, but let's try to resolve things without any drastic action at first. I'll speak to him and ensure he's aware of correct procedure. As for his idea of carrying out training... Do you not believe that it would be beneficial?"
Ensign Alyx Morgan 18-Oct-19 03:47 PM
"It would, but I do not believe it would be beneficial to be taught by someone who does not respect their senior officer. He would be a bad influence."
Captain Syrezeaju 18-Oct-19 03:51 PM
"I don't think that he doesn't respect you. It's possible that he just mistook the casual atmosphere around the rest of the ship for what's accepted down here - and evidently he was wrong. He's not going to be teaching 'how to address your senior officer 101'. If it would be beneficial, then I think you should organise it."
Ensign Alyx Morgan 18-Oct-19 03:52 PM
"Please speak to him, and ask him to return to my office so I can approve him training." He said, clearly understanding the captain's words and advice (edited)
Captain Syrezeaju 18-Oct-19 04:02 PM
"I'll go and speak with him now. Thank you for considering it; and do please try to get along with him. I don't want any fighting between my officers."
Ensign Alyx Morgan 18-Oct-19 04:02 PM
He nodded. "That would not exactly be productive, sir." He said, agreeing with her (edited)
Captain Syrezeaju 18-Oct-19 04:06 PM
She turned to leave, but paused in the doorway. "Oh, and a request, lieutenant: don't call me sir, please. I've always hated that." With that she gave him a smile and headed out. (edited)
Ensign Alyx Morgan 18-Oct-19 05:23 PM
He nodded at her as she left, before going back to his work

Captain Syrezeaju 27-Oct-19 08:10 PM
As usual Talos took up position leaning against the windowframe. This seemed to be what she did no matter which room they were in. "Take a seat, you two..."
spicyitaliana 27-Oct-19 08:10 PM
The girl walked in, silent. She sat down, being petty enough to not look Zanmar in the eye.
Ensign Alyx Morgan 27-Oct-19 08:10 PM
He went and sat down on his side of the desk.
Captain Syrezeaju 27-Oct-19 08:11 PM
"Right, Lieutenant Zanmar... Earlier today you stated one of the reasons for not letting Lieutenant Vacult here be part of the away team was because she's from the KDF."
Ensign Alyx Morgan 27-Oct-19 08:12 PM
"Yes Captain." He said plainly
Captain Syrezeaju 27-Oct-19 08:12 PM
"Would you like to explain the reasoning behind your statement?"
Ensign Alyx Morgan 27-Oct-19 08:14 PM
"The exact reason I wanted her blade. The KDF are ruthless, they kill for honour, and think that if someone has killed someone, they should be killed. They do not use phasers because it is 'too sudden' of a death for the person at the other end. They are not suitable to be under our command on tactical missions as they compromise our ethics and tactics, as has been proven today." He said plainly. He seemingly had no hatred in his tone, just general disgust for their way of dealing with people.
spicyitaliana 27-Oct-19 08:15 PM
She raised an eyebrow. So she was right.
Captain Syrezeaju 27-Oct-19 08:16 PM
"Lieutenant Vacult was accepted onto this exchange. For as long as she wishes to, she is a Starfleet officer. Do you not think, lieutenant, that those who chose her for this exchange would not have ensured that she can uphold Starfleet codes of conduct whilst here?"
Ensign Alyx Morgan 27-Oct-19 08:16 PM
"And yet she murdered in cold blood... with a blade." He said plainly (edited)
spicyitaliana 27-Oct-19 08:17 PM
K’pora held her tongue. They did unspeakable things, and she took care of it.
Captain Syrezeaju 27-Oct-19 08:20 PM
"Did you have phasers set to stun, or to kill, lieutenant?" She questioned.
Ensign Alyx Morgan 27-Oct-19 08:21 PM
"Mine was on stun, others... were not." He said plainly. "But a phaser death is almost painless. A blade causes agony, and a slow death." (edited)
Captain Syrezeaju 27-Oct-19 08:23 PM
"I understand your issue with Lieutenant Vacult here using a blade. I've already discussed this with her, and reminded her that it's not a Starfleet-issue weapon. It'll go down as a formal RoD on her file, and the Lieutenant shall agree to not use a bat'leth whilst on away missions without having it cleared first. My main worry now, Lieutenant Zanmar, is the xenophobia that you've showed today."
spicyitaliana 27-Oct-19 08:23 PM
She kept listening.
Ensign Alyx Morgan 27-Oct-19 08:26 PM
"A Klingon is a perfectly normal sentient being. A Klingon can be a perfectly good Starfleet officer, even a PPF officer. A Klingdon is a murderer when they use a blade over a phaser, the same as anyone else. I do not care of who she is, I care of her actions and her training. I knew she was KDF, I knew this would happen, so I knew to refuse her from this extremely sensitive mission when she had already expressed uncontrolled negative emotion on the bridge towards said situation. I will never allow an emotionally compromised officer on a mission that requires focus, nevermind someone who I knew is primarily trained in bladed combat when I did not want death to occur." (edited)
spicyitaliana 27-Oct-19 08:30 PM
“Then punish your squad for using kill on the phasers.”
Ensign Alyx Morgan 27-Oct-19 08:32 PM
"You should not have been let on that mission with a blade. It is simple. Their lethal force is legally authorised because they felt their life was threatened. As for you, lethal force would have been fine if you did not use a murderously painful weapon."
spicyitaliana 27-Oct-19 08:33 PM
She held her tongue. They mutilated people!
Captain Syrezeaju 27-Oct-19 08:34 PM
"So we can all determine that the use of the bat'leth is the issue, and I've already discussed what shall be done about that. Lieutenant Zanmar. If Lieutenant Vacult here agrees to leave the bat'leth and stick to Starfleet-issue weapons in the future, and learn from this mistake, then will you be willing to drop the prejudice you have towards her?"
spicyitaliana 27-Oct-19 08:35 PM
“I want to put it in my room, hang it up. It’s my fathers, and he’s presumed dead.”
“On my honor I won’t use it—I just want to have a memento of my father.”
Ensign Alyx Morgan 27-Oct-19 08:37 PM
"The only prejudice I have is her actions, which is her cultural training. Had she not been trained in that, she would have been trained in some other way. I do not blame her. I blame her culture, and her training. I have no prejudice to be 'dropped'." He said honestly
spicyitaliana 27-Oct-19 08:38 PM
“But you do,” she explained with a level tone, looking up. “Blaming a culture is a form of prejudice, as it’s how a race’s ideals are.”
Captain Syrezeaju 27-Oct-19 08:40 PM
"...I'm afraid that blaming someone's culture is prejudiced. Things are different throughout different cultures. People are taught differently, which you know. Lieutenant Vacult has not had time to experience how we do things within the Federation, and you have not experienced how things are done within the Klingon Empire. There are reasons behind them being taught in such a way - as is the case with every species. Please remember that cultural differences are something to admire, not to dismiss or be hateful for."
Ensign Alyx Morgan 27-Oct-19 08:44 PM
"Is it really prejudice to dislike something with a personal opinion? I do not hate why they are the way they are, only that through evolution, they became the way they did. People know nothing about my culture, and do countless offensive things, but are they prejudice to me? No. They are uneducated. In my case, I am educated in studies older than the United Federation of Planets."
Captain Syrezeaju 27-Oct-19 08:46 PM
Talos pinched the bridge of her nose and exhaled slowly, taking a moment before continuing. "Lieutenant, please. I don't want this to turn into an argument. All I ask is that you show Lieutenant Vacult some respect, treat her like a Starfleet officer, and give her a chance. In turn, I'm certain that she will be willing to do the same for you. Okay?"
spicyitaliana 27-Oct-19 08:46 PM
She nodded.
Ensign Alyx Morgan 27-Oct-19 08:48 PM
"Those who murder and have no regret deserve no social respect. Those who murder and learn to regret deserve equal social respect." He said, almost sounding like he was quoting someone.
spicyitaliana 27-Oct-19 08:49 PM
“The Tal Shiar murdered those people. They got justice. Your patrol killed them too.”
Ensign Alyx Morgan 27-Oct-19 08:50 PM
"My patrol actually did not kill a single Tal Shiar. They killed a mutated person, of which also ended that person's suffering."
spicyitaliana 27-Oct-19 08:50 PM
She sighed. It was like she was talking to a brick wall.
Captain Syrezeaju 27-Oct-19 08:54 PM
"Lieutenant Vacult here was acting in self defence, and we have already resolved the issue of her using a bat'leth. We now have the opportunity to move on. I would like you to take that opportunity too, Lieutenant. I do not want to drag this issue on forever, and you're ready well aware that I do not tolerate xenophobia aboard this ship."
spicyitaliana 27-Oct-19 08:56 PM
She was impatient. She just wanted to go drink with Shansa.
Ensign Alyx Morgan 27-Oct-19 08:58 PM
"Is it xenophobic to hate a culture that prides themself of honour to the extent of killing people slowly and painfully who 'do not have' honour? Is it xenophobic to hate how she managed to take a blade on an away mission? Is it xenophobic to hate her choice of using a blade when we have phasers, of which are humane? Is it xenophobic to have this reaction when I saw sentient beings murdered, stabbed and bled to death for no justified reason? Is it xenophobic to think her a murderer when I had to clear up her hideous, disgusting, putrid, depressing mess?" He said, sounding a combination of disgusted, genuinely upset by what he saw, and somewhat horrified, for that matter, but without raising his voice. Clearly, he had been holding his emotions back, and now they burst, like a water balloon. (edited)
spicyitaliana 27-Oct-19 08:59 PM
She pinched her nose. “I’m going to go drink. It’s xenophobic when they did deserve it, as they tested on innocents. Captain, you’re welcome to join us when we’re drinking.” She got up, hoping Rhea would remember her saying that ‘you couldn’t fix anyone’ and take her offer to drink. (edited)
Captain Syrezeaju 27-Oct-19 09:02 PM
"I'll speak with you later, Lieutenant," she said to Vacult. She wasn't about to stop the woman from leaving; there was no more need for her to stay anyway. After a few moments Talos pushed herself away from the wall and began to unsteadily pace the room, despite it being rather small. "What... What exactly did you have to deal with down there, Lieutenant. I didn't see any of it. I don't know the extent of what she did. I was under the impression that it was just that Tal Shiar agent in medical..."
Ensign Alyx Morgan 27-Oct-19 09:19 PM
“Several unharmed prisoners, several stunned prisoners, and.... I lost track of how many dead Tal Shiar. All dead... to a blade. Unless she went through the head, which she did not, it would have been slow... and painful. I have seen injuries, I have seen domestic violence. I have never seen that many bloodied corpses, and I am 36...” He said, sighing.
Captain Syrezeaju 27-Oct-19 09:20 PM
Talos froze, mid-step. "Are you trying to tell me that she killed more than just the Tal Shiar agents..?"
Ensign Alyx Morgan 27-Oct-19 09:25 PM
“I do not know who they were. I arrived after the fighting. I feel like she killed those who posed a threat in her opinion, from what she said, but, still.... with a blade...” He said, sounding more and more disgusted.
Captain Syrezeaju 27-Oct-19 09:26 PM
"Did she or did she not kill those other than the Tal Shiar. It's a simple yes or no question, lieutenant."
Ensign Alyx Morgan 27-Oct-19 09:28 PM
“I think they were all wearing the same uniforms associated with Tal Shiar, not that it should matter...”
Captain Syrezeaju 27-Oct-19 09:30 PM
"It does matter. If she had killed innocent people then we would have an entirely different situation on our hands. There is a distinct difference between killing war criminals because they shot at you and killing unarmed victims," she stated, bristling in anger. "You have my sincerest apologies about what happened down there. I hadn't realised that she intended to use a Bat'leth - some people just prefer combat instead of firing from a distance. The lieutenant has been told what to do, and she's agreed. She's been reprimanded. It's going down as an RoD on her file. What more would you like me to do to amend this?"
Ensign Alyx Morgan 27-Oct-19 09:34 PM
“Make her regret killing sentient beings!” He shouted, standing up violently in the process. “Just like the nanites made us regret killing them, just like my people make anyone if they kill! It is an unacceptable crime against a person, regardless of what they did!” He shouted, shouting louder than the red alert claxon. It was obvious his emotions had built up, seemingly for a while. However, during all of this, he did not move towards the captain, or seem violent. He just shouted, knowing better than to physically harm anyone. He was taught how to express his emotions, and he was now doing just that. ‘Shouting is better than harming anyone.’ (edited)
Captain Syrezeaju 27-Oct-19 09:40 PM
Talos had turned to face him, standing resolute. She may have looked horrendous and ready to keel over, but her posture was perfect and she never once faltered. "Did your other officers kill today? Yes. Did they have their phasers set to kill? Yes. Am I being told to reprimand them? No. Vacult and the rest of her team performed in self defence. The Tal Shiar fired first. You are focussing on Vacult because of a mistake she made, one which has been dealt with. Learn to move on, or I will forcibly make you move on."
Ensign Alyx Morgan 27-Oct-19 09:43 PM
“My personnel put a mutation out if its misery without causing it a single bit of pain in the process! We used phasers, we did not harm in the process! Next thing you will tell me is putting down a pet on earth for its suffering is wrong, or a rabid animal that is attacking you. We caused no harm, she caused pain. That is the difference, Captain.” He said, his volume slowly lowering the more he spoke
Captain Syrezeaju 27-Oct-19 09:45 PM
"I am aware, Lieutenant. You have said this already. I have reprimanded her for her actions. It's going on her file. She's agreed to not use a bat'leth again without having senior staff allow it first. If that isn't good enough for you, then what is?"
Ensign Alyx Morgan 27-Oct-19 09:47 PM
“She has to realise the pain she put people through. She has no remorse.” He said, slumping down into his chair.
Captain Syrezeaju 27-Oct-19 09:53 PM
"She does, you're just not sensitive enough to see it. She was having a breakdown down there in medical over all of this. She regrets everything. If you look further than what's right in front of you, Zanmar, then you'll find that other people have thoughts and feelings too." She paused briefly before shoving her hands into her pockets and looking back to him. "I can't begin to imagine what you saw down there. I know that it must have been traumatic. I know that you're finding it hard to process. But please, for the love of the Gods, speak to a counsellor about it. Do not take it out on my crew."
Ensign Alyx Morgan 27-Oct-19 09:55 PM
“As far as I care, unless she has our training, she is only our crew. She will never be our personnel.” He said firmly (edited)
Captain Syrezeaju 27-Oct-19 09:57 PM
"That is enough, Lieutenant! I will not tolerate that sort of attitude from you. First you continually argue with MacKenzie, and now this? ...I have half a mind to relieve you of duty for your continuous mistreatment of the crew."
Ensign Alyx Morgan 27-Oct-19 10:01 PM
“And yet no one seems to care about my culture. In Klingon culture, she did good, but not in mine. You may have punished her, but that is to your standards, and not mine. That is where you fail to understand me, Captain. I am one of few Alexdon who wanted to join Starfleet, and yet you never seem to understand my cultural perspective on anything anyone does. If she can get away with struggling to adapt, why can I seemingly not get away with struggling to adapt to the ever-increasing disrespectful and rude world that is outside my own? Answer me that.” (edited)
Captain Syrezeaju 27-Oct-19 10:03 PM
Every word she spoke was blunt, straight to the point. She was done cutting corners with him. "She has been here for no time at all, Lieutenant. I have punished her to Federation standards. You are a Federation citizen, you are serving within Starfleet, and therefore you will conform to Federation ruling too. If you cannot put your cultural differences aside, then the Fleet is not for you."
Ensign Alyx Morgan 27-Oct-19 10:07 PM
“You know why I joined Starfleet, Captain? Because I was tired of my own species, tired of doing the same thing over and over. But I never expected other species to be this bad at being culturally sensitive. I have tried to adapt for a year.” (4 years of academy plus 1 year on the vanguard/phoenix = 1 alexdon year) “Tried, and tried, and yet.... no one seems to try and adapt to me, either. I may be a Federation species, but that does not mean I have Federation culture. It is easy for some of my people to adapt, but honestly... no one raised before the Referendum can easily adapt, including myself. Not even your damn second officer was trained in interspecies ethics with Alexdon for crying out loud!” He said, just sounding fed up, yet also sounding like her words were sinking in.
Captain Syrezeaju 27-Oct-19 10:12 PM
Somehow, through the exhaustion, her anger was building. "You are one person amongst an entire crew. Every person aboard this vessel tries to get along. They all try to understand cultural nuances. Perhaps you should stop blaming two-thousand people and realise that the fault is with yourself. I get complaint after complaint about your conduct. I have tried to reason with you, but time and time again it doesn't work. And now this."
Ensign Alyx Morgan 27-Oct-19 10:14 PM
He stood up. “Computer, locate Lieutenant Junior Grade Vacult.” He said as blandly as a vulcan. Clearly, something in him emotionally snapped, or switched off. His tone was empty.
Captain Syrezeaju 27-Oct-19 10:15 PM
"What do you think you're doing, lieutenant?" [Computer] "Lieutenant Junior Grade K'Pora Vacult is in the mess hall. Deck 13."
Ensign Alyx Morgan 27-Oct-19 10:16 PM
“Apologising.” He said blandly, before walking back into the armoury.

He read it, and immediately stood up and left
Ensign Alyx Morgan 10-Nov-19 05:54 PM
He walked in and sat down at his desk, beginning to try and find out who Giles was. He started with medical files.
Deleted User 10-Nov-19 06:18 PM
[D] A medical file did show up on the search; it seemed to be one saved to the databases of numerous medical facilities. There were no details on any of the files, though; all there seemed to be was a ‘request further information’ option and a page to enter Starfleet medical credentials. It seemed as if his details were hidden out of necessity, but easy enough to obtain when they were required; which, judging by the number of facilities the file was saved to, seemed to be often.
Ensign Alyx Morgan 10-Nov-19 06:29 PM
He sighed and tapped his commbadge
Ensign Alyx Morgan 10-Nov-19 06:43 PM
He ended the comm and proceeded to put in the medical credentials that were sent to him
Deleted User 10-Nov-19 07:00 PM
[D] Almost immediately the file became accessible, and it was extensive. Arranged in chronological order there were well over a hundred notes displayed. Every section from around age twenty to twenty-six appeared to be classified; either asking for another unknown credential or coming up as completely redacted. Included in this classified section seemed to be any note of his joining – it didn’t appear at any other point. The rest seemed like normal notes. At age twenty-seven there was a diagnosis of a terminal illness and a life expectancy of two years given. Every so often that life expectancy seemed to change; it could go either up or down. Apparently he had a bit of a knack of defying medical. There was an extensive list of hospital admissions and treatments and note of his prescription of numerous drugs, all to dull the symptoms. There was even mention of how he had been given a service dog trained to detect his seizures before they happened. None of this was classified at all – only the earlier section remained hidden, tauntingly greyed out.
Ensign Alyx Morgan 10-Nov-19 07:08 PM
He read the whole thing, and then tapped his commbadge.
Ensign Alyx Morgan 11-Nov-19 11:42 AM
He sat back in his chair having nothing to do... again.

Ensign Alyx Morgan 19-Nov-19 01:54 PM

The stout denobulan woman in medical uniform walked in, immediately flashing the officer a friendly smile. She bustled over to the desk and held out a hand for a handshake. "Lieutenant Zanmar, sorry to keep you waiting there!"
Ensign Alyx Morgan 19-Nov-19 01:58 PM
He stood up, and shook her hand. "It is fine." He said, sounding fed up, annoyed, perhaps angry, and also like he wanted to give up on something.
MCPO. Eshen'strars Houston 19-Nov-19 02:01 PM
"Sit down, sit down, there we are." She took the seat opposite him, swinging her legs for a moment. "Now, what can I help you with? You mentioned that you've been experiencing some issues?" Her expression went from that beaming smile to a sympathetic frown.
Ensign Alyx Morgan 19-Nov-19 02:08 PM
He sat down. "Several..... firstly, the captain denied my uniform change request, then I requested to go elsewhere for shoreleave, and she asked why, followed by me being honest about my reasons, she denying my request, me arguing she cannot because of my rights as a Starfleet officer, she says I am blaming other people for my own problems, and I am to follow my orders and stay onboard during the shoreleave like everyone else who does not want to go for Risa, or I could leave the ship permanently. I then argued against her concept of denying someone with Bajorans having to leave for religious reasons, or Vulcans having to leave for emotional stability reasons, and she then accepted my request to leave, but told me if I blamed other people for my problems again I would be demoted and removed from my position. That woman absolutely hates me and everything I do. She is two-faced. One minute she praises my ability to command, the next, she denies my wish to leave the vessel so I can regain emotional control among my people and says I am blaming other people for my problems, when all I said was no one on here is trained in interspecies ethics and are bigots because they associate me, an individual, to my whole species, in which upsetting and insulting another Alexdon onboard in the process. I had complaints from that Alexdon. She blamed me for making bad impressions of our species, which I admit is my fault, but then everyone thinks all of my people are the same, and I cannot stand that at all, which is why I wanted to spend my shoreleave away from these idiots!" As he spoke, his voice slowly got louder, and louder, and louder, to the point of shouting, and pure rage. Clearly, he had been messed about a lot, and in his opinion, treated unfairly, unjustifiably unfairly. (edited)
MCPO. Eshen'strars Houston 19-Nov-19 02:17 PM
Phenna had remained completely silent but had nodded along whilst hastily scrawling noted on her PADD. She only spoke once she was certain that he had stopped. "Alright. Firstly, we're going to take some deep breaths. In for three - one, two, three - out for three. There we are. And again. Just like what I'm doing. There we go, perfect. We're allowed to be angry, but we don't want it to cloud our judgement or get in our way, so we're going to take a moment to slow down." She waited for a minute before continuing. "Now, if you're ready, let's go through this step by step."
Ensign Alyx Morgan 19-Nov-19 02:18 PM
"Which step first?" He asked, seemingly calm....er
MCPO. Eshen'strars Houston 19-Nov-19 02:18 PM
"The first you brought up was the issue of uniform, so how about there?"
Ensign Alyx Morgan 19-Nov-19 02:22 PM
"Right... I went to request a uniform change in person.... extending the coat to correctly replicate traditional Alexdon garments. She denied it, stating that if one person changed it, everyone would..... I said Bajorans could wear an earring, Kelpiens could wear custom boots, and Bounder don't wear trousers, and yet she did not accept my request as valid. I left, and as I did, she said something about explaining it.... I went to my office, took a break from her, and then did, which she did not respond to at all.... Of which I then proceeded to request leave... which is the next step."
MCPO. Eshen'strars Houston 19-Nov-19 02:26 PM
"Okay... Bajoran earrings are due to a person's faith, Kelpiens quite literally cannot wear standard boots, and as far as I'm aware, Bounders cannot wear conventional clothing like we can. Was your request one which reflects faith or practicality, or is it just part of a custom? Something tells me that you may find the reason for your disagreement there."
Ensign Alyx Morgan 19-Nov-19 02:26 PM
"It is inappropriate..." He said, sounding a little uneasy at the whole concept.
MCPO. Eshen'strars Houston 19-Nov-19 02:29 PM
"Sorry, I don't think I fully understand... What is it you find inappropriate?"
Ensign Alyx Morgan 19-Nov-19 02:29 PM
He sighed, and stood up gesturing to his hip/pelvic area. "This is all meant to be covered, front and back..." (edited)
MCPO. Eshen'strars Houston 19-Nov-19 02:31 PM
"Do trousers not serve that purpose..?" She enquired, and sounded like it was a legitimate question as opposed to being sarcastic.
Ensign Alyx Morgan 19-Nov-19 02:31 PM
"This uniform does not serve the standardised purpose our clothing does. It is too close, to form-fitting."
MCPO. Eshen'strars Houston 19-Nov-19 02:34 PM
"As unfortunate as it is, the uniform is designed with practicality in mind... Technically speaking there's no way for it to be changed in such a way. There's no aspect of faith or accessibility in mind with your proposed change to it, I'm afraid."
Ensign Alyx Morgan 19-Nov-19 02:35 PM
"My people have functioned for decades with elongated torso garments without issue."
MCPO. Eshen'strars Houston 19-Nov-19 02:40 PM
"Your people aren't the only ones within Starfleet. Uniform is getting redesigned all the time, though. I'm quite happy to feed back your suggestion - but for the time being you'll have to make do with what you have. Perhaps after a while you might get used to it?"
Ensign Alyx Morgan 19-Nov-19 02:40 PM
"I have been doing this job for over a year, and at the academy for four. I always hated it...."
MCPO. Eshen'strars Houston 19-Nov-19 02:43 PM
"When it comes to uniform it's just something that you have to get used to. I know it's not the comfiest of things, but there's always the chance it might get changed in the future! Now, onto the next topic - shore leave. You said that you're eager to spend shore leave away from the crew. Can you explain to me why that is?" She asked, stylus poised to take more notes.
Ensign Alyx Morgan 19-Nov-19 02:45 PM
He sighed. "No one respects me here because of my way of behaving, but no one gives me chance to change.... They judge me because I do not like their culture, or because I am stern, or because of whatever rumours spread around.... They are all bigoted because they think I represent my entire species. They literally treated another Alexdon badly because of them thinking we are all identical...."
MCPO. Eshen'strars Houston 19-Nov-19 02:48 PM
"I very highly doubt that they believe that every person of your species are identical. Have you considered that maybe you're the first Alexdon that you've encountered, and so you're creating this impression of your species for them?"
Ensign Alyx Morgan 19-Nov-19 02:50 PM
"Perhaps.... but they are narrow-minded if they think we are all similar. I had complaints from another Alexdon about me giving everyone onboard a bad impression of our species... I am fine with myself, but when it gets to the point of upsetting my people, I will not tolerate it anymore... I just want a break from everyone onboard.... to be with my people, to learn to be peaceful again."
MCPO. Eshen'strars Houston 19-Nov-19 02:55 PM
"I do think that sounds like a wise course of action. However, shore leave would give you the chance to talk with others. You could learn their culture, they could learn yours." Her frown was sympathetic, but she sounded resolute. It was like a perfect balance between the two. "You won't get anywhere if you shy away from an issue. You have to take the first step, otherwise nothing will ever change."
Ensign Alyx Morgan 19-Nov-19 02:56 PM
He nodded. "Do you know anything of my people?"
MCPO. Eshen'strars Houston 19-Nov-19 02:58 PM
Phenna gave a smile and spoke from the heart. "I do, yes."
Ensign Alyx Morgan 19-Nov-19 02:59 PM
"Then you know why I do not want to go anywhere near Risa..."
MCPO. Eshen'strars Houston 19-Nov-19 03:06 PM
"Because of the temperature, or because of what the planet is known for? There's a very large misconception about Risa nowadays. It's been characterised for the... Uhm... Exploration of intimacy, to be polite about it. It's a regular well-ran holiday destination too. There are clothings you can replicate to keep your core temperature cool, so that issue is more than fixable." She stopped for a minute to let herself catch up with the writing. "If those aren't acceptable, there are members of the crew who will be staying here - it would be a smaller group for you to deal with. Maybe you could spend a week on One before returning to the ship? You could use whatever learning you have reconciled there to start building the foundations of a better relationship with others here." (edited)
Ensign Alyx Morgan 19-Nov-19 03:08 PM
"My initial plan was to only spend a week, just to learn.... And then to come back and practice it. Plus, also, the medical side of things: Being off One for too long is unhealthy for us physically, as I am sure you are aware."
MCPO. Eshen'strars Houston 19-Nov-19 03:16 PM
"Perfect, I'll have that plan sent on, then! You can spend a week there to reconcile and reconsolidate, and then come back here. Now. You mentioned numerous times that there's a bit of a conflict between yourself and your commanding officer - would you like to tell me a bit more about that?"
Ensign Alyx Morgan 19-Nov-19 03:18 PM
"One minute, she is praising my ability to command... and then she is slagging me off instead of actually helping me, as well as threatening me with demotion, nevermind denying my shoreleave which is against my rights as a Federation citizen and a Starfleet officer. You know what I told you in that... rant... when you first came in here...."
MCPO. Eshen'strars Houston 19-Nov-19 03:25 PM
"I'm going to presume that there are reasons being those actions. What exactly has she said to uhm, 'slag you off'? I'm sure you can understand that this is quite a serious matter to be dealt with, so any specifics would be appreciated."
Ensign Alyx Morgan 19-Nov-19 03:27 PM
"Accused me of blaming other people for my problems.... Saying I was the one with the problems, when everyone else is making me feel the way I do... Also I must admit... I do not know what 'slag you off' means truly, I just learnt the rough concept at the Academy..." (edited)
MCPO. Eshen'strars Houston 19-Nov-19 03:34 PM
"It's when you insult or belittle someone," she explained in clarification. "From what I've heard, Lieutenant, it's not just the fault of everybody else. You need to be more open, and help them to change. Not everyone is a Betazoid; if you aren't willing to be civil and explain that you're hurt then no one is going to know. You have to step up and make the change, and help them follow."
Ensign Alyx Morgan 19-Nov-19 03:57 PM
He nodded. "The thing is..... everything is so complicated here..... At home, I can apologise, mean it, and have done with. Here, people hold grudges, people do not accept apologies if they think they are fake..." (edited)
MCPO. Eshen'strars Houston 19-Nov-19 04:02 PM
"Quite often when it comes to other species, actions speak louder than words. Saying that you're sorry and that you'll do differently in future is one thing, but proving that through your actions is another."
Ensign Alyx Morgan 19-Nov-19 04:03 PM
"How can I prove myself different when I go off what I was always taught? What I have always known?"
MCPO. Eshen'strars Houston 19-Nov-19 04:05 PM
"That's where you have to be willing to adapt, to change - to learn." She gave a soft smile. "Life within Starfleet is never easy, but if you're willing to take those steps to adapt, then it can easily be the biggest opportunity of a lifetime."
Ensign Alyx Morgan 19-Nov-19 04:06 PM
"How do I not clash with cultures I believe to be inferior, or wrong?...."
MCPO. Eshen'strars Houston 19-Nov-19 04:09 PM
"There's something that you've done wrong already. No-one is inferior. Everyone is equal. You may differ on opinions, but you have to agree to disagree. There's a framework we use within my profession - CALM. Consider, acknowledge, listen, manage. You consider the person's point of view. Acknowledge that while theirs may be different to your own, that they are entitled to it. Instead of berating them you listen to what they have to say. Manage that difference; instead of escalating it, you can just agree to disagree. Or, if it's of a more crucial matter, then it can be brought to a third-party."
Ensign Alyx Morgan 19-Nov-19 04:10 PM
"And how do I deal with Klingons?" He asked. It was clear that they were an issue for him.
MCPO. Eshen'strars Houston 19-Nov-19 04:18 PM
"By treating them like you would any other person - with kindness and respect. Cultural clashes happen all the time and it is something that you just have to work through." Her frown had changed. It was no longer sympathetic, just concerned.
Ensign Alyx Morgan 19-Nov-19 04:21 PM
"And when they chose to use a blade instead of a phaser? And say people deserve to die? Then what?"
MCPO. Eshen'strars Houston 19-Nov-19 04:22 PM
"Then you tell them off as part of your job, but acknowledge that they have been brought up differently. If you want people to take your culture to heart then you have got to do the same for those of others in return."
Ensign Alyx Morgan 19-Nov-19 04:22 PM
He nodded slightly. It was obvious this information was seeping into his stubborn skull.
MCPO. Eshen'strars Houston 19-Nov-19 04:30 PM
"What I want you to take away from this, lieutenant, is the concept of change. I want you to realise that everybody is capable of it, including yourself. Asking others to help you is all very well... Coincidentally, an anonymous report was sent to the Academy recently detailing how Alexdon culture needs to be better integrated... But you have to be willing to take those first steps as well. You've gotten this far; through the Academy training, through two ranks, to a department head." You could practically hear the happiness return to her voice. "Something makes me think that you're more than capable of making a change."
Ensign Alyx Morgan 19-Nov-19 04:34 PM
He nodded. "I.... have been considering something... but I doubt it would be allowed when I need it." He commented
MCPO. Eshen'strars Houston 19-Nov-19 04:36 PM
"Would you like to tell me what you're thinking about?"
Ensign Alyx Morgan 19-Nov-19 04:38 PM
".........Getting a... 'pet'."
MCPO. Eshen'strars Houston 19-Nov-19 04:40 PM
She chuckled a little, having remembered seeing Zanmar amongst the crowd at the tribunal and making the connection. "There are other people aboard this ship who own pets. Not large animals, but animals nonetheless. I don't see why a request would be denied for you - I think it would do you some good."
Ensign Alyx Morgan 19-Nov-19 04:42 PM
"Except I know protocol, you cannot bring it with you during work."
MCPO. Eshen'strars Houston 19-Nov-19 04:47 PM
"Not unless it's a working dog, then no. Your anger management can't be put onto a pet, Lieutenant, it's something that you have to do for yourself. Raising a pet is a good form of stress relief though - something nice to go back to at the end of the day."
Ensign Alyx Morgan 19-Nov-19 04:49 PM
"I just want company...." He said, sounding genuinely downtrodden, even perhaps a bit lonely.
MCPO. Eshen'strars Houston 19-Nov-19 04:51 PM
"When you're on duty you have a job to do. A pet is that company that you can come back to; and it may bring you closer to others aboard the ship. You can use it as an opportunity to speak with others who own pets, use it as something in common."
Ensign Alyx Morgan 19-Nov-19 04:52 PM
"Personally, if I may speak my opinion, I do not understand why, in my line of work, said pet cannot be in my office. All I do is administration unless someone, somewhere, breaks the rules. This is a desk job."
MCPO. Eshen'strars Houston 19-Nov-19 04:55 PM
"Because there are rules in place for a reason, and you, just like everybody else, have to follow them." Phenna was getting the feeling that Zanmar really didn't understand that everything didn't revolve around him. Uniform, shore leave, culture, pets; he wanted it all adapted to serve himself...
Ensign Alyx Morgan 19-Nov-19 04:56 PM
He sat quietly for a moment, before speaking. "Fish, fish tank, quarters, something nice to look at in the evening. Quiet company."
MCPO. Eshen'strars Houston 19-Nov-19 04:58 PM
"That sounds very nice and relaxing. Or perhaps you could consider the likes of a hamster - something small but one you can interact with, that isn't too hard to look after?"
Ensign Alyx Morgan 19-Nov-19 05:00 PM
"They are rodents, right? I think they do not live for very long... And, well, you know how long I live for. That would only be a few months to me."
MCPO. Eshen'strars Houston 19-Nov-19 05:05 PM
"A guinea pig, then? They tend to live a bit longer..?"
Ensign Alyx Morgan 19-Nov-19 05:09 PM
"Do you not have to keep two of them? I thought you did.... and yes, I slightly studied Terran animals."
MCPO. Eshen'strars Houston 19-Nov-19 05:12 PM
She gave a sheepish laugh. "Honestly, I'm not too sure! I don't own any pets myself. But I'm sure there are lots of resources for you to go through so you can make an informed decision."
Ensign Alyx Morgan 19-Nov-19 05:14 PM
"I will consider it. The downside, though, is that I cannot pay for animals."
MCPO. Eshen'strars Houston 19-Nov-19 05:16 PM
She raised a bushy eyebrow. "This is the Federation. Paying doesn't exist."
Ensign Alyx Morgan 19-Nov-19 05:17 PM
"I thought it did...."
MCPO. Eshen'strars Houston 19-Nov-19 05:20 PM

cayde-6 03-Jan-20 03:27 PM
he walks out to the hallway
Deleted User 03-Jan-20 03:48 PM
Only a moment after Tarna'Motlan and Eshlyp had exited, a newcomer silently stepped into the room. Pitch black but friendly eyes immediately looked over the new chief security officer, gathering first impressions; excitement. A hint of anxiousness... But mostly determination. She shuffled forwards slightly; out of the dimmness of the entrance to the door and into the light. The newcomer was an older woman, admittedly rather short and stout, with long, silver hair neatly pinned back. She seemed to be a Denobulan by general appearance, and in typical Denobulan fashion, gave a friendly smile. "You give a good speech, Lieutenant Windsor. I haven't known your security officers to be so optimistic before; it makes me hopeful for the future of this department."
She got up, gave a slight nod and approached her, smiling to shake her hand. "Oh that is too kind Admiral. I try to do what's best for them and for the crew." she said, her secure tone hiding her complete meltdown she was having. Shit! She didn't know she was going to meet with the Admiral today.
She fidgeted a bit around with her duty belt, fixing a bit her phaser weapon and equipment fixed on it.
She remembered that the admiral was also partly betazoid, so she managed to calm herself down to avoid any problems.
Phenna chuckled a little at the lieutenant's frantic move to stand up, and then accepted the handshake gratefully. "I'm glad to hear it; they deserve someone who can help mend the rift between security and the other departments... I trust that you have already been informed of the tension between your own people and the rest of this ship?"
"I have heard, unluckily. I've spoken with Commander Dunamis this morning, so I am up to speed with the situation." she let out a little sigh. "I was actually writing a departmental memo right now, to delineate the various divisions and the techniques and procedures to adopt." she said, now smiling happily at the admiral.
Deleted User 03-Jan-20 04:33 PM
"It sounds like you already have everything under control," she mused. "Security's issues run deeper than just their previous head of department, though. A significant number of this crew came from another vessel; the Vanguard. Their head of department was exactly the same; discriminatory in practice, harsh in judgement. As their successor, I thought you ought to be aware that people may find it hard to trust you - to begin with, at least... By no fault of yours, of course."
"I see. I appreciate the heads up. I had considered it, the possibility of a difficulty of engagement. I do hope that I will be able to overcome this. I should probably get in the mess hall, start getting to know people, and such. Would that be an appropriate course of action, in your opinion?" she said, taking a quick note of it on a PADD notebook she produced from her belt. (edited)
Deleted User 03-Jan-20 05:11 PM
"Getting to know the crew is more than definitely a wise choice. The people previously in your position refused to socialise, from what I've heard. They were loathe to interact with others and learn the ins and outs of this crew; how they function, how they live. Going ahead and getting to know people would be an immediate improvement upon that."
"Then that will surely my course ot action." she said. "Was there anything else?"
Deleted User 03-Jan-20 05:27 PM
"No, Lieutenant; that was all. I just thought a 'good luck' might be in order." She added the latter part as an afterthought, giving a friendly smile.
"Oh, it is highly appreciated." she said, pausing briefly. "Would you by any chance be able to take a look at my memo for the new guidelines?" she said, addressing the Admiral, hopeful.
"I'd be delighted to - but I won't begin to pretend that I'll understand all of it, though," she replied with a light laugh. The blue division colour of her uniform easily conveyed that security wasn't her area of expertise.
"Of course." she continued. "Here!" she said, handing her the memo. ( #deleted-channel )
Deleted User 03-Jan-20 05:58 PM
The woman spent a good few moments quickly skimming through the information. "This... All of this sounds fantastic, even just as a basis for future work. Your investigations team can be partnered with intelligence, the special response team could be paired with tactical... And I'm aware that the ship doesn't currently have a boatswain, but when one is appointed then the project could be a collaboration with them. Yes, all of this is very good work..." She trailed off though, squinting at a certain part of the document. "Although... Doesn't the concept of your officers being armed at all times convey a negative message?"

If the hallway here was a little blackened, that's why. Apparently making weapons is a form of coping mechanism for him after some sort of accident. Word has it that he's received treatment for the condition, but just how smoothly along it goes, I don't know."
Nebtadjeser 24-Feb-20 04:29 AM
"Deeply concerning. Has he been relieved of duty while he's being treated? Or are we looking at another potential accident, but this time with ship grade weaponry?"
KardasXRT 24-Feb-20 04:30 AM

Lt. JG. Ramat'iklan 25-Feb-20 01:50 PM

I swept his room with ensign Walsh and thankfully found nothing of concern. If you ask me, he needs to be kept in a mental ward lest he do something we can't control. If this is what he does while mentally compromised I shudder to think what he's capable of when clear in the head." (edited)
Nebtadjeser 25-Feb-20 01:54 PM

From what I've gathered, he's being followed by Medical and one of the ship's counsellor, as per peevious recommendations. Now, as much as I'd like to acquiesce to your recommendation, the only thing we can do is increase surveillance to make sure an incident like that does not happen again." He leaned forward on his desk "You recommended a mental institute. Is that not slightly... Drastic a measure?"
Lt. JG. Ramat'iklan 25-Feb-20 01:55 PM
"Sir. Permission to speak frankly?" He requested, sitting up even straighter if possible.
Nebtadjeser 25-Feb-20 01:56 PM
"Always, Lieutenant."
Lt. JG. Ramat'iklan 25-Feb-20 01:59 PM
"He's capable of building a functional, damaging weapon while mentally compromised. As a coping mechanism. You've probably read the reports of all the damage this partially complete weapon caused. He builds something like that while in the wrong state of mind. What happens when he's clear headed and has enough reason? A bomb? A photon micro-torpedo? An antimatter warhead? This is the kind of people Starfleet deems fit for active duty. I'm honestly appalled. While he's got this habit of his he remains a threat, not only to Starfleet and his crew, but himself too."
Nebtadjeser 25-Feb-20 02:02 PM
"A dangerous mind indeed." The Klingon said as he leaned back on his chair. "One filled with the potential to hurt, maim, kill people. Maybe prone to outburst of angers, violence. Isn't that right Lieutenant?"
Lt. JG. Ramat'iklan 25-Feb-20 02:04 PM
"Exactly. Which is why I say that we need him contained, away from anything that can possibly be used to make a weapon or anything similar. Preventive measures."
Nebtadjeser 25-Feb-20 02:05 PM
"Lieutenant. I know your species is not native to our quadrant. How familiar are you with Starfleet history?" (edited)
Lt. JG. Ramat'iklan 25-Feb-20 02:06 PM
"Not very. We only joined the Delta Alliance about sixty years ago, after all."
Nebtadjeser 25-Feb-20 02:10 PM
He nodded "Whay I've said earlier did not only describe Ensign Reyes, but also what the Federation used to think of my own species, in a time that was not so long ago. Now granted, we are dangerous, I will not deny it. Yet, here I am. And so are countless Klingon officers serving on Starfleet vessels." He leaned in on his desk "You may see this as too much leniency, but Starfleet believes in giving its officers a chance. I'm willing to do the same for the Ensign, now that he's fully monitored." (edited)
Lt. JG. Ramat'iklan 25-Feb-20 02:13 PM
"Starfleet also encourages freedom of opinion, as I recall. If you ask me, sir, I would rather err on the side of caution. But that said, I'm not about to do anything reckless and take matters into my own hands. He needs to be watched carefully, that much I agree with." He replied. "You have my word."
Nebtadjeser 25-Feb-20 02:18 PM
He nodded. "And I appreciate your honesty. The Ensign is already under heavy scrutiny, we will not let such a thing happen again. I will have his access to the armouries restricted, unless there is a security or tactical officer officer with him. We must walk a fine line, and make sure we do not cross the line of caution and delve into paranoia, else we become the danger on this ship. I am glad to hear you do not intend to take matters in your own hands on this case."
Lt. JG. Ramat'iklan 25-Feb-20 02:22 PM
"Of course not, sir." He replied simply.
Nebtadjeser 25-Feb-20 02:29 PM
"Good. Now, as much as I appreciate your dedication and hard work, I would prefer if you kept at least a full shift of rest between your own. I am unclear on the amount of rest your species need, but a tired officer is a dangerous one."
Lt. JG. Ramat'iklan 25-Feb-20 02:30 PM
"Yes, sir. I'll find something to do with myself in the meantime, I suppose. Whatever it might be."
Nebtadjeser 25-Feb-20 02:32 PM
"As long as it does not involve building heavy weaponry, I'm sure you'll do just fine." The Klingon chuckled briefly "Now, are there any other concerns, security or otherwise, that you would like to tell me about?"
Lt. JG. Ramat'iklan 25-Feb-20 02:33 PM
"None." He stated simply - he wasn't about to tell his commanding officer about his own problems, of course - no one else needed to fight the battle with him and get hurt along the way.
Nebtadjeser 25-Feb-20 02:37 PM
He studied the Benthan for a few seconds, then nodded "Excellent then. I'm eager to see your work in action, Lieutenant."
Lt. JG. Ramat'iklan 25-Feb-20 02:38 PM
"Yes, sir. You shan't be disappointed." He got up, just as stiffly as before, bowed slightly and marched out of the room without another word.
Nebtadjeser 25-Feb-20 02:43 PM
He nodded to the Lieutenant then turned back to his console. He would have to keep a close eye on that one in the future.

This was going to be interesting. He quickly looked up the crew roster, then tapped his commbadge " @Breaker , this is Lieutenant Commander Kolorf, Chief of Security. Would you have a moment to meet me in my office?"

[Comms] "Of course, sir. Higgs out."
Nebtadjeser 25-Feb-20 10:17 PM
Kolorf nodded to himself before tapping on his commbadge and turning back to his console, resuming his writing.
Breaker 25-Feb-20 10:45 PM
A chime would sound, requesting entry into the room.
Nebtadjeser 25-Feb-20 10:48 PM
The Klingon stood up from his chair and made his way toward the door "Come in."
Breaker 25-Feb-20 10:51 PM
The door would open, though it was apparent that the hologram had not been expecting someone to be standing right there. Though he did not look physically startled, the foot he had lifted to begin stepping into the room was put back down, and instead a snappy salute replaced it. "Lieutenant Commander. My apologies for the underestimation of my progress."
Nebtadjeser 25-Feb-20 10:54 PM
The Klingon looked at the salute, and extended his hand toward the Lieutenant as he stepped in "No need to apologize, Lieutenant. Those things happens." He waited for the hologram to return the handshake, then indicated the chairs in front of his desk "Please, do come in. It shouldn't take that long. I'm sure you're quite busy down there." He said as he made his way to his own chair and sat down
Breaker 25-Feb-20 11:10 PM
The handshake was indeed returned, the pressure from the strong grip of the Klingon, able to reply in kind when the greeting was extended. "The engineers have been thankfully well coordinated- while there is always work to be done, we are working ahead of schedule currently. While optimal, it shares its own series of errors." Moving into the room at the bidden of the Klingon, the hologram would take efforts to move through the room like a person might, even swiveling his chair in order to give him the ability to sit once the Commander took his station across from him. Once they were both seated, Higgs would continue before the Commander had the opportunity to dive into the business. "There is also a matter of security I would like to discuss with you, but it is also currently non-critical. We can address it once the primary matter has been acknowledged, if you'd like, sir. How many I be of service?"
Nebtadjeser 25-Feb-20 11:17 PM
The burly klingon nodded as he sat down "Well, that is good to hear. If there's any department that can figure out of to fix stuff, it's Engineering." He said, leaning over his desk as he stared at Higgs. He had not known that the man would be a hologram, having mostly skimmed his file as he read it before he'd walk in. "I have received a... Not a complaint per se, but a comment about one of the Engineer on your team from one of my security officers. A certain Lieutenant Junior Grade Pasto Nix. As I'm sure you're aware, we also have a holographic member in our department, Ensign Jayne Walsh. While she assures me the boy is a smart one, he has also messed with the programming of her holo-emitter while she was on duty on the bridge. Now I do not know much about programming and hacking, I will admit, hence why I've called you in. What worries me is not what happened, as Ensign Walsh seems to have forgiven the Lieutenant, but the further possibilities of his actions. Especially considering the fact that you are also a hologram. I would like your opinion on this matter."
Breaker 25-Feb-20 11:28 PM
For the most part, the face of he man remained passive and stoic, as it usually did. At the mention of Walsh, his expression began to shift, and by the time the Chief of Secuirty had finished, the brow of the Chief engineer was furrowed, the photonic follicles bunched on the bridge between his eyes. "Messed with." He repeated. His tone didn't seem to indicate any sort of irritation, though the choice of what the engineer had picked out from this greeting was certainly with purpose. "First, allow me to explain that an engineer tampering with the work procedure of any crewman- hologram or otherwise- is unacceptable behavior. I'm not pleased to learn that such a course of action has taken place. If I can inquire further, sir, would you be able to elaborate on the nature of this interference?" Although he was sat back in the chair, his fingers laced together and rested on the desk of the Officer. He didn't look tense on the outside, but the subroutines that now searched Starfleet database might have suggested otherwise. If the Klingon was able to see such a thing, anyway.
Breaker 25-Feb-20 11:44 PM
A ding sounds on the PADD of the engineer, to which the engineer pulled out briefly to check. A small sigh escaped his lips as he held up a single digit to the Security officer, indicating that he needed just a moment before he tapped his com badge. "Higgs to Engineering..."
The communication ended and Higgs gave a soft sigh and a shake of his head. "My apologies. Perhaps I placed a little too much confidence in some of my staff." The exasperation was punctuated by a pinch to the bridge of his nose before he returned his head upright. "Please, continue."
Nebtadjeser 25-Feb-20 11:51 PM
Kolorf nodded "Of course Lieutenant. Let me just pull out the report." He said as he turned to his console, flipping through the files until he found the correct one and displaying it on the screen "Switched the holo-emitter's color palette to a multi-color one. After being told to stop, made the holo emitter emit glitters around the Ensign." He turned back to Cormac "As I've mentionned, nothing life threatening, or that could pose a threat to the crew, but still a concern for the safety of our systems if they're vulnerable enough for a Junior officer, talented as he may be, to so easily go through."
Breaker 25-Feb-20 11:59 PM
Listening to the report, Higgs would nod a couple times here and there. It was a formality of biological forms to show an active listening process. Although his sensors were pretty much always active, there was no way to display as much without the image doing do for him. "I see," was his initial response, "It is indeed good to know that it was not something more drastic, and that Ensign Walsh had good humor about the dilemma. I'd like to speak with Lieutenant Nix and see what he has to say for himself. With Ensign Walsh not interested in pursuing punishment, I think the Lieutenant has found a stroke of luck. Had this happened off duty, I would advise the matter be dropped, but because systems were tampered with on duty, and after a request for desistance was ignored, I feel it is only proper to, at the very least, offer a spoken warning. Perhaps a reference to a councilor for education on the immoral nature of adjusting a photonic being against their wishes, and outside of their parameters." "Endowed with intelligence as the Lieutenant might be, I find it hard to believe he cannot grasp the concept of manipulating someone beyond their own control. This implies that he either failed to give his actions the proper forethought, or he acted in disregard of the knowledge." His gaze turned back to the officer, meeting his gaze in a steely resolution that comes with the unwavering nature of a program. "What is your opinion on the matter, sir?"
Nebtadjeser 26-Feb-20 12:12 AM
He nodded, listening attentively to the Lieutenant as he spoke "I do agree with at least a spoken warning. While I'm tempted to have him spend a night in the brig for altering a being without their consent, I'm taking into consideration how the Ensign reacted afterward too. As an officer of Starfleet, one expects to receive respect as much as to show respect to their fellow officers, whether they're organic or photonic in nature after all. At the same time, I do know you've recently been outfitted with a new warp core, and to deprive you of working hands would prove unwise for the ship. As such, I would appreciate that you educate the young man on proper handling of Starfleet equipment, and on manipulating photonic beings. After all, I could not think of one better suited for such a task."
Breaker 26-Feb-20 12:27 AM
Higgs head tucked against his chest, his eyes falling down to the desk for a moment as he assimilated the opinion of the security officer. He could say that their feelings were the same on the matter- neither of them wanted to come down hard, but it was obvious that something must be done. Coming to a conclusion, Higgs lifted his head to return his gaze to the Klingon. "I find myself in agreement with your assessment, sir. I just spoke to the crew yesterday on the importance of respect to both equipment and to crew- had this incident happened after my meeting, I might be more inclined to second your recommendation for a night in the brig. As it stands, I believe spending the next week recalibrating and testing the Tactical Unit equipment would give the Lieutenant an opportunity to make amends. Beyond that, I am going to send a note to Doctor Carlisle in recommendation of seeing a councilor. As I have no medical training myself, I will defer to her expertise. If she believes me to be the best one to educate him, I would be more than able to follow suite." Sitting back slightly, the hologram gave the impression of a relaxed image. "Did you have time to talk with me about a matter of security?"
Nebtadjeser 26-Feb-20 12:32 AM
The Klingon rested his chin on the back of his hands, leaning slightly on the desk as he listened to Higgs. He nodded "I could not agree more, Lieutenant. Please do so. And do inform him that this is a one time warning too, as I do not take kindly to people interacting this way with my officers, as I'm sure you do with your own." He said, leaning back on his chair "And of course, Lieutenant. I always have time for security matters."
Breaker 26-Feb-20 12:46 AM
Higgs had little issue jumping directly into the new subject. It was not a display to a lack of attention, but more so his focus on the things that need to be done. "As a department head, I understand that security is very important. I also realize that, as a photonic lifeform, there are certain dangers that come with having the operable routines of my synapse. This could make me susceptible to being disabled, or even potentially compromised. As such, I have devised a set of codes that will override my programming in order to access an emergency protocols. I can generate a code, and forward it to you, thus giving you the ability to circumvent normal security subroutines. Starfleet guidelines suggest consulting you before passing this root code to anyone else, including the Captain. Once this code is generated and sent, it's information will be deleted from my system so that the integrity cannot be compromised. Who else do you believe should have access to this code?"
Nebtadjeser 26-Feb-20 12:57 AM
The Klingon wrapped his fingers together and put his mouth against his fist as he listened to Higgs, frowning slightly. He did not answer immediately, thinking. After a few seconds, he finally started speaking again "I must admit, it is my first time dealing with holographic officers. If I understand what you're saying correctly, you are talking about a code that would... Disable you should your programing be compromised? This has huge implications, I must admit, and I would not grant access this code to many. I do think the Captain should be the only other person who would have access to this code. If you do trust them, maybe your assistant, but I would only recommend this as a last option."
Breaker 26-Feb-20 01:18 AM
Higgs would nod to his response, having had an idea that this might have been what the security officer would suggest. "The Captain seemed like a clear choice, but regulation suggest I consult your position before confirming such things. You understand it correctly; the unique ability to access my subroutines could give an enemy a unique advantage over the things I command, and so it's become protocol to generate an emergency end command, which is to be assigned at the very least to the Chief of Security. I have no intention of allowing my presence on board to cause a threat, and my base access certificates easily bypass many safety protocols in time of emergency. " Higgs would take a moment, not wanting to overload the man with techno jargon. "In essences, it's better to make sure that I can be turned off when I need to be."
Nebtadjeser 26-Feb-20 01:30 AM
He nods "I will not pretend to understand most of what you've said, Lieutenant. Again, engineering and programming are most definitely not my area of expertise. But I do see the tactical advantage of being able to deactivate you should the need arise. I do believe that your programming is constantly being backed up in a redundant system, right? We would not want to lose our CEO should push come to shove."
Breaker 26-Feb-20 01:35 AM
"Once more, your observations do not fail you. My program is backed up every rest cycle so that, assuming the ship systems remain in tact, I should be able to be restored and initialized from the data within the ship. In case of an emergency, there is an emitter that is disconnected from the ship that is holding a redundant version of my programming as well; knowledge I've given to Doctor Carlisle as well. It seemed pertinent that she know how to restore me, given her position as the Chief Medical officer."
Nebtadjeser 26-Feb-20 01:37 AM
"Excellent then. I do believe that we would be better off keeping as little of those security codes as possible, should some of us be compromised as well as you. I would recommend myself and the Captain for now. As time goes by, and if your trust in some other senior officers grow, please do consult me if you wish to grant access to this code to other people."
Breaker 26-Feb-20 01:46 AM
"Of course. Your reasoning, no doubt, is the same conclusion I have come to, and why I have not desciminated any sort of authorization thus far. As Head of Security, I understand it is of critical importance to keep your position in the loop with all actions tagged as security oriented. The last thing I will say on the subject is, once the code has been wiped from my banks, I will not create another until requested. You should have little fear of these access codes being handed out without a great deal of consideration followed by your consultation. I assure you, you won't have to interrupt your duties to sign off on classified codes. It was very important, however, that I consulted you before the prime generation." It was at this point that Higgs would push himself from his seat, offering his hand forward once more to the Klingon. The security chief had exceeded his expectations. With a command of observation and logic, Commander Kolorf had done well to assure the hologram that the security team would see minimal fault, and even less fault tolerance. The clear communication they set forward now meant that Higgs and Kolorf would have a very healthy professional relationship. "It's been a pleasure to meet you, Commander. If there is nothing further you have need of, I will return to my shift. And if any of your teammates detect a malfunction in their equipment, do send word to my team. Glitches will find no tolerance under my protocols."
Nebtadjeser 26-Feb-20 01:51 AM
The Klingon got up from his chair, giving the offered hand a vigorous handshake. "Of course Lieutenant. I am glad you consulted me on this, and I will assure you those codes will not be misused. Please make sure to give the Captain a copy before purging them from your databanks. Should you have any issues regarding Security, please do not hesitate to contact us."
1
Breaker 26-Feb-20 01:57 AM
A moment of shared understanding was had between the two of them in this final handshake. It was firm and professional, just as the ground that both men stood. One photonic, one organic, both with the interest of performing their duties to the highest Calibre possible. Once the grip was released, Higgs would turn and make his exit from the room without further connection, turning in the doorway to make his way down towards the lift, and ultimately, his station. It was my first attempt at handling a problem like that, solo, I tried to find you but I was unsuccessful." (edited)
Nebtadjeser 04-Mar-20 09:03 PM

Captain Syrezeaju 05-Mar-20 11:01 PM
A message began typing itself out to @Nebtadjeser. It seemed to be in complete gibberish, at first; but it seemed like as soon as the station recognised that he was reading it the message began to shift. The cyphertext switched to plaintext and then, when the words had been read, vanished.
Good morning Lieutenant Commander Kolorf, and sincerest apologies if I am interrupting you in any way. I have a concern about an officer under your jurisdiction – one Ensign Jayne Walsh. The Ensign has asked myself – a complete stranger – to alter her programming in order to teach her manners of all things. Furthermore, she hasn’t at all been concerned about the concept of said stranger typing messages to her station. This is rather concerning considering how I evidently have access to her authorisation, including her security clearances, and she should be concerned in general seeing as how it is a security breach. I would have thought that a hologram would be a bit brighter. Then again, she is rather lacking in lines of code… I thought you deserved the heads up. Yours, A friend at Starfleet Intelligence.
Nebtadjeser 05-Mar-20 11:08 PM
Kolorf heard his station -that he had just turned off nonetheless- powering up. With a sigh, he walked back to his desk and sat down, looking at the screen. His frown deepends with every lines of text read on the screen. Starfleet baktag intelligence. They were always trouble. He started typing, having absolutely no doubt that his text would reach the agent
To whomever you are. Your concern is duely noted. However little this may do, I shall inform our Commanding Officer that the ship under scrutiny by Starfleet Intelligence. Thank you. Lieutenant Commander Kolorf.
Captain Syrezeaju 05-Mar-20 11:09 PM
Your commanding officer is aware. He and I are good friends... It is your own department that you should worry about. And that bridge crew. How unprofessional... Yours, SI.
Nebtadjeser 05-Mar-20 11:11 PM
The Klingon rubbed his tired face with one hand as he sat back. qeyliS he was beginning to miss that miserable island. He got up and walked out the door.
Nebtadjeser 05-Mar-20 11:28 PM
He walked in, leaving the door open behind him. At this point, he should probably move his bed down here, considering the amount of time he spent in this office. He sat down, and stared at the Ensign.
Lieutenant Jayne Walsh 05-Mar-20 11:28 PM
She sat down, not saying a word.
Nebtadjeser 05-Mar-20 11:30 PM

Lieutenant Jayne Walsh 05-Mar-20 11:30 PM
"And why would that be?"
Nebtadjeser 05-Mar-20 11:31 PM
He pulled the first message on his screen and turned it so that the Ensign could read the entire thing. He leaned on his cross fingers, staring her down
Lieutenant Jayne Walsh 05-Mar-20 11:33 PM
She put a hand to her face. "Idiot" She mumbled. "I should have known better..... I just wish I didnt have these emotions interfering with my work..." (edited)
Nebtadjeser 05-Mar-20 11:36 PM
"Getting rid of emotions, Ensign, is a surefire way to not do your job correctly. We need to protect people, and without empathy, we cannot do our tasks." He sighs again, turns the screen back his way "I will assign you to patrol duty for the next week. Actual patrol duty, not monitoring the security systems from the bridge. I want you to walk amongst our crew, be part of them. No dematerializing unless there's an emergency either. Use the turbolifts and the hallways. And you will attend my seminar."

While this is good news, we have been informed that her illness was not natural, but most probably a bioweapon engineered by a fellow Starfleet officer named Dennzen Zoyill. While we do not currently have empiric proof of this, I would like you all to double your vigilance, and to keep both eyes open for signs of illnesses in your fellow officers. If you find yourself feeling sick, do not hesitate to notify me or one of my Assistants, and to head to sickbay immediately. I would rather we have fewer officer for a shift than having one of my officer toy with their lives. If you have any suspicions or concerns, please do feel free to seek me or your ACOS out. Lt. Nebtadjeser 01-Apr-20 05:41 AM
Kolorf shook his head. "No. The accusations made against her Sir. Now we know that those against Commander Zoyll were proven true with his confession. But it was also said that his memories were altered, by his own work. Is it our only proof on both accusations?"
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 01-Apr-20 05:45 AM
"It seems that way, though there might be more. There isn't much that I do know for now; there will be a report by ensign King in the morning, hopefully with all the necessary details. I'd be able to supply you with a better answer then."
Nebtadjeser 01-Apr-20 05:51 AM

Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 01-Apr-20 05:52 AM

Nebtadjeser 01-Apr-20 05:59 AM

He sighs again. "I will communicate with ESD Security and will have the prisoner transferred tonight, Sir."
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 01-Apr-20 06:01 AM

Nebtadjeser 01-Apr-20 06:04 AM

Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 01-Apr-20 06:07 AM
"Of course. You did your best Commander in my judgment. Don't worry." He managed a smile - an exhausted one. The Kelpien looked extremely tired overall - sagging shoulders, hunched posture. "Spacedock security can have him in the morning; I still have the Tiersen's captain and crew to notify."
Nebtadjeser 01-Apr-20 06:08 AM

Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 01-Apr-20 06:10 AM

Nebtadjeser 01-Apr-20 06:18 AM

Lieutenant Jayne Walsh 21-Apr-20 01:52 AM

Lieutenant Jayne Walsh 22-Apr-20 10:00 PM
Jayne had re-entered her temporary office and sat down with some paperwork on her desk, writing was definetly Devak's as he was always the one to write on pen. Looking through his notes there were entry's, or moreso plans on how to improve his work. Page by page she was discovering the schematics of soo many other "Holograms", or at least, thats what they looked like. But as Jayne looked deeper into the schems she found the certain codes and detailings of android types or "synthetics". Each page had that code, including hers. "So this was his final work, the end of my mysteries, this is what I was supposed to find. But why wasnt I designed to be the final product." She questioned her thoughts and decided to look further into his files that Captain Stone gave her. The paper showed a lot of messy handy work, pages stained with what looked like a terran coffee, ink spreading to the portion that it was spilled on. She could figure out the words on a peticular page that intruiged her. It was what described his final day, his final entry. The rest was just death papers and information of his so called "legacy". The page read "The virus had spread, couldnt be controlled, or so they thought. Whatever has infected me, has turned me into some sort of monster. I must be stopped for the safety of the rest of the crew. My final project will be 7-8KB, if the new activation sequence works then she will be a fully functioning hologram with physical capabilities, if this doesnt work. Then the crew of the Ramshaw will perish. To whoever reads this, please carry on my legacy, be the one to finish my projects." She read further in, the virus was really something that couldnt be named, there is no information on it. She looked at the bottom of where it was signed and read the last message"This isnt a virus, this is a monster. I am a monster. Signed Lieutenant Devak of the USS Ramshaw"
"Damn, Dash was right. This man was very secretive about his work." She tapped her panel

This hologram" She pointed to herself, her finger phasing into her chest as she tried to touch it "Is just the innards that need a shell to protect itself. Now I need someone who can help me."

Lieutenant Jayne Walsh 23-Apr-20 01:21 AM
"Well first, to answer your question. Several years ago the USS Ramshaw was subjected to a new type of disease/Virus or whatever you would call it, unheard of in the medical industry. Nobody knows what it did, nobody knows how it happened or where it came from. It ended up killing half of the crew before they could cure it. The only way to cure it was to kill the host of the virus. Lieutenant Devak managed to find a way to contain the Virus, but it backfired and it mutated his body slowly, until he became one with the virus and began to kill innocent people. Before he turned, He had a choice to make, and that was to skip the process of turning me into an android, and instead, into a hologram... to Kill him and save the rest of the crew." She sighed, she was learning something new every day, even though her memories are still foggy about those events. "His last note was to carry on his legacy, finish what he started. He is my creator, I have to follow his wishes and pursue this." (edited)
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 23-Apr-20 01:23 AM

Toilet Sponge 29-Apr-20 10:45 PM
#deck-fourteen-hallway
Captain Syrezeaju 17-May-20 03:03 AM
[D] A ping for @Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen.
Good afternoon sir, and sorry to bother you. I'd firstly like to thank you for all but rescuing me from the corridor the other day - I don't think I would have made it up to medical without your assistance. Secondly, I've been thinking about the presence of security officers on the civilian decks during a red alert. I'm aware that someone has to be down there to ensure that they're alright/staying in line, but security seems... Rather imposing, don't you think? I was wondering if we could perhaps come up with a system in which the counselling staff might be sent. It would establish a better relationship between ourselves and the civilians, free up your own staff for deployment elsewhere around the ship, and would mean we counsellors were able to help more in a crisis. Let me know any thoughts you have, sir, and thank you again. Best, CPO. Eshen'strars Houston, counsellor.
KardasXRT 17-May-20 04:47 PM
He walked into the office and sat down behind the desk, typing up his training plan.
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 17-May-20 04:56 PM
[D] Ezran typed out a reply to the counsellor as soon as he got a free moment.
Hey there patchy,
>
Thanks for the suggestion, I'll have a look into it during the next security breifing, it certainly sounds like a good idea, I'll run it past Tarn and Jayne.
>
Also, give me a shout if you need rescuing again, I'd be more than happy to come a running.
>
Best, Ezran Ch'evhalen, COS.
