Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 30-May-20 11:25 PM
Hearing the call for away team participants, Ezran signed out of his console and headed out of the office
3
Noxxious 22-Jun-20 10:11 AM
Entering the office, she sat down in front of the desk, hands folded neatly in her lap. Hopefully this would go down well. Or not. She'd just have to see.
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 22-Jun-20 10:37 AM
Around 5 minutes later than he was actually meant to arrive, he entered the security office. He still looked rather sleepy... As he walked around he took note of her emotional aura she gave off... "Ensign Verne." (edited)
Noxxious 22-Jun-20 10:38 AM
"Commander." The poor hybrid was still rather scared of hom, though it'd died down some now. "I-I guess I'll start at the beginning of it all?"
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 22-Jun-20 10:39 AM
He nodded and sat down at the desk opposite her. "Take your time, Ensign. The floor is yours."
Noxxious 22-Jun-20 10:43 AM
A nod. For a start she brushed aside the black locks of hair that hug in front of her forehead, revealing it to be ridgeless, unlike a typical member of the species she presented as. Not that her hair color didn't give it away beforehand. "I'm half human, sir. I was born with... a couple of birth defects. I had constant headaches and couldn't use my antennae cos my brain couldn't process them, I'd feel cold all the time. Like, intensely cold. Being born in Laikan city didn't really help. I had to wear quadruple thick winter coats everywhere. As you can imagine the other full-blooded Andorians around me didn't always take it so well." (edited)
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 22-Jun-20 10:48 AM
"I can imagine, Ensign. Sometimes Xenophobia does happen, and these days hybrids seem to the one who take the most of it. They're an easy target normally. Somebody who doesn't fit into either category, usually they can be hated by both species."
Noxxious 22-Jun-20 10:52 AM
"Nah, humans didn't hate me. My girlfriend is human as you know," She flashed him a watery smile. "Uhm. Anyway. So there was this Aenar chaan called Kishri in my class and a bunch of his friends who had it out particularly bad for me. They'd laugh at me, push me around sometimes, steal my jacket-" She choked up at the memory and curled up some into herself - the memory hurt. A lot. 16 years on. "-toss snow on me..."
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 22-Jun-20 10:53 AM
"Bullies then, taking their anger out on somebody easy to pick on." He said, still listening carefully to her story.
Noxxious 22-Jun-20 10:57 AM
"Yeah. So... I was about ten. I put up with this sort of treatment quietly. Y'know? Andorians and Aenar alike are warriors. We stand up for ourselves, right?" A long pause. "Um. We were at the Alliance embassy at Laikan. School tour. It was about lunchtime? cha Kishri and two of his Aenar friends took me off to the side and stole my jacket again, then dumped snow on top of me while laughing at me and calling me names and I-" She broke and began to cry, burying her face in her palm. (edited)
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 22-Jun-20 11:00 AM
Ezran was no councillor... But over the course of his lifetime he had spoken many the difficult conversation. He held his hand out across the table... "It's okay, Ensign... Keep going. I know this must be hard for you." Ezran could feel the emotions given off by her, her aura was practically weeping as much as she was... This was clearly an entire childhood of bad memories.
Noxxious 22-Jun-20 11:03 AM
It was a few more minutes before she pulled herself together sufficiently enough to continue. In telling her story she'd opened up a proverbial Pandora's box; something she did only to Maggie. And look where having it at all had taken her. "-I just cried. It was so smothering, so cold, snow dripping down my skin and everything and this whole time there was just laughing and laughing and this sort of squeezing on my brain kindofandIfeltsoafraid-"
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 22-Jun-20 11:11 AM
"It's okay to be afraid, our fears help define who we are as a person, but it's overcoming those fears, that helps build you into a better person. In your case, a crippling fear of Aenar probably isn't the best way to live your life, Ensign." He said, trying to stay calm and help the ensign through this.
Noxxious 22-Jun-20 11:13 AM
"Yes sir." She nodded, antennae drooping to the floor. "I-I know this is wrong. I can't keep on like this. But.... I'm sorry. It's just something that's stayed with me for so long. I have nothing against you, sir. I'm sorry it sort of all came out those few days ago. I was in shock and scared and and-"
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 22-Jun-20 11:16 AM
"I'd like to hope that particular stressful situation with Lieutenant Roode was a one off, but let's not forget you are a tactical officer. You are meant to be able to handle stressful situations, I hope that your failure to do so on this occasion was simply because of the nature of the attacker being your partner."
Noxxious 22-Jun-20 11:16 AM
"It was, sir. No more lapses. Just the way she acted and everything, just-" She shook her head. "It was so sudden."
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 22-Jun-20 11:21 AM
"I understand, Ensign. I want to see evidence that you'll be visiting a councillor from now on, for at least the next few months to work out your childhood trauma, I want to see you back to working at full capacity once both yourself and Leiutenant Roode are fit and able to do so." He said with a nod. "And I hope I never see a security report with your name on it, if I find out anymore unjustified hostility towards my species, and I'll have you brought up to the captain. Understood, Ensign?"
Noxxious 22-Jun-20 11:21 AM
"Yes, sir." Yep. There it was. But it was a decent step in the right direction at least.
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 22-Jun-20 11:24 AM
He nodded. "Thank you for taking time out of your busy schedule to speak to me about this. I accept your apology for the previous incident, and hope that we shall have no further incidents in future." He gave a smile, it was fake, but she probably wouldn't be able to tell, Ezran was good at concealing his anger. "I'll see you later, Ensign Verne. Enjoy the rest of your day."
Noxxious 22-Jun-20 11:35 AM
"There'll be none, sir." She stated with a smile before standing and walking out. If anything his antennae gave his feelings away. Kind of.
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 22-Jun-20 11:36 AM
Well, that was that problem dealt with... Hopefully she would get the help she needed from here on out.
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 22-Jun-20 05:05 PM
Ezran had beenwl working for a few hours here in the office since Shar left, going over security reports. Once he heard the call for people to go a protect the president. He figured this wasn't an opportunity he was going to get to pass up, it was after all, his job for 11 years of his life. He stood up quickly and headed out of the security department.
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 23-Jun-20 01:30 AM
Ezran sat down at his desk, and brought up some paperwork to do whilst he waited for the JPO to arrive.

The Junior stepped in, hands behind her back and shoulders squared out of respect for the commander. “Junior Petty Officer, Breda Nowe. Reporting as ordered, Sir.”
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 23-Jun-20 01:36 AM
"At ease, Junior. Please take a seat. This isn't a formal call, and you're not in trouble."
Rabbit 23-Jun-20 01:37 AM
The Officer sighed out of relief. She casually slipped into a chair. “That’s a relief sir. So what’s this about then, if you don’t mind me asking?”
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 23-Jun-20 01:39 AM
"First, I'd like to ask you a few questions. Ominous, I know. But I need to judge you before I can make you any offers." He said with a smile. "Is that alright with you?"
Rabbit 23-Jun-20 01:40 AM
She was confused, but tried not to show it in-front of her commanding officer. Offers? What sort of offers? “That’s fine sir.”She nodded.
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 23-Jun-20 01:42 AM
"Alright. First question. How are you enjoying life aboard the Phoenix?" He said with a smile.
Rabbit 23-Jun-20 01:43 AM
“Well..I’ll be honest sir, it’s not what I was expecting. This ship and it’s crew seem to have been through hell. I haven’t exactly integrated myself with it yet, but I believe it’s only a matter of time..”
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 23-Jun-20 01:45 AM
"Well, I do apologise for having such a hectic ship." He said, with a light chuckle "But in all honesty, I think you're doing a great job in this department."
Rabbit 23-Jun-20 01:47 AM
“Thank you sir.”She nodded, finally matching his smile with a polite one of her own. “I’m just trying to make this ship safer.”
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 23-Jun-20 01:48 AM
"You perform your duties well, and make an excellent addition to any security team. Your paperwork I've seen from you is also kept to a remarkably high standard..." He said, flicking through said security reports on his desk terminal.
Rabbit 23-Jun-20 01:51 AM
“I just like to keep things thorough. You can’t protect the ship if reports are missing the most important parts of information.” (edited)
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 23-Jun-20 01:52 AM
"Well, you show amazing potential, Junior. I'll give you that." He said with a smile. "You got many friends onboard, or even within the department?"
Rabbit 23-Jun-20 01:54 AM
“I’ve actually made one. She seems like a nice person. In fact you might even recognize her yourself.”
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 23-Jun-20 02:08 AM
"Yeah, who's that?" He said with a smile.
Rabbit 23-Jun-20 02:09 AM
“Ms.Verne, we met in the arboretum.”
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 23-Jun-20 02:10 AM
"Oh. Her." He said, smile fading slightly. "Is she nicer once you get to know her?"
4
Rabbit 23-Jun-20 02:13 AM

Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 23-Jun-20 02:14 AM

Rabbit 23-Jun-20 02:16 AM

Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 23-Jun-20 02:23 AM
"Sorry, I really shouldn't drag you into this. Back to the questions." He said with a nervous chuckle "Does this job satisfy you? Or do you wish you could have a little more responsibility one day?"
Rabbit 23-Jun-20 02:24 AM
“I’ll have to go with the second option on that one sir. Although being a security officer does indeed satisfy my lust to be important. I’d like to go on to captain my own vessel someday.”
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 23-Jun-20 02:27 AM
"Captain is quite the step up from JPO... You'd have to work your way up quite far. How would you like to take on an additional reponsibility for this department? In addition to your regular duties, that is."
Rabbit 23-Jun-20 02:30 AM
“Well, as long as it takes to reach captain, I’m ready to take that step. But right now I’ll focus on my responsibilities. What did you have in mind sir?”
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 23-Jun-20 02:31 AM
"One of our Intelligence agents, Copernicus and Lt Walsh have decided we need a liaison between our two departments."
Rabbit 23-Jun-20 02:35 AM
“So a translator?”
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 23-Jun-20 02:37 AM
"Somebody who can communicate between our departments, somebody who can pass and receive messages between our two departments, and help build inter-departmental relations." He said with a smile.
Rabbit 23-Jun-20 02:40 AM
It took the woman a moment to realize that he was offering such position to HER. She blinked taken aback. “And you want that person to be me sir?”
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 23-Jun-20 02:41 AM
"Yes, I know your only a JPO, quite literally the lowest rank a Starfleet officer can hold. But that doesn't make you any less of a capable officer, I think you've got amazing potential, Junior."
1
Rabbit 23-Jun-20 02:43 AM
“If you’re offering me the job sir, then it’s one I’ll be glad to take. Does this mean I’ll have to switch to Intelligence?”
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 23-Jun-20 02:44 AM
"No, you'll be the security side of the Liason. You'll still work under security, and wear Operations gold. And you'll still perform your regular security duties when you're not working for Intelligence."

Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 23-Jun-20 02:47 AM
"You'd miss us too much, huh?" He said with a smile. "I'll forward your file to the Intel duo and they can read you over. They may want to have a interview like this with you as well, so they can check you out. But I'm sure you'd be great for the position."
Rabbit 23-Jun-20 02:49 AM
“It’s a tremendous honor sir, you won’t regret having me for the job.”She said with a smile.
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 23-Jun-20 02:52 AM

Rabbit 23-Jun-20 02:54 AM
“Yes sir, is this role temporary?”
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 23-Jun-20 02:55 AM
"For now, just to see how it goes. If you do a good job, I don't see any reason we couldn't keep you around as a permanent position." He said with a reassuring smile.
Rabbit 23-Jun-20 02:57 AM
“Ah. Well then if that’s all sir, I’ll get some much needed sleep.. it’s been an eventful day.”
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 23-Jun-20 02:58 AM
"That'll be all, yes. Enjoy your sleep, Junior. We all deserve it after the last week. Goodnight." He said with a light smile.
Rabbit 23-Jun-20 02:59 AM
She gave him a nod. And stood up. “If you need someone to talk to sir. My door is always open.”
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 23-Jun-20 03:01 AM
"Since when were you a counsellor, Junior?" He said with a chuckle. "Also what door? Since when did you have an office? You're just confusin' me here kid." He said, giving her a smile. (edited)
Rabbit 23-Jun-20 03:03 AM

Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 23-Jun-20 03:05 AM
"I'd like to think so! Leaving your door open all the time would be a security risk. I'd like to think you'd know better than that." He gave her a smile. "Again, goodnight Junior. I'll see you again when you're on duty."
Rabbit 23-Jun-20 03:07 AM

Jawbreaker 17-Jul-20 12:40 AM
Brunhilda walked into the office, peering around. She cleared her throat as she entered, clicking her heels together and clasping her hands behind her back as she stood straight. "Lieutenant Brunhilda, reporting for duty. I apologize for my lateness..." she gave the officer a very small smile, followed by the Vulcan V in her right hand. "I am looking for the Chief Security Officer I presume?"
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 17-Jul-20 12:43 AM
He smiled up at her from where he was working away at his console. "Lieutenant Brunhilda, it's a pleasure to meet you. Please, take a seat."
Jawbreaker 17-Jul-20 12:46 AM
Brunhilda nodded, bowing her head slightly, putting her hands on the back of her thighs, down her legs, patting her knees, before crossing her legs. "No handshake? I was preparing myself for one. Shame... It's a unique experience," she stated, tilting her head to the side for a second. "Not that we have to, of course, but... I enjoy unique experiences. I take it you do not care for my tardiness? My last commander did. Early to bed... Early to have your toes licked by your dog, as... He enjoyed to say, for reasons that elude me to this day," she suddenly recalled, shaking her head to clear her mind of the mystery. "... Hopefully I will not take that inquiry to my grave and resolve it one day."
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 17-Jul-20 12:52 AM
Ezran merely paused for a moment, looking slightly confused at whatever the woman had just said, before brushing it off with a smile. "I do not mind your tardiness, Lieutenant. You are here now." He held out his hand to her. "If you think a handshake would be appropriate, then I shall oblige."
Jawbreaker 17-Jul-20 12:56 AM
Brunhilda bowed her head gratefully, and gave a firm, very deep handshake. "Not appropriate, but... Interesting. Vulcans have quite heightened senses. Touch can become quite overwhelming. I have trained myself to a degree that I can handle a bit. Practice makes perfect, after all," she explains, patting the top of his palm. "... Ouch. Anyway. So, have you had a chance to look over my Security records? They are suitable, then."
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 17-Jul-20 01:01 AM
"If your security records weren't suitable, I wouldn't have accepted you as my ACoS now, would I lieutenant?" He said with a smile. "They are more than suitable enough."
Jawbreaker 17-Jul-20 01:05 AM
Brunhilda's microscopic smile returned. "Hence why I concluded and asserted as such. A preclude to any inquiries you might have... And my own curiosities which are probably none of my business but I am nevertheless interested in. So, to avoid further niceties: what duties do you expect of me, in detail? Is there a bone fracture quota per aggression? Or was that also a peculiarity of my old commanders? Some could be quite exacting, you see," she asked, genuinely confused. "Quite odd in retrospect but I aim to please." (edited)
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 17-Jul-20 01:12 AM
"Your duties will be outlined on your PADD. I've got a very comprehensive list of things I compiled for my previous assistants. And as for uh, bone fracture quotas? We don't do that here." He said, looking even more confused at this point. (edited)
Jawbreaker 17-Jul-20 01:13 AM
Brunhilda cleared he throat. "Of course. From what I understand about the ship's record, you see quite a bit of action. Not as much as the Normandy, but... Well, I suppose I could use a bit of a break," she said, nursing her scar.
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 17-Jul-20 01:18 AM
He chuckled. "Our ship records don't do the ship justice, there's a lot of stuff that this ship has been through. Your Normandy doesn't even begin to compare, there's a serious amount of things this ship is responsible for that you can't read in the federation news."
Jawbreaker 17-Jul-20 01:23 AM
Brunhilda felt a tingle in her fingers... Actually smiling for once. A blank smile. Quite... Creepy and out of nowhere. Unfiltered, unrestrained joy... There one second, and gone the next. "... Um. That sounds quite... Challenging. Yes. I very much enjoy a challenge," she nodded... She looked at her boots for a second. "... I relish, a challenge, sir. I have craved it for a while. I am an effective Security operative... Highly effective. I swear before you and Starfleet, I will be the best Security officer you have ever seen."
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 17-Jul-20 01:29 AM
"Well, I shall certainly strive to provide that 'challenge' for you, Lieutenant. Go away and have a look over the list of requirements I have for you, if it's not comprehensive enough, I'll easily find more work for you to do."
Jawbreaker 17-Jul-20 01:41 AM
Brunhilda bowed her head, this time serenely and slowly. "I would be most grateful. I want nothing more than to serve Starfleet... Anyone less demanding than my mothers is quite suitable," she said, tilting her head, and patting her knee once. "Anything else, Commander...?"
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 17-Jul-20 01:43 AM
"Not at the moment, Lieutenant. If you have any issues feel free to bring them to me. But work on that list of requirements, it's mostly duty rosters and patrol assignments. You should be used to those by now."
Jawbreaker 17-Jul-20 01:47 AM
She smiled, humbly small. "Aye, sir. Live long and prosper," she crooned as she stood and marched out the door, reaching into her duty satchel. "Greetings, PADD... Tell me your secrets," she murmured to her old friend.
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 17-Jul-20 01:57 AM
He looked away from the woman, going back to work, left rather confused and puzzled by the whole encounter. Hopefully she would be less confusing or concerning in future.

Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 19-Jul-20 11:50 PM

Ensign S'vrk Syllak 19-Jul-20 11:55 PM
The Ensign entered the same way, walked to a similar pace as the last time and stopped exactly at the last place he had last time. "Commander. I have instructions to deliver, from the Captain himself." he told the superior, well, with the same tone he had last time.
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 19-Jul-20 11:56 PM
"Take a seat, Ensign. I'm all ears." He said, motioning for the man to sit down opposite him.
Ensign S'vrk Syllak 20-Jul-20 12:00 AM
"Aye, Sir." He would have told it while standing, but as he was asked to sit, he did so, seemingly not any less straight than before. He then began to recount word for word what the captain had said, with no mistake.
Ensign S'vrk Syllak 20-Jul-20 12:26 AM
"The Captain informed us a man had been killed in the stellar cartography laboratory just a day ago. The killer is still on the ship. He told us that he needed surveillance from that night. We would provide all of us with the current timeline of when the body was discovered, which was delivered to every console accordingly as he said so. Surveillance from that entire night and days before must be reviewed. As well as looking for any security breaches within the Jeffries tubes, computers, or cameras. He needed as much surveillance as he could get around here. All cameras should have eyes on them at all times and should be checked out' if they are tampered with or anything is abnormal with them. He asked everyone to be on their guards when patrolling. Officer Breda asked if we were authorized to use force when dealing with the predator, to which he answered that in the case we find them, which he stated is unlikely, we are allowed to use enough force to apprehend them accordingly, before reminding that any use of excessive force will be reprimanded. He then informed us that, in the files that he had sent us, he had also listed out their several skills and our current suspicions. If he could have perhaps one or two of us beginning narrowing down suspects based on what we find on surveillance, it would be extremely helpful. Finally, he demanded that we informed our superiors of the assignment and that, if anyone doesn't have work to do, you put them on the case, before he walked out. That is all, Sir." he finished. The whole thing was delivered as he was just telling a grocery list. (edited)
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 20-Jul-20 12:30 AM
The man nodded along, listening to everything the officer had to say. "Very well, Ensign. Message received, I'll put out a security notification at once. Have the team start reviewing security footage and logs. I want reports filed and sent to me as soon as anything suspicious is flagged. Please CC the captain into any security reports so he's informed of any updates."
Ensign S'vrk Syllak 20-Jul-20 12:34 AM
"It will be done as such, Commander." He stood once Ezran was done but did not make any move to leave, as he was not yet dismissed. "Anything else, Sir?"
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 20-Jul-20 12:50 AM
"Nothing else, Ensign. Thank you for bringing this to my attention. Dismissed."
Ensign S'vrk Syllak 20-Jul-20 12:51 AM
Syllak nodded briefly before leaving the office.
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 20-Jul-20 10:17 AM
Ezran stood up and stepped out of the office.
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 20-Jul-20 11:31 AM
Ezran was sitting back in the office again, staring blankly down at his monitor deep in thought...
Lt. Cmdr. Dev Clark 20-Jul-20 11:32 AM
A small knock along with the 'whoosh' of the doors resounded. Kun entered with a dip of his head, mostly a sign of respect, before sitting down at the opposite chair. "What's going on?"
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 20-Jul-20 11:38 AM
"Myself and Lieutenant Tarna have just finished up with Commander A'aerhel and her questioning. I wanted to consult you on how it went."
Lt. Cmdr. Dev Clark 20-Jul-20 11:40 AM
"Please and just to preface- I really don't think we have to worry about her having done something." He then motioned for him to go on.
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 20-Jul-20 11:43 AM
"Me neither, Captain. But it's my job to investigate these things." He nodded. "Lieutenant Tarna will file you the official report, but I would like to give you the more immediate summary first, so you can have time to think on things before you read the report." He looked up at the captain. "Now, I doubt that Commander A'aerhel would have actually done something like this, but from experience, She is a fully capable individual, and at present is our prime suspect. Given her... unique history." (edited)
Lt. Cmdr. Dev Clark 20-Jul-20 11:46 AM
"I entirely understand that and I've.. I've realized that raises suspicions on her." Back leaned back into the chair, hands clasped. "I also realize that while we need to view all our options, I trust her to know that she should be ruled out of the investigation."
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 20-Jul-20 11:50 AM
"Captain, you know we can't rule anyone out. No matter how unlikely they may be. I trust the commander as well, but romulans are as we all know, known for their deception... Not to make any assumptions of course." He sat back in his chair too, with a sigh. "Shall you bring up her profile or shall I? It's a bit more... legal if you do so."
Lt. Cmdr. Dev Clark 20-Jul-20 11:52 AM
"I know we can't, but this just doesn't seem right. His eyes had narrowed in on what the Commander had said but didn't comment on it, he need cooperation right now - not anger towards each other. "Did Lieutenant Tarna tell you that the only evidence there was a ripped piece of fabric from a Tactical slash Command uniform? You and I both know that a skilled killer wouldn't just leave evidence like that there, it was planted." "I've got it-" Reaching over the desk, he tapped at Ezran's console to bring up the Commander's personnel file. (edited)
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 20-Jul-20 11:55 AM
"Well, that's the only evidence you guys found. I however have personal experience with the commander, outside of work. I know how much of a trained martial artist she is. I've also personally witnessed the commander snapping both the bones and necks of training holograms with no sense of remorse or regret about it, like it was second nature to her." (edited)
Lt. Cmdr. Dev Clark 20-Jul-20 11:59 AM
"No, no, no. I'll be blunt with you, Ezran, I really could not care less about something like that happening. She's got her own stuff going on internally but she would never, take it out on one of her own crew members." His jaw was almost locked into place, unmoving. "You aren't even listening to me-" Ah, Kun, what happened to not butting heads. "-One, like I said, no skilled killer would just leave evidence there. Either one, they're toying with us by giving us that info, or it's planted to get us off track from his non existent trail. Second, even if we are to consider the Commander in this situation, it's far too risky for her to do something like this. Too many eyes on her, too easy of a target." "If we're going to catch whoever did this, we need to think like them."
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 20-Jul-20 12:02 PM
He nodded. "Yes Captain, however doubtful it may be that the Killer is actually from the tactical or command department, that doesn't exclude them from suspicion. It could just as easily be possible that whoever performed this murder messed up, and made a mistake... Even the most skilled killers can still leave behind evidence." (edited)
Lt. Cmdr. Dev Clark 20-Jul-20 12:06 PM
"I didn't rule it out, I gave two very likely outcomes of which division the killer could be from. And for all we could know, it could very well be a civilian that did this as well." Teeth click, a cause of him trying to stop himself from grinding them together. "Whether he messed up or it didn't, we have a list of what were looking for. Strength, ship knowledge, computer software expertise, robotics expertise."
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 20-Jul-20 12:08 PM
He nodded. "Of course, Captain." He tapped his monitor and pulled A'aerhel's profile up to full screen. "Perhaps you should take a look see how many boxes of yours the Commander ticks..."
Lt. Cmdr. Dev Clark 20-Jul-20 12:13 PM
That’s when his brows furrowed, he wasn’t angry? But was? At the same time? In one fell swoop, he hit the power off on the console. “I’m not going to do this, Commander. I don’t know that’s gotten into you, but I’ve already cleared her. So stop inciting her like she actually did it.” For the man who was almost always cheery, a sudden flick to this was a bit unpresidented. “If you want to talk suspects? Let’s talk suspects - not accuse people.” (edited)
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 20-Jul-20 12:16 PM
"Commander A'aerhel is a suspect, Captain. If you had let me continue my point, I would be able to explain to you my reasoning behind my suspicions. Are you going to let me do my job, or are you going to let your emotions for your crew get in the way?"
Lt. Cmdr. Dev Clark 20-Jul-20 12:19 PM
“Are you going to consider other people? Or make it rain down on my First Officer?” He shot back, leaning back into the chair while crossing his arms once more. With a single hand he motioned for him to go on, tongue pressing into the lower section of his cheek.
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 20-Jul-20 12:25 PM
"Many other people are already being considered, Captain. I've got my entire available security team working on this at the moment, it's of utmost priority to all of us." He tapped the console again, bringing up her profile, even without Kunzo's authorisation. "Commander A'aerhel is an ex-Tal Shiar agent. Now, I don't know how well informed you are about their organisation, but you don't just get to be an 'Ex-Tal shiar agent'. That's not how this works, the Tal Shiar would kill you the minute you thought of defecting. But of course, there's mention on here of 'another older order' within the Tal Shiar." He looked up at Kunzō across the desk. "How informed are you about the Zhat Vash?" (edited)
Lt. Cmdr. Dev Clark 20-Jul-20 12:30 PM
His gaze flickered from screen to man speaking to him. “I’ve got a brief bearing of it, nothing extensive” Kun merely responded. The other parts didn’t shock him, he had read through this before, he had to.
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 20-Jul-20 12:41 PM
"Around 10 years ago, I was on an escort mission for the president, they were meeting an ambassador from a species of synthetic lifeforms. They had recently reached out to the federation for support. During the meeting with these synthetic lifeforms we was attacked. We were attacked by a group of highly trained romulans." He paused to let Kunzo take this all in. "It wasnt until after that encounter, until more information about them became known to us. The Zhat Vash, are an ancient order of the Tal Shiar, dedicated to destroying all traces of Synthetic Life. They're a organisation of android killers."
Lt. Cmdr. Dev Clark 20-Jul-20 12:45 PM
The Captain had only fallen silent for just a moment, that, explained a lot of what he saw on the outside. Stop- you’re getting yourself off track. “Commander, would you like to inform me of what race the first murder was?” A single brow was raised. “And next, did you ask her about.. any of this in questioning?”
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 20-Jul-20 12:52 PM
"The first murder rightfully mentioned, was of an human, but the cause of death matches her particularly fighting style... The second death was also a broken neck, and she would know exactly how to take down an android." *He paused." "And no, Captain. I did not bring any of this information up during questioning, as I should not officially have this information, and due to the presence of Lieutenant Tarna'Motlan, I did not be mention any classified information."
Lt. Cmdr. Dev Clark 20-Jul-20 01:00 PM
“Next time, you send Tarna out and tell her that you’ve been given authority to this info” he began. “See now, I want you to follow my thought process real carefully on this one - because clearly you haven’t before. I’m a killer, and I’m trying to make sure I get away with the crime of killing two people. So when I kill these two people, I kill them in a fashion that is only used by me - I stab them forty-seven times. Oh but! In my records, when I was working for another job, I was known to always kill by stabbing them forty-seven times. If you looked in my record you’d know this. So why in the name of the Divines would I use that method if it’s so traceable to me?” “You’re not thinking right, Commander, this is what our killer wants to think. They want us to waste our time and turn on our own people before we ever get a chance to catch them.”
1
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 20-Jul-20 01:07 PM
"Because when killing an Android, you don't have many options, Captain. She's trained to take down androids with a swift snap of the neck. When confronted with an android you have to kill, its entirety possible that you default to the method you know to work." He stated calmly. "And it's not evident from her file that she was Zhat Vash, or anything about her martial arts training. I only know all this information about the commander through research. Not a simple glance at her profile."
Lt. Cmdr. Dev Clark 20-Jul-20 01:20 PM
“Fine, keep her on the suspect list, hell, you know what. Confine her to her quarters,” His eyes were dead set on Ezran. “Confine her, and you can watch as another one of my crew members dies. Thank you for the concern, please continue on with the investigation as you see fit.” It sounded completely polite even if that’s not the message that came across. With not a second to spare, Kun was walking straight out the door.
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 20-Jul-20 01:31 PM

Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 20-Jul-20 01:44 PM

Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 20-Jul-20 01:54 PM
"Come in." He said, he didn't sound as cheery as he usually was.
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 20-Jul-20 02:02 PM
Stepping through the door, the Kelpien's expression was one of someone who'd just rolled out of bed - literally. Heck, if he could have bed hair (which he would have had had he had any hair) he would've. Other than that though, somehow he'd managed to get into uniform just fine. "Commander. If I may get straight to the crux of this meeting?"
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 20-Jul-20 02:06 PM

Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 20-Jul-20 02:21 PM
"They found a scrap of red uniform on the body. As for them being strong, both victims had their necks snapped." He looked up at Dunamis. "Where have you been during the last 12 hours?"

Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 20-Jul-20 02:34 PM
"Alright, we'll look into that. I want you to keep an eye on your department and report anyone suspicious."
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 20-Jul-20 02:36 PM
"I most certainly shall - beginning immediately after this conversation. Are there any names that I might do well to keep an eye on?"
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 20-Jul-20 02:48 PM
"You would know better than I, Commander. It is your department after all."
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 20-Jul-20 02:53 PM
"Of course. Then I suppose I ought not to dawdle further - have there been security measures put in place? Such as refraining from travelling alone?"
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 20-Jul-20 02:55 PM
"The majority of the ship are still unaware. We don't want to cause any widespread fear or panic. But there is a murderer on the lose, keep your most senior and trusted members of tactical informed if you must, but be aware that they could also be the murderer we're looking for."
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 20-Jul-20 02:57 PM
"To the contrary I believe they deserve to know - somehow. We need to... communicate." Reasoning born out of his own failure to do that, perhaps, when in the captain's chair. "But in a way which advises caution rather than breed suspicion. The longer we leave them unaware the more people will fall victim, I feel." (edited)
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 20-Jul-20 02:58 PM
"Of course people need to be informed, but at the same time, we have a harder time of finding the murderer if they are aware we are onto them."
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 20-Jul-20 03:05 PM
A low growl started deep in the Kelpien's throat - clearly he did not quite approve of this course of action or the circumstances surrounding it, and his emotional aura reflected thusly. Nonetheless he would reluctantly accept it. What else could they do. "Indeed. I shall be judicious as to whom I inform about this."
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 20-Jul-20 03:06 PM

Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 20-Jul-20 03:08 PM

Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 20-Jul-20 03:08 PM

Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 20-Jul-20 03:10 PM

Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 20-Jul-20 03:14 PM

He paused... 'she was safe enough to work on this ship.' Yet she was his prime suspect in these murder investigations... Maybe she wasn't as safe as he once thought.
5
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 20-Jul-20 03:20 PM
"Merely curious, that's all. Strange as though it might seem, despite her origins I am quite willing to place my faith in her - even against our circumstances. But thank you - I'd best be going..." (edited)
4
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 20-Jul-20 03:22 PM
He nodded. "Indeed, goodbye commander."
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 20-Jul-20 03:23 PM
He barely cracked a smile at that as he stood and loped out the door.
Captain Syrezeaju 20-Jul-20 09:07 PM
In most Federation customs and cultures, listening in was generally deemed to be rather rude. It was why she stayed out of most things, trying her hardest to ensure that she did not overhear anything which would rather go unheard. It likely was not the same here as it was on Romulus... But when the conversation was about yourself then you naturally had to listen. For a chief of security, Ch'evhalen did not value privacy too much. He did not have any form of audio distortion field placed upon his office. It had not been difficult to exit the security hub via this door and leave her PADD there within the bookshelf, set to record and send a live feed to her account. Logging in only across the hall in security's footage office had not been difficult. It enabled her to listen in upon every word said. It was rather pleasant and surprising to hear that Captain Kunzō was still willing to defend her despite their brief argument a few days prior. Ch'evhalen's attitude, though? It was appalling... And if she had been a more emotional person, she would have thought that it hurt. Paranoia and fear and suspicion were perfectly understandable. It would have been concerning if people were not suspicious of her; if they knew her file and knew how she fought - as the Aenar did - then of course you would filter her in as a suspect. What frustrated her was his constant attempt to hone in on her past. Yes, she had conducted horrible things. Yes, she was trained to destroy any form of synthetic life by any means necessary. Yes, she was dangerous, yes, she still harboured resentment towards those life-forms now... But she was trying to be different. She was trying.
The fact that Ch'evhalen knew so much was also rather disconcerting. She listened in on his tale, recounting how he had fought with her elusive order before. Of course he had - that had likely further bolstered his career in service to the president. The more you knew about the enemies of the Federation, the better prepared to defend people you could be. What... What really, well and truly perturbed, angered, downright upset her was the fact that Ch'evhalen had been 'researching' her all this time. That had been his word choice; 'researched.' She had finally opted to put her trust in him - the first person in forever, perhaps. She had given him sight, she had treated his shoulder and made him tea and he... He had used her. It should have been expected. She was a fool for not seeing it until now. Her desire to change had gotten in the way of her logic, refusing to think that there may be something nefarious behind the Lieutenant Commander's attempt to become 'friends.' She was trained to be better than this. People could never be trusted, friends could never be made, and perhaps she would never change from the ideals she had right now. Oh, there was a deep desire to. All she wanted was to brush away the past and learn to develop, creating some sort of new life... But Ch'evhalen had showed that it was impossible.
What was even more difficult was the fact that she understood. His concerns were more than valid. Had their positions been reversed she would have been paranoid about it, too. The prospect of her being a sleeper agent was even more horrifying, something that made even the seasoned agent shudder. The points he raised were more than worthy of consideration... How she had been allowed to leave the Tal Shiar, how she had not been hunted down since. Despite her best efforts - and the realisation all those years ago that murdering synthetics had brought more harm than good to her universe - despite her efforts... That revulsion was still there. It was something she could not shake. Was that why? She was a sleeper agent and had been all along, destined to continue to carry out the Zhat Vash's work but not even being aware? The prospect nauseated her. Kunzō had stopped talking and then left. Dunamis had stopped talking and then left. Finally... Ch'evhalen was alone. Slinking through the corridors she all but appeared at his doorway, a sudden imposing statue-like figure standing in the arch, blocking the path out. Her anger would be kept in check. The man had betrayed her trust... She would not waste any further emotion on him. ...She would try not to, at least. Even she had the capacity to feel. "So, Commander. I hear I am to be confined to my quarters." Her tone was perfectly neutral, somehow. Inside, however, it was like a continued world of hurt.
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 20-Jul-20 09:11 PM
He looked up from his workstation with a shocked impression, not even hearing the door open, just hearing her speak. "I- Commander. I didn't hear you come in. You've got me slightly off guard." (edited)
Captain Syrezeaju 20-Jul-20 09:20 PM
"I do not believe that matters," she stated rather coldly and crossed the distance to stand in front of his desk, easily covering the space between in a matter of strides. "Am I to be confined to quarters, yes or no?"
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 20-Jul-20 09:26 PM
"Well, I was planning on spending time considering how to word it. But yes, for the time being. I assume you've spoken to Commander Kunzo? Either that or you've bugged my office." He said, looking up at the woman.
Captain Syrezeaju 20-Jul-20 09:34 PM
With purposeful strides she all but marched over to his bookcase and plucked the PADD from amongst dozens of training manuals. It was held up in one hand for a moment before she folded her arms across her chest. "You are not particularly observant for a man who once served on the presidential guard."
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 20-Jul-20 09:38 PM
"And you're still as deceptive as ever, despite being a respectable Starfleet officer now. Do you not trust me, commander?" His eyes followed her across the room. "Don't let my conversation with the Captain taint your opinion of me, the man was rather getting on my nerves."
Captain Syrezeaju 20-Jul-20 09:46 PM
"Why should I trust you, Lieutenant Commander?" She replied, crossing back over to his desk once more. If Ch'evhalen had been standing then there would have been no chance for it, but at present, the general impression was of her looming down upon him. "Captain Kunzō's conduct was acceptable. Your own, however?" She had told herself she would remain emotionless. It had evidently already fallen through. "I was most amused by your comment - that you have been researching me."
7
10
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 20-Jul-20 09:57 PM
He looked up at the woman, he didn't seem fearful or shocked that she was angry with him. "Of sorts, Commander. Perhaps research wasn't quite the right word to use, more just general intrigue. You should have known this though. I've been interested in you since you came aboard this ship. This is not new information." (edited)
7
Captain Syrezeaju 20-Jul-20 10:02 PM
His lack of a response only angered her more. Had he nothing to say for himself? The conniving bastard! "You did not express that your interest extended beyond becoming 'friends,' as you put it and into exploring my past. Speaking with me was just an attempt to learn of my personality and attitude, sparring with me was in order to gauge my skill and ability. My past does not define me - but apparently, you are more than content to believe that it does. To think I was content to work on changing my ways - perhaps to even establish some pretty form of 'friendship' with you - that mistake repulses me."
7
5
5
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 20-Jul-20 10:08 PM
"I- A'aehrel, I think you're getting the wrong impression from all of this... I've been spending time with you because I find you interesting. Not dangerous. If I thought you were an actual threat to this ship I wouldn't be confining you to quarters, I'd be sending you to the brig." He sighed, looking up at the woman. "I don't believe that you could have done anything like this, at least not consciously. What Captain Kunzo did not get the chance to hear from me is the possibility that if it was in fact you, then you wouldn't personally be behind it."
Captain Syrezeaju 20-Jul-20 10:18 PM
There was a moment of complete silence. A'aehrel did not comment in any way. She did not even move, glare fixed on the Aenar... And when she did speak, it was rather clear that she was not convinced. "You fought awfully hard to convict me, Commander, for someone who believes that I am innocent."
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 20-Jul-20 10:23 PM
"What I believe Commander, is that you may be behind these murders, you fit quite well into this whole investigation. But, as this ship usually is, I'm choosing to believe you did not consciously commit these murders. The woman I know may have a dangerous past and a rather deadly set of skills, but she hasn't shown me any real reason to believe she'd murder the crew she's trying so hard to integrate herself into. If you'd please sit down and give me a moment to explain my reasoning. I'm hoping you could be more reasonable than Captain Kunzo as to my theories, rather than just blatantly denying any possibility." He stated, motioning for her to sit opposite him, with an almost pleading expression.
Captain Syrezeaju 20-Jul-20 10:32 PM
Another rather lengthy moment of silence. She did not take a seat like requested, but instead inclined her head. "You may continue."
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 20-Jul-20 10:42 PM
He nodded and spoke up once she was ready. "You know the most about your past, Commander. Was you being truthful with me about any gaps in your memory? If you have been influenced in some way to commit these murders without your own knowledge... It would be helpful to prove your innocence." He paused, to let her contemplate her answer. "If these murders were not you, then it's also rather clear that the real killer wants evidence to point towards you as a way to frame you, hence why I'm not accusing you of anything, or even placing you under arrest."
Captain Syrezeaju 20-Jul-20 10:58 PM
"Yes, I was being entirely truthful. There are no such gaps in my memory, no instances of blackouts or forgetting how I traveled to a location, nothing of the sort." But was it true? Was there something she hadn't noticed? "I am not a sleeper agent, nor am I a part of these murders in any way. You also have no idea if the actual murderer, or murderers, are purposefully trying to frame me. It may be coincidental."
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 20-Jul-20 11:03 PM
"Well, if you are behind these murders, we'll know once we confine you to quarters..." He looked down at his console. "It's not ideal, I know. But we'll make sure your work isn't inhibited by your confinement." He looked up at her. "Are the Zhat Vash or Tal Shiar known for using sleeper agents?"
Captain Syrezeaju 20-Jul-20 11:13 PM
"...The Tal'Shiar have been known to utilise that method as a form of deep undercover work, yes." There was no point in withholding the truth. She despised the prospect just as much as Ch'evhalen did. What if he was right? All this time she might well have been carrying out their work, completely unaware...
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 20-Jul-20 11:15 PM
"I too despise the idea as much as you do, I can tell you're conflicted by it, I can sense the emotions coming off you. But as much as you hate it, you think there could be a real possiblity, right? You've seen all the evidence."
Captain Syrezeaju 20-Jul-20 11:29 PM
There was an increased urge to begin tapping her foot off the floor. "Yes, Commander, I agree that it may be a possibility."
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 20-Jul-20 11:40 PM
"So, you understand my concern then. And why I agree that perhaps confining you to your quarters until we can confirm your innocence may be best. You know that I mean no ill intentions with this, I'm only looking out for the crew."
Captain Syrezeaju 20-Jul-20 11:52 PM
"Your... Insistence upon me being the prime suspect was merely frustrating." It still was. Everything was frustrating right now, from his attempts to backtrack on his comment about research, to her being accused of being some sort of puppet for the groups she used to work for. Was Ch'evhalen being truthful? Was this just him trying to find out the truth behind the murders and protect the rest, or was it some sort of personal vendetta? The latter would make sense; he had fought their order all those years ago... She didn't want to think about it. She couldn't think- no, no, no. None of this was true. It was all fine. She wasn't still working for them, controlled or not. Ch'evhalen was just doing his job, and- "I shall see myself to my quarters. Confirmation shall be sent once I am there, Commander, and you may remotely lock the doors after me. Good day." An incline of her head and she left within seconds; seemingly desperate to get out, head now reeling. (edited)
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 20-Jul-20 11:56 PM
He nodded, and spoke after her. "Thank you for being so cooperative, commander." He waited for the door to close behind her before letting out a deep sigh, and putting his head down on his desk, deeply upset. This woman meant the world to him, and his dedication to his job and his crew means he might have driven the two of them further apart. He hoped he could one day work on fixing the distrust between them. But that would have to wait until this murderer had been brought to justice. (edited)
Captain Syrezeaju 21-Jul-20 12:42 AM
You may now lock the doors to quarters 2.A, Deck 8.
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 21-Jul-20 12:44 AM
He raised his head when his console pinged out. He typed in his security code, allowing for the quarters to remotely lock themselves. He then typed back.
Thank you for your cooperation, A'aerhel. Again, I'm terribly sorry about all this.
 (edited)

Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 22-Jul-20 09:45 PM

Lieutenant Jayne Walsh 22-Jul-20 09:58 PM
Attached Medical File Denoggre-1
Stardate 93716.56 The USS Gallant crew was sent to mine a huge crop of Dilithium on Signus IV, however the attempt to mine the dilithium was risky Signus IV had large readings of CO2 buildup just below a layer of thin denzinite ore, covering the planet. The Away team, consisting of: Lieutenant Junior Grade Claymore Gorge a Stellar Cartographer who had descovered the planet prior to the Gallant arriving. JPO Atad a science officer who ineffectively scanned the planet, not accounting for the buildup of CO2. Lieutenant Ramirez, a medical officer assigned to accompany the away team as the mission was proved to be dangerous to to the rocky terrain. Ensign Antonio a Warp engineer who was minin the dilithium crops for the warp core to function properly (Extra note: was the one who contacted Lieutenant Gorge about the need for dilithium) Cadet Denoggre: Accompanied Ensign Antonio due to a suggestion and confirmation from the Captain that he should learn how to mine the Dilithium properly
>
The away team was transported down infront of the dilithium crop and was sent to mine the crop as quickly as possible. But, due to the pressure of the CO2 building up underneath them, time was of the essence. A phaser was used in the procedure which caused the layer of Denzinite to burst, causing the entire area around them to burst aaround them, huge vents of Burning CO2 emmissions flooded the area and Cadet Denoggre was seriously injured. In a quick decision the away team decided that Denoggre was a lost cause and they should get back to the ship immediatly.
>
From known information, Ensign Antonio tripped and fell face first into a CO2 vent, causing the burning air to melt her pupils and destroy her cornea.
>
Cadet Denoggre was found 1 day later by the USS Andromeda who was scouting the area when they picked up a distress call from his beacon
>
He had serious lung damage, 3rd degree burns. Leg was amputated.
5

Scarlet 26-Jul-20 10:13 PM
[D] There came a chime at the door. Then another, followed by a quiet 'oops'.
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 26-Jul-20 10:13 PM
With a slight raised eyebrow, the Aenar called out to the visitor. "Come in, its open!"
Scarlet 26-Jul-20 10:15 PM
Beaming, she entered, expression not sheepish in the slightest. Selara's hair was all but dry at this point, and the gym bag slung across the woman's shoulder seemed to be of no hardship to lug around. Overall, she looked unsurprisingly content. "Hello, Sir. Lieutenant Selara, recent transfer. I hope I'm not interrupting anything!"
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 26-Jul-20 10:18 PM
"Oh, nothing much Lieutenant. I was simply working on some paperwork." He looked up with a smile. "Take a seat."
Scarlet 26-Jul-20 10:21 PM
She obliged, but only after a prolonged moment stood bouncing gently on her heels. Depositing the bag beside her, Selara tossed blonde hair over one shoulder and shifted within the seat to become comfortable. "Oh, good! I was just at the pool," she elaborated, feeling it only polite when he had alluded to his paperwork. "It's very big. Awfully nice, we didn't have one on the Starbase, see."
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 26-Jul-20 10:26 PM
He nodded and slyly brought up her file on his desk. "You transferred from Starbase 902, Correct?" He said, looking up with a smile. "How was your time aboard the Starbase?"
Scarlet 26-Jul-20 10:31 PM
"Correct," she affirmed, balling her hands into her lap so as to keep from visibly fidgeting. "It was a lot of work, but very interesting. I suppose I grew restless after some time, sat in one place, even with all the activity down on Kesprytt."
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 26-Jul-20 10:35 PM
"It means you will have had plenty of experience before, what with such a difficult workplace. Would you say you performed your duties well onboard?"
Scarlet 26-Jul-20 10:42 PM
"Oh, yes," Selara chimed nonchalantly, then reverting into a state of slight sheepishness. "I mean, yes. I believe so." Still, her smile remained bright. "It took some getting used to, being so directly involved in conflict, but we always put a quick stop to most of it."
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 26-Jul-20 10:48 PM
"You're a very confident individual, Lieutenant." He smiled to her. "That's an important trait I like to see in my officers, if you're to take charge in an emergency, you need confidence."
Scarlet 26-Jul-20 10:52 PM
With patent relief, she sat upright in the offered seat. Any slither of doubt upon Selara's delicate features had been duly thwarted, their absence finalised with a firm nod. "Thank you, Sir. I look forward to meeting everybody, I have heard that the team is incredibly diverse."
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 26-Jul-20 10:54 PM
"Diverse, yeah certainly. Aenar, Jem'hadar, Android, Vulcan, Bajoran and now an Edo. Diverse indeed, Lieutenant." He paused for a moment, having a think. "Dont your species have a certain history with their criminal justice system? Why security?"
Scarlet 26-Jul-20 11:05 PM
"Mhm." Another nod, softer than the last. It appeared she was capable of toning it down, if a necessity. "As I suppose you're aware, Rubicun III is considered a 'pleasure planet' of sorts to visitors. Visitors from everywhere, who consider our system to be enlightened. Meeting them, spending time with them led me to question why, which got me interested in the workings of alien systems, and so on. My parents are both mediators, too, so I like to think myself quite familiar with the concept of law enforcement."
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 26-Jul-20 11:39 PM
"Well, I'm glad to hear it, it's rather important in out line of work. I'm sure you'll get on just fine."
Scarlet 27-Jul-20 12:04 AM
"I hope so, Sir." She smiled, a sincere gesture as she regarded the appearance of her new boss. The width of his shoulders alone alluded to Ezran's prioritising of fitness. Selara supposed she would come across him in the gym for sure.
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 27-Jul-20 12:42 AM
"Do you have any questions for me?" He inquired, looking back at the woman with a smile.
Scarlet 27-Jul-20 01:11 AM
"Not that I can think of," she replied honestly, full lips pursed in a pensive little pout. "Well, one thing, perhaps, but I don't wish to overstep any boundaries, Sir."
3
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 27-Jul-20 03:02 AM

Scarlet 27-Jul-20 10:00 AM
“Okay,” she started, enthused again. “I was simply wondering if you had an interest in sport, Sir? I apologise if you think my asking untoward in any way.”
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 27-Jul-20 10:01 AM
"No harm in asking." He chuckled. "And not at all, Lieutenant. I don't know what would give that sort of impression."
Scarlet 27-Jul-20 10:07 AM
Selara laughed rather than allow the situation to become awkward, swaying in her seat slightly. “Again, you will have to forgive me for my observation, but you appear to be very fit physically. Fitness regimens between species have always fascinated me; they are ingrained in the society from which I come from, and a conscious choice within others.”
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 27-Jul-20 10:09 AM
"Well, your observations would be correct. Fitness is very important for security officers, it can be a very tiring job sometimes, we need to make sure we're always at our best! I assume you take care of yourself? You look to be in excellent physical shape as well."
Scarlet 27-Jul-20 10:13 AM
“I do, Sir, and have tried to maintain a similar level of activity I would have exerted on Rubicun III since leaving.” Another laugh, more nostalgic than the last, and the Edo found she could relax in her seat. “Much to the dismay of my old medical peers, I think.”
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 27-Jul-20 10:15 AM
"As long as you don't go overexerting yourself here, the medical team have enough on their plates usually." He said with a smile. "But I'm glad you take care of yourself. I'll probably see you in the gym at some point in that case."
Scarlet 27-Jul-20 10:17 AM
“Yes!” She blurted, evidently needing no time at all to warm to the idea. “I’ve yet to visit, actually. The pool was of more intrigue to me, since I’ve never had one before. On a posting, I mean. Not, like, a personal—. Yes, I hope to see you in the gym!”
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 27-Jul-20 10:19 AM
He chuckled and nodded. "Perhaps I could show you some time, I could also give you a tour of the ship if you'd like, if somebody else hasn't already offered. It's important for my officers to know the layout of the ship well."
Scarlet 27-Jul-20 10:31 AM
“Oh, I would love that, Commander!” And she would, evidenced by the brightening of her grin and return to a bolt upright position. That hadn’t lasted long. “I’ve already been offered a place as a, uh? Morale officer—? But, no tour thus far, so I still honestly have no idea where I’m going.”
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 27-Jul-20 10:33 AM
"Well, I'll see if you have time later in the day for one. Once I've finished my list of things I need to do." He nodded to her. "I should probably let you go now."
Scarlet 27-Jul-20 10:35 AM
“Yes, likewise,” she blurted, jumping up from the seat with a brisk nod. Smilingly, the Edo reached for her discarded duffel and shot the Aenar a lopsided grin. “Thank you again, Sir! I look forward to getting to work.”
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 27-Jul-20 10:36 AM
"And I look forward to seeing you perform said work, I always look forward to seeing new officers in action. And you certainly look like a promising one, Lieutenant. I'll see you later. Let me know if you'd like that tour."
Scarlet 27-Jul-20 10:43 AM
“I will! See you later.” It was some feat for Selara to stop herself from reaching across the desk. ‘Thank you’s were awfully repetitive, and there was nothing like a hug to demonstrate gratitude. Similarly, there was nothing quite mortifying as embracing your non-Edo boss upon introduction, and Selara had learned that the hard way. Opting to shoot Ezran one last grin, it was with a two-fingered salute that the tall blonde finally left his office.
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 27-Jul-20 10:44 AM
He smiled as she left, and turned back to his paperwork again.
Lieutenant Jayne Walsh 27-Jul-20 08:57 PM
[D]The door chimed immediatly after Selara had left, someone was waiting.

In this time, that isnt suitable for a ship of this stature dont you think? The Captain has already requested for us to be refitted with new members and I completely agree. Unless you have some objections?"
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 27-Jul-20 09:36 PM
"I've already met some of our new staff, I agree they would make excellent additions to the team."
Lieutenant Jayne Walsh 27-Jul-20 09:38 PM
"I have also noticed a change in command. The intelligence officer of unknown origin has been granted the rank of First officer, how odd." She said, in discontent and disbelief. An intelligence officer? being the XO of a starship after only working there for a couple weeks, this would not end well. "That is a risky move."
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 27-Jul-20 09:42 PM
"I can assure you, Lieutenant. Commander A'aehrel is a perfectly fine candidate for XO, she's been thoroughly vetted by myself for any possible security threats, and I insist she's no risk." He said looking up at the woman. "Do you believe otherwise?"
Lieutenant Jayne Walsh 27-Jul-20 09:44 PM
She checked the security logs under the file of Commander A'aehrel, she has already been confined to quarters for suspicion of murder. "Everything has been filed here I assume. I still do not agree with the decision, however your judgement is better than my own." (edited)
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 27-Jul-20 09:55 PM
"The murder investigation was purely just for safety. Nobody believed the commander was actually behind the murders."
Lieutenant Jayne Walsh 27-Jul-20 09:57 PM
"From another persons perspective Commander, one completely oblivious to the events that took place on this vessel. This isnt something that one should see when it comes to a person who is apart of the chain of command. Wouldnt you agree?" (edited)
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 27-Jul-20 09:58 PM
"Her past isnt relevant to her performance ability on this ship, she's a more than capable officer, and as far as we're concerned poses no threat to the safety of this vessel."
Lieutenant Jayne Walsh 27-Jul-20 10:08 PM
"That didnt answer my question. Peoples pasts are relevant Commander, it helps decide whether or not they are suitable. Hell, imagine if I an Android came to you and some of my reports had said I had been suspected for murder? wouldnt you be concerned?"
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 27-Jul-20 10:20 PM
"I'm sure plenty of people have been falsely accused of murder in history, doesn't make them any more dangerous than the next person. We've got a lot of highly trained indiviuals onboard, I'm sure they're all fine."
Lieutenant Jayne Walsh 27-Jul-20 10:31 PM
A lot of training, of course. The fall back excuse to cover something up. Her suspicion grew only slightly. Was the Commander excusing the first officer in some sort of bias? why didnt he have the same exact concerns as she did? this is all too weird to just brush by. But in the moment, it doesnt matter, he is COS. "Very well, I am sure are officers are the finest of the fleet. You dont have to tell me twice" She smiled, although she couldnt help but feel like it was a fake smile, as it always was.
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 27-Jul-20 10:54 PM
"Is there any further concerns you'd like to bring to me? You are my assistant chief so you concerns are, as always, very much valid." (edited)
Lieutenant Jayne Walsh 27-Jul-20 11:23 PM
"No sir, that is all that I have. Is there anything else I should know about?"

"If that's all Lieutenant, I have a meeting with the captain to attend with. We can have a meeting another time." (edited)

Jayne was used to the dust however, the cluttler and the explosions of rubble were all the same to her. It was just "mess". TO: Lt. Cmdr. Ch'evhalen FROM: Cmdr. ShiKahr DATED: 98183.53 CHANNEL: X97V01-Encrypted MESSAGE: At stardate 98177.19 a communications breach into our internal messaging system was noted. The following images display the messages sent. While the perpetrator did not seem to pose a threat or act hostile in any way, this has still revealed a breach in our system. Internal diagnostics show that a break in through our computer was not conducted; communications relays have not managed to ping the message back to its source. Please be aware of a potential breach and continue an investigation if at all possible - we must remain vigilant in case of a further break-in. If you have any further questions please do message me. All consoles are removed as well. The brigs replicators are designed to provide plastic cups, hard rubber plates and dull plastic utensils to prevent any self harm. Your holodeck training will start with the handling of prisoners, so that you can wrap your head around what type of people you can, and will deal with in your career as a security officer."
