Lt. Cmdr. Dev Clark 18-Aug-20 07:05 PM
“Did something else happen not added in the report?” He questioned as they entered, choosing to stand rather than sit. He wasnt exactly sure what was up.
Lieutenant Jayne Walsh 18-Aug-20 07:19 PM
"I have not filed a report Captain, not yet. I was busy with other things. However, I dont want people to think that the Commander was about to maim me. I had everything under control and I knew what I was getting myself into. That is why I volunteered, knowing full well that she would have done worse to living officers." She sat down, at her desk, swiping her PADD. "As you are well aware, it was quite the suprise to hear of the Commanders recent promotion to first officer. To think that she came on board this ship without us knowing why exactly, and then a week later she gets promoted. I decided to look into it and found no evidence of my own." "However, after my break, I was greeted by a disturbing message regarding her being confied to quarters for the suspicion of murder. It piqued my interest immediatly upon reading that message. I began to wonder why exactly, so. I decided to investigate. Reports came in and I studied her interactions with other officers and I noticed she had a distasteful bias against synthetic lifeforms. Her presence in the holodeck would allow me to test my theory. I wanted to see how far she would go without me urking her on. How far she would go to end my life, the signs were pretty obvious. The hand placements, the sudden burst in movement as she tried to strangle me. In my mind, those actions proved my point that she is not capable of being the first officer. She endangers the lives of many with this example."
Lt. Cmdr. Dev Clark 18-Aug-20 07:43 PM
Kun had been listening silently, calmly, and with full respect o the officer who sat in front of him. "I want to be very frank with you, Lieutenant. Commander A'aehrel is more than capable of being our First Officer. Could probably do much better than me as Captain in some areas. But I'll very clearly explain to you why she acted the way she did. Which, will stay between both you and I less the Commander decides this becomes public information." In one fell swoop, he took a seat across from the woman, placing both hands neatly on the table - one over the other. "First off, you pointed out that she was confined. While it was an... off accusation - it was needed. A'aehrel ShiKahr is a former Tal-Shiar agent. Now, it's quite known that the Tal-Shiar doesn't just let their agents go. Not without killing them or forcing them to their bidding." "Commander Ch'evhalen brought to light that there was a chance Commander ShiKahr was a sleeper agent. An accusation that has allowed the Commander to realize that many, many of her behaviors and decisions were being influenced by Tal-Shiar conditioning. In fact - right after the threats of destruction of New Romulus, she came to me almost immediately to explain what had been going on with her" he paused for a moment, taking a deep breath as he continued. "She came with the notion that she could be removed from duty and that she was going in for a full psych evaluation with medical." "That, was all until the events that transpired in the holodeck. If you couldn't despite Ensign Maleb's concerns and warnings at the time, the Commander was not herself nor in the right headspace. So while the superior in the room snacked on goodies, your life was put at risk. I am not excusing her actions, mind you. I'm telling you all of this so you have context on the situation."
Lt. Cmdr. Dev Clark 18-Aug-20 07:51 PM
There was another long pause after this. His eyes lay cast down as he was seemingly deep in thought. For just a moment, he held his breath before releasing it. "I... I chose the promotion for Commander ShiKahr as my partner on this vessel because not only is she an extremely capable officer, I believe people can change." It was then that his gaze went back up to meet Walsh's. "I put her on this ship because I put my trust in her. And that trust is still there. But right now, she's falling further and further down the traps the Tal-Shiar has laid in her mind. You've seen what they can do, you saw the destruction that happened just earlier." There was little he could add on. With all that has happened, with the direct choice from A'aehrel not to go to medical first, Kun still was foolish enough to believe... to trust that she was still good. That she could be good. "Look, Walsh, Jayne, you don't know how... Sorry I am that you were at the brunt of this. I wish I could tell you that it won't happen again but until I speak with the Commander and make sure she's getting the help she needs - I can't guarantee anything but the fact that I am trying my damn hardest right now to keep things from falling into shambles."
Lieutenant Jayne Walsh 18-Aug-20 08:04 PM
"I understand where these apologies are coming from. However I want to reassure you that there was no harm dealt to me. I am an android, I dont feel pain. Therefore I cant share the same reactions as others. Part of me wishes that people didnt have to apologize and just accept that it was apart of my duties. I was conducting my own investigation, I knew the risks and I had taken them. I did what was best for the crew." She stood up for a moment, to get some artifical blood pumping to her legs-metaphorically speaking-. "Imagine the consequences, if Sa'val or any of the other members went through the process that I did. They would be severe. I did take malebs concerns into account when going into the whole thing. In fact, I knew as well as everyone else about what was happening with the commander. In that moment, I saw her conflicting mind. She had something that she needed to get off of her back." "What I did was the make or break for the commander. I drew the line for her to cross and all she had to do was decide on whether or not she should cross it. Maybe now, after the realization sinks in, the commander will have second thoughts about what she really wants to do with her life."
Lt. Cmdr. Dev Clark 18-Aug-20 08:12 PM
"And yet, you still went on with it. You didn't try to help, you, you made her worse" "What you did, was reckless, unnerving, and risky. If you had a concern about the Command on this ship - you should have come to me. You should have stopped the sparring and helped the damned woman." This time, Kun stood. "You pushed her off an edge she was teetering on, an edge I was trying to get her away from. If you saw her conflicting mind - you should have done something than keep her going." "I don't think you realize and maybe it's because you don't understand." The words came out unusually harsh from the normally kind Captain. "She didn't choose to cross that line. She was conditioned to, forced to. What you did? Lieutenant? What you did is you opened the door with the handle on your side. She would have never opened that door had it not been for you. And for that, I can with all my might say you were not doing what was best for my crew." "I don't ever, ever want to hear you running your own little 'investigation' like this ever again. You come to me when you concerns, you don't go around acting like the Captain around here. And if I hear you pull anything of this sorts again, I'll have you removed from this ship before I even think about removing the Commander. Is that clear?" There wasn't a raise in his voice, it was completely leveled, but it did not take away from the fact that he wasn't happy with what she had said at all. "And clearly, you haven't been listening to me. If you were listening - you'd understand the context I'm putting to this situation. You of all people should know how much I care about this crew, and A'aehrel happens to be apart of that crew as well." (edited)
Lieutenant Jayne Walsh 18-Aug-20 08:20 PM
"Very well captain. But may I ask you a question?" She asked, wanting to get one last thing off of her chest.
Lt. Cmdr. Dev Clark 18-Aug-20 08:22 PM
“Of course, ask away,” A soft exhale of air released from him. Shoulders still placed in their rigid form ever since this morning’s reports. His jaw slowly unlocked from it’s harsh placement.
Lieutenant Jayne Walsh 18-Aug-20 08:27 PM
"You told me that you were helping her, and I understand where you were coming from. But what if she had kept all of those harsh feelings bottled up? What if she kept on waiting, walking by people she hated until one day she couldnt take it anymore? This is coming from a person who yes doesnt understand the situation, but is also concerned for the safety of the crew. I understand your judgment and I take full responsibility for my actions." "I have to go through this with brigmates every time they come through the door. There is a certain ammount of trust that you can put into one person and it cant be too much. Because if you do put all of that trust into them, they are bound to pull the wool over your eyes. She is a starfleet officer, I understand that. But like you said, there were suspicions from the start." (edited)
Lt. Cmdr. Dev Clark 18-Aug-20 08:34 PM
“I don’t want to think about the ‘would have’ or ‘could have’. It didn’t happen. We don’t need to worry about it - we are... lucky that there were people who cared enough about her to stop this before she did something truly irreversible.” “I am not as, naive or foolish as at times - I can be made out to be. I am an excellent judge of character and when I know I can trust them - I trust them.” A hand slipped the bobby pin from his sleeve and up to his hair. “The only people who are bound to-“ he began as he finished pinning the strands of hair back. “Pull the wool over your eyes, are the people you chose to wrongly trust. That - will almost undeniably not happen when you choose correctly.” A final pause occurred. “And if we were to play with the possibility of something happening, I would have taken the blame either way.” “Was that all, Lieutenant? Ive still got time to spare if there’s anything else.”
Lieutenant Jayne Walsh 18-Aug-20 08:39 PM
"That is all Captain. I am sorry for my lack of judgment, I promise that will not happen again." (edited)
Lt. Cmdr. Dev Clark 18-Aug-20 08:40 PM
“It’s -“ Oh don’t do it “It’s alright,” Oh my Divines. “It happens, we all slip, it’s whether we learn from it or not.” Shoving a hand into his pocket, he turned out of the office. “See you,”
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 25-Aug-20 11:35 PM
Once leading the woman through to the security office, he made sure to lock the door behind them, for one to prevent her from quickly escaping if she did decide to turn against him, but mainly for privacy. The Aenar had a lot to confess to the woman, and if anyone was to overhear or walk in, it would make things rather awkward especially given how she was not supposed to be there... He moved across the room, and turned to face the woman, leaning up against his desk, trying to seem as calm as possible, but despite the attempt he was still incredibly nervous. "A'aehrel, we've shared some good times aboard this vessel, and some particularly nasty times as well. I'm sorry that our friendship was so short lived, and I'm glad we seemed to reconcile said friendship towards the end. It pains me deeply to think this is the end, and that I may never see you again." (edited)
Captain Syrezeaju 25-Aug-20 11:43 PM
In typical fashion she had stood there, observing his actions including how he locked the door. That was... A gesture that she certainly had not anticipated. She would have held her hands behind her back as always but with them cuffed in front of her all she could do was keep her back perfectly straight and visage as Vulcan as possible as she listened. It was... surprising, to hear him speak of that, even despite their previous conversations. He was glad that they had been able to reconcile, and... Out of nowhere she felt tears spring to her eyes. What had happened to the Vulcan act? They were blinked away rather swiftly, swallowing thickly and hoping her voice didn't sound any different. What was wrong with her? Starfleet had made her soft. These constantly contradicting emotions were not fun. "I much regret this too, Commander. While our friendship did take a rather difficult turn I am glad that, at the end, we could see eye to eye. I appreciate all the help you have given me over these past two months."
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 25-Aug-20 11:57 PM
The man gave her a sad smile in return, seeing her so upset made his heart drop, but part of him new she was not tearing out of entirely sadness, but out happiness as well, that he had said such comforting words despite everything... "I'm incredibly upset that our friendship has to end so soon, I've met a lot of people during my career, and a lot of bad people. But I know you're not a bad person, you're not a criminal. You're a good person deep down, A'aehrel... It's just the circumstances which lead you to where you are today have not been kind to you. I certainly hope from the bottom of my heart that we do meet again one day, hopefully in much better circumstances." The man smiled, more fully this time but still filled with the same level of sadness... His attachment to this woman was far deeper than he once thought and she could probably tell from the way he reacted to all this that it was tearing him apart at the thought of having to hand her over to Starfleet security.
Captain Syrezeaju 26-Aug-20 12:24 PM
There was the customary incline of her head, forcing herself back to that Vulcan attitude before she made a complete and utter fool of herself. Internally of course it was a complete contrast, far too emotional for her own liking. How amusing it was that the security officer would be telling the murderer that they weren't truly a criminal. It just felt rather contradictory, but at the same time, it also said a lot about Ch'evhalen's perception of her... That she was not the one to blame, merely a victim of the regime. "And I hope so too, Commander," she managed to reply after a moment of silent contemplation. "While my time aboard this vessel was not particularly long at all, it has been a pleasure working with you and the rest of the crew. And while things certainly took an... Unfortunately downturn, I shall endeavour to remember my service here as pleasant."
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 26-Aug-20 12:40 PM
The security officer gave her a respectable nod, at this point he wasn't entirely sure where to continue with the conversation... He knew what he wanted to say, but he wasn't sure if now was exactly the correct time to say it... Or if it even needed to be said at all. Not as if it would suddenly chance the outcome of this situation... "A'aehrel, I... I wish things were different. I feel like despite everything our friendship could have really done well. That we could have spent more quality time together. I'm still incredibly greatful for that first evening we spent together, where despite barely knowing me, you gave me sight for the first time in my fifty years. It's an experience I feel I shall never forget, and it saddens me deeply to know that I will most likely never share a similar experience with you again."
Captain Syrezeaju 26-Aug-20 12:48 PM
While before she had stayed neutral she now could not help but raise an eyebrow at the aenar's attitude. All of this talk was fair and well but there was only so much of it that you could do, and it was very quickly becoming tedious. As always her tone slid just a little, gaining that slight hint of irritation. "You are repeating yourself, Commander," she cautioned. "If you have nothing else to say turn I do not see any reason to further delay my inevitable departure."
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 26-Aug-20 01:10 PM
He paused... She was right, there was no reason to keep her here any further, he knew that. But for some reason he just couldn't let her leave. Some part of him just wanted to hold onto her for a long as possible. He might as well get things over and done with... "You are right, commander. I should not hold you here for longer than you need to... It's just, I've grown to be quite attached to you. But I guess it is time to finally say goodbye." He stood up off the desk and stepped forward towards her, letting out a deep sigh... "I just hope you felt the same way. That this wasn't all for nothing."
9
9
9
9
10
9
Captain Syrezeaju 26-Aug-20 10:42 PM
Yet again he was just saying the same thing, and rather typically she could not help but bristle in irritation. A’aehrel had always been one for just getting to the point; all of the pathetic wordplay and dragging a conversation on for an unnecessary amount of time was just downright stupid in her opinion. But yet he kept reiterating it instead of moving on with the conversation – saying goodbye, and attachment, and- Oh. Oh, by the Great Bird of the Galaxy. How could she have been so blind? The realisation hit her all at once. Their conversations and explanations, oh, god, the meeting with the Chief Medical Officer – had they been talking about her? Ch’evhalen’s hesitance, the awkwardness, the downright pain when the accusation against her had been made, and now all of this which seemed to be tearing them apart. And was it… Was it real? Her realisation? Was it real, or had she just imagined it, but why would she imagine it? Because she- because she felt the same? A flush of dark green had washed over her cheeks. Actions always spoke louder than words, inaction was always going to be a person’s downfall, and… Do it. Just. Bloody get on with it. Her strides were surprisingly hesitant compared to normal but she crossed the boundary between them relatively quickly – Ch’evhalen still leaning with his back against his desk, her with hands bound in front of her by the stasis cuffs. How stupid their situation was, the security officer and the covert operative… But for once she was not going to let that get in their way. Stood directly in front of him she stretched up on her tiptoes, hesitating for only a fleeting fraction of a second before then leaning in.
9
9
9
8
9
7
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 26-Aug-20 11:28 PM
Ezran didn't make any hesitation either, this was the moment he had been waiting for for almost two months now, since he had first fallen for the romulan. He brought a hand up to her face, and leant forward as well, closing the already small distance between the two of them until their lips finally met. It was finally happening. He could sense the pure emotion coming off the woman as he could instantly tell she felt the same way about him. This was never the way he imagined it going... It was probably the least ideal situation out of all the ones he had hoped for, but at this point he was definitely out of options.
6
6
Captain Syrezeaju 27-Aug-20 12:01 AM
Hesitation seemed to melt away at the fact the commander was reciprocating this - that it wasn't just some figment of her imagination. For a brief moment she could not help but wonder how horribly awkward this would have gone if it was just herself imagining things, but thankfully she did not need to consider that... And there were far more pressing matters at hand, considering that she was kissing Ch'evhalen. And how awful it was, as well, knowing that this relationship would begin and end within seconds considering how she was mere hours from the court martial which could change her entire life. She would be sent to jail, most likely, or... What did they do to people like her? A'aehrel had no idea, and she had no desire to find out. Instead she would have much rather remained here, completely enveloped in this moment and feeling as if everything had finally been put right... But she knew that it could not last, and after a moment, she neatly took a small step back.
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 27-Aug-20 12:13 AM
As soon as the kiss had started it had quickly finished. It was devastating knowing that she did in fact have feelings for him, but now they could never act on them... In some ways it would have been less painful if she had shut him down and the two had never seen each other again. But now he would only ever wonder how things could have been had things been different. The aenar moved a hand up, quickly grabbing a hold of the stasis cuffs as if to tell her not to go, to not let this end so soon... "Don't. Don't let this end so soon." He leant forward slightly, one hand moving into her hair. "Please, A'aehrel..."
9
9
9
Captain Syrezeaju 27-Aug-20 12:35 AM
His reaction had been in a split second - if she hadn't been trained then it might well have looked like he had snatched out from nowhere. The strength of how he grabbed at the band of the stasis cuffs actually pulled her forwards again, her teetering on her tiptoes, barely an inch between them. The proximity was simultaneously daunting and enticing all at once - the air thick with the sudden nervous tension. All she could do was stare up at him, frozen, with that deep green blush seeming to darken even further. What was she supposed to do? It had been so long since she had even been friends with someone, never mind intimate. And then there was the issue of whatever happened next. She was going to vanish to whatever fate Starfleet decided for her, this would be completely fleeting and over in an instant... But then, in that case, what was the harm of making it a moment to remember? Who was she to deny them of what they both wanted, of what neither of them could ignore for any longer? Conclusion met, A'aehrel's movement was with equal swiftness. She hooked one ankle around the back of his leg, using that to drag herself closer considering how she could not place arms upon his hips or curl them around his back - and, now well aware of the hunger they both shared, she closed her eyes and closed the gap between them once again. [And with that... We will proactively fade to black.]

Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 12-Sep-20 06:41 PM

"Those who work here all seem trained to a high enough standard, but I must admit the department is spread a little thin... We don't have as many officers as I'd like but we're making due as is right now." He let out a quiet sigh. "But obviously ship security is of incredibly high importance... Perhaps the tactical department could assist us until we can get more officers transferred?"
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 12-Sep-20 07:27 PM

Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 12-Sep-20 07:35 PM

Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 12-Sep-20 07:36 PM

Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 12-Sep-20 07:41 PM

Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 12-Sep-20 07:43 PM
"Of course. I expect that we should be departing shortly. As always my door is open if you need me." Standing, he walked out of the office. Back to looming over him like an emaciated tree, it seemed. Ha ha.

Command had sent a few more onboard to help out but the department was still rather understaffed. He was looking through all the current transfers to see who he still needed to meet.

Artistic_Almanac 21-Sep-20 12:11 PM
She pressed the button to ring the doorbell-although she always thought it sounded a bit more like hailing someone- waiting for permission to enter before she set foot in her commanding officers office.
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 21-Sep-20 12:42 PM
The man was yet again still working in his office. Finalising the new crew members shifts for the upcoming week. The man looked up as he heard the door chime before calling out. "Come in, door's open!"
Artistic_Almanac 21-Sep-20 12:56 PM
She walked through the door and stood at salute to her new commander “Lieutenant Nazral Reeehn, your new AOS” she said, her chest swelling a bit with pride
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 21-Sep-20 12:58 PM
The man greeted her with a warm smile, motioning to the chair opposite him as he usually did. "And may I be the first to say it's a pleasure to have you aboard. Please, have a seat and we can get started."
Artistic_Almanac 21-Sep-20 01:03 PM
She stepped forwards and sat down in the chair, keeping her hands folded in her lap “Then you certainly would be the first.” she said, remembering her interaction with Krurin. “I had assumed the crew was aware of my arrival, but it seemed to not be the case”
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 21-Sep-20 01:05 PM
"Sorry, yours and most of the others arrivals were a bit short notice. The department has been understaffed for a few weeks now, but I'm glad to see command have stepped up and filled the gap." The man smiled, tapping at the console to bring up the woman's file. "Can I get you anything to drink? I can imagine this meeting might last a little longer than your typical one."
Artistic_Almanac 21-Sep-20 01:08 PM
She nodded, her face thoughtful. In front of her commander she intended to make sure she created a good rapport, even if that meant lowering her guard. “a fair point commander” she said, crossing her legs and relaxing a bit in the seat “Lemon tea, hot please” she said, realizing she’d left her previous cup in the replicator and hadn’t had a chance to have any of it.
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 21-Sep-20 01:11 PM
The man nodded and stood from his desk as he moved to the replicator and came back with two cups, sitting hers down in the desk before her. "There we are. Before things get awfully professional and serious, I'd just want to make clear that I'm not exactly the most strict of bosses. This ship is a relaxing environment for everyone, and despite our role to always be on guard of it, it does not mean that we must always be so strict about it, no?"
Artistic_Almanac 21-Sep-20 01:14 PM
She blinked, a bit surprised by his words. Her eyebrows creased together in confusion, taking the cup and blowing on it before taking a sip. She then set the cup back down “Then it will take some adjusting for me” she said, looking up at him “My environment has always been fast paced and I have always been motivated to keep my crew safe and strive to do my job to the best of my ability. I fear that has not build the most ‘friendly’ of masks for myself.”
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 21-Sep-20 01:17 PM
"Well, this is a new ship, a new crew. Nobody here knows what you're like, you've got a chance at a fresh start here. I've learned that if you treat this crew as family, then they'll treat you back the same. It's hard not to be friendly when everyone here is so kind and welcoming." He said, giving her a reassuring smile. "I'm sure you'll do great."
Artistic_Almanac 21-Sep-20 01:19 PM
She looked down at her hands in her lap “I fear I may have already had a run in with Lieutenant Krurin earlier. I suppose I may own her an apology” she sighed, this was going to be difficult. She was used to running a tight ship. That didn’t mean that no one on her previous ship had not been treated like family, but it did mean setting the standard for respect ahead of time. She cleared her throat “Tell me then commander, if one is so relaxed with their crew, then how do you know they will appropriately respect you when the time calls for it.”
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 21-Sep-20 01:24 PM
"They can all tell when the time for respect is due, there's always a place and time for enjoying ourselves but if anything serious arises everyone is always very professional and efficient with their role, nobody has let me down so far. I'm incredibly proud of all them." He frowned slightly. "I'm a little disheartened to hear you've already had a brief altercation with another member of the crew... Perhaps some form of training exercise or team building is in order... We do have a lot of new crew to introduce to one another..." The man looked up at the woman sitting opposite him. "Does that sound a good idea? I suppose I should get used to running ideas past somebody else again."
Artistic_Almanac 21-Sep-20 01:38 PM
She chuckled “not so much as an altercation so much as inappropriate address to be honest. Had I stopped by here first I would have known to expect it.” she sighed, pondering for a moment as she lifted the cup to her lips again and drank some more of it “I believe it would be good to be introduced to the crew, though perhaps a team building exercise may been too soon to be called for. I feel a simple meal together may prove better for the short term. If problems continue into the long term, then perhaps it may be a good plan.”
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 21-Sep-20 01:41 PM
"Sorry, I was busy with paperwork again. It had been stacking up recently. But yes, I feel like we do need to introduce everyone to one another, It would help everyone get to know who they're going to be working with a lot more." He smiled at her and had a sip from his own cup before continuing. "You're already helping with suggestions. That's what I like to see."
Artistic_Almanac 21-Sep-20 01:49 PM
She smiled, feeling a bit proud “Well, I will more than happily take some of those stacks off of your proverbial plate” she said taking another drink of the tea. “and yes, I do believe introductions will be the best place to start. I will admit that I do not like being addressed casually, but I assume over time I will come to terms with the concept. I hope you do not fault me for priding myself in my position, I worked very hard to get it.”
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 21-Sep-20 01:53 PM
"Obviously you can have your team address you in whichever way feels best to you. As for myself, Either Ezran, Commander or just 'Sir' is fine enough. I'm honestly not all that bothered mostly." He said with a chuckle before continuing. "And of course not, you be proud of yourself. You know how hard it was yourself to earn this, and I'm sure you'll want to do your utmost best at all times."
Artistic_Almanac 21-Sep-20 01:54 PM
She nodded, smiling a bit “I will always do my best for my team Commander” she said. She tilted her head, curious “How long have you been positioned here Sir? If I may ask that is.”
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 21-Sep-20 02:35 PM
"Oh goodness, don't ask me to remember that..." He paused for a moment, counting in his head. "Five months or so?"
Artistic_Almanac 21-Sep-20 02:44 PM
She blinked in surprise, he hadn’t been here very long himself! She cleared her throat “I look forwards to seeing what protocols you have put in place” she said with a small smile.
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 21-Sep-20 02:50 PM
"Well, I'm sure you'll be very familiar with everything soon enough. Hey, you might even come up with a few yourself eventually." He smiled, and tapped his console again so the screen was focused again. "Let's talk about your file then, shall we?"
Artistic_Almanac 21-Sep-20 02:52 PM
She nodded, taking another drink of tea and looking down into the cup in slight dismay as she set it down, empty. “Alright then.” she said with a nod, ready when he was.
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 21-Sep-20 02:56 PM
"The phoenix is only your second posting, correct? It's quite rare to see somebody appointed to a ship for such a long period of time, most people take a few attempts before they find somewhere they wish to settle down. How was your last ship?"
Artistic_Almanac 21-Sep-20 03:01 PM
She thought back to her last team and chuckled “Much smaller” she admitted, shifting nervously in the chair “But we all were very close and respected one another. Naturally it caused issues sometimes to be in close quarters, but it also meant always knowing who had your back. I enjoyed being there a lot but...well I had my reasons for requesting my transfer.” she thought about her parents back at starfleet medical on earth, wondering how they were doing.
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 21-Sep-20 03:45 PM
"Well, I won't ask what reasons they were unless you feel I should know. This ship is much larger than one you'll be used to, so I just hope you feel you're up to the task of ACoS. If you have any questions or doubts then you can obviously ask me at any time." He said with a smile.
Artistic_Almanac 21-Sep-20 03:49 PM
She nodded “my parents needed to be moved to starfleet medical and I preceded to join a ship where I could return more often.” she said honestly. “I know that every ACoS has generic duties, but I would appreciate a detailed list of any extra expectations you have for me” she said, returning his smile. So far things seemed to be going well. That was good.
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 21-Sep-20 03:56 PM
"Well, I'd certainly be happy to provide that for you at a later date, just briefly however, my previous ACoS helped me with crew reports, work out duty rosters for the rest of the security team, helping oversee training exercises and dealing with any issues arisen by the rest of the security team and bring them to myself." He smiled, looking up at her. "Sound reasonable? It may sound like a lot of work, but split between the two of us it'll be no issue."
Artistic_Almanac 21-Sep-20 04:39 PM
She nodded, yes all those duties sounded familiar. “sounds like a perfect plan. Can you send me your preferred formats later?” she asked with a small smile.
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 21-Sep-20 04:41 PM
"You should have full access to the security documents. There's a nice template in there for things like the duty roster. Makes things so much faster." He said with a chuckle, before taking yet another security issue PADD from his desk drawer and sliding it across the table. "This one is yours, take good care of it."
Artistic_Almanac 21-Sep-20 04:50 PM
She took it with a curt nod, the nervous feeling in her chest as beginning to settle down. “Apart from that, was there anything else Sir?” she asked, excited and looking forwards to having a chance to explore the ship soon
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 21-Sep-20 04:51 PM
"Not unless you have any further questions for me. I think this concludes your evaluation. Well done, I think you'll make a fine assistant." He said with a smile.
Artistic_Almanac 21-Sep-20 05:05 PM
She smiled in return “I plan to do my best each time.” she said with a grin “although I would not be opposed to knowing when my off hours might be so that I might familiarize myself with the ship”
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 21-Sep-20 05:06 PM
"Your duty roster for the upcoming week is already on the PADD, all the new officers aren't due to start until tomorrow so there's plenty of time to familiarise yourself with the ship, get your physical, relax before your first shift."
Artistic_Almanac 21-Sep-20 05:10 PM
She couldn’t prevent the excited smile that crossed her face “I look forwards to seeing you tomorrow then Sir” she said, holding her hand out towards him as she stood up, eager to explore and meet others.
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 21-Sep-20 05:12 PM
He smiled and shook her hand "Again, Welcome aboard. I look forward to seeing you on duty tommorow as well. I'll be able to give you a better tour of the security department."
Artistic_Almanac 21-Sep-20 05:14 PM
She nodded, shaking in return before releasing his hand “I look forwards to it” she said, giving him a polite nod before leaving his office.
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 21-Sep-20 06:31 PM
[D]There was a short bleep at Ezran's console, and a letter appeared on it, written from the Gamma Quadrant:
To: Lt. Commander Ezran ch'Evhalen From: Lt. JG Tarna'Motlan
>
Hello, Commander. I'm not good with words or goodbyes, so I'll try to keep this one short. And I'm sorry that it's late. I only had so much time to write before lieutenant zh'Ashrelil and I were transferred off. Thank you for everything. It's been an honor to serve with you and the rest of the security department - small though we might be we were and will be all warriors in our own right. You know. Soldiers. I don't know if I'll ever get a department so welcoming ever again. My new crew is a little cautious of me but no one tries to rip my scales off or drop metal grates on my head at least.
>
That aside however, the Niflheim is in the Gamma Quadrant. We've been tasked with convincing more Jem'hadar enter Starfleet - difficult considering the sheer magnitude of the task and my people's attitude but I suppose it can be done. I think you'll see the next one come in... maybe in the next four years. Hopefully.
>
Eh. It's alright over here otherwise. We're relatively safe, couple of rogue Hur'q come at us sometimes but the Niflheim exterminates them all. Annoying little things. But I'll miss you all, sir. Hope to meet again out among the stars. Someday.
>
Remember. Victory is life. I think you'll all have nice, long lives.
>
~Lt. Tarna'Motlan ACOS USS Niflheim NCC-5975-A

Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 19-Oct-20 11:39 PM
Ezran had returned back to his office after the senior staff meeting and was currently working away as he usually found himself doing. This office was practically his second home at this point, he seemed to spend more time here than his actual quarters...
Captain Syrezeaju 19-Oct-20 11:42 PM
[D] The door chimed.
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 19-Oct-20 11:43 PM
The man looked up from his desk and called out to whoever was waiting outside. "Come in! Door's open."
Captain Syrezeaju 19-Oct-20 11:45 PM
With hands in pockets the Captain wandered in, taking a look around the dimly-lit office. Not exactly like the man needed light, considering how he was an Aenar. "Hope I'm not interrupting anything, Commander. Do you have a moment?"
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 19-Oct-20 11:46 PM
"Captain Syrezeaju! And not at all. Please, come in and take a seat." The man said, motioning to the seat opposite him with a gentle smile. "What can I do for you?"
Captain Syrezeaju 19-Oct-20 11:47 PM
She all but folded herself into the chair opposite, one leg crossed over the other and foot tucked back behind the other leg. Didn't seem comfortable but that was the position she opted for anyway. "As I mentioned at that meeting, I've been having a think about your staffing. I reckon it's high time that we find you an ACoS, don't you?"
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 19-Oct-20 11:49 PM
"I'd be glad for the help. The previous two didn't last very long. One of them didn't even last a day." He said with a slight chuckle, rubbing at the back of this head. "I need somebody a bit more reliable to work with me on things. Who did you have in mind, if anyone?"
Captain Syrezeaju 19-Oct-20 11:51 PM
"Well, this is where things get a little bit tricky. I had a look over your current roster and there... Well, I hate to say it, but there just ain't anybody capable of taking the position at the moment. So that's why I thought you might wanna expand your field of view a bit." Taking her PADD she sent the document she had prepared over to the Aenar's console, aware that he might not read it in the conventional sense. "Your departments are basically the same, after all. Bit of co-operation and communication between the two wouldn't go amiss."
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 19-Oct-20 11:55 PM
The man took a moment to 'read' over the document the captain had sent his way. "This isn't the worst suggestion I've had. It could probably work given a little bit of time and adjustment between the two. You think it's our best option we have at the moment?"
Captain Syrezeaju 19-Oct-20 11:56 PM
"I think so, given their track record. It would help get one another more involved, and the two departments should be working very closely anyway. I can't see a downside to it other than it might come with an adjustment period. It's not up to myself, though. If you aren't happy with the idea then I won't implement it."
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 20-Oct-20 12:05 AM
"Well, it's certainly a very achievable idea. The two of our departments are meant to work together as is anyway, and it really wouldn't take very much effort to merge the two departments either..."
Captain Syrezeaju 20-Oct-20 12:06 AM
"If you're happy to sign off on that change, then, then I'll have a word asap. Hopefully you can have a bit of a meeting with them shortly as well, ensure that they know what's going on?"
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 20-Oct-20 12:08 AM
"Sounds like a plan, Captain. I'll let you start work on that ASAP. Sooner we get the department working smoothly the safer the ship will be. Safety should be number one priority." He said with a smile. "It is our job after all."
Captain Syrezeaju 20-Oct-20 12:09 AM
"Glad that it's all handled well by yourself, Commander. I know that things can be quiet but your job is imperative at the end of the day." Unfolding her legs from that weird position, she stood and shook them off before heading to the door. "If I can give you a hand with any of this then just let me know, alright?"
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 20-Oct-20 12:10 AM
"I'll be sure and let you know. Thanks for stopping by Captain. It's glad to see we have somebody as efficient as you working onboard. You seem to have everything under control here."
Captain Syrezeaju 20-Oct-20 12:11 AM
She paused in the doorway and couldn't help but laugh at that. "I don't think I have everything under control yet, but I'd quite like to get there. I just don't want to be too strict about it. Folk don't like change."
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 20-Oct-20 12:29 AM
"Well you've certainly made a good impression on myself, Captain." He said with a smile. "Will you let me know how your meeting with your candidate goes? If we do find a suitable ACoS then I've got something to discuss with you."
Captain Syrezeaju 20-Oct-20 12:30 AM
"Multiple meetings, you're not making my schedule easy," she mused. "But I'll let you know, don't worry. Feel free to get in touch and I'll meet you for this secondary discussion of yours. And if you need anything then just get in touch, Commander. Enjoy the rest of your day." A quick wave was given and then she vanished around the doorframe.

He blinked. "You may, after I finish with your expected duties. You're familiar, I'm sure, with standard Starfleet security duties; we run bi-weekly training sessions and weapons drills, nothing out of the norm. I'm also working on some emergency preparedness drills, environmental hazards, unauthorized access to secure locations, that sort of thing, so be ready for updates on that to come." He slid a PADD across the desk. "This is your standard issue security PADD, it should have all pertinent information on it, including where to report for duty and so on. Any questions?"
Riku-DarkHeart 11-Nov-20 11:44 PM
As expected, the duties were security related and were within his wheelhouse. "No questions, sir." He took the pad, positioning it under his arm so it was secure until it was time to leave.
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 11-Nov-20 11:45 PM
"Very well. You may proceed to... 'speak freely' then, Ensign."
Riku-DarkHeart 11-Nov-20 11:59 PM
"I mean no offense, I'm just curious. I was expecting you to be more...rough around the edges so to speak. I'm glad you're friendlier than I expected."
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 12-Nov-20 12:04 AM
Parlac chuckled. "Your opinion might change once I have you running drills, but I try to be, uh, friendlier than expected. Cardassians have a reputation for short tempers and I don't want to scare off any of my crewmates."
Riku-DarkHeart 12-Nov-20 12:15 AM
A sigh of relief was let out by Galen "Honestly it wasn't the reputation that led me to ask, it was more the combat prowess of your species. If you do not need anything else, shall I head to work, or should I head back to my quarters and start tomorrow?"
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 12-Nov-20 12:18 AM
"The combat prowess is precisely why I'm in security, but it certainly doesn't mean I'll bite your head off given the chance. I suppose you haven't met many Cardassians if you were that concerned." He smiled, and tried to impart as much warmth to his features as possible. "Just stay on your toes and you'll do fine, Ensign. One last thing before you go, and then you can return to quarters: what are your preferred pronouns, and how do you prefer to be called? Galen or Maar?"
Riku-DarkHeart 12-Nov-20 12:20 AM
That was a question that was definitely not expected but nonetheless he answered "He/Him and honestly, Galen or Maar is fine sir. Heck you could even just call me by my rank and as long as it's obvious you're speaking to me, I'll answer!"
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 12-Nov-20 12:22 AM
"I'll keep than in mind. I tend to use family names over given names, and rank over everything else." He stood, straightening his uniform slightly, and gave a polite nod. "Feel free to return to your quarters, or the mess hall or what have you. Report for duty on alpha shift tomorrow. Have a good evening, Ensign."
Riku-DarkHeart 12-Nov-20 12:26 AM

Gnik Trac Gnippohs Eht 12-Nov-20 12:46 AM
[D] The bell to Rekat's new office rang. What a busy day!
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 12-Nov-20 12:46 AM
"Enter!"
Gnik Trac Gnippohs Eht 12-Nov-20 12:49 AM
Krurin entered promptly, standing in front of the door at attention. "Lieutenant Parlac," she growled softly and kindly. As kindly as she could muster anyway, her voice would always be gravelly in some manner. "Lieutenant Krurin, a pleasure to finally make your acquaintance." She came forward with her furry arm extended, her other arm stuck professionally behind her back. She wasn’t going to make the same lackadaisical mistake she had made last time with formalities.
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 12-Nov-20 12:50 AM
Parlac sat behind his desk, PADD under his right hand. He looked up with a smile as the Caitian entered, and stood to greet her, accepting her hand for a brief but firm handshake. "Thank you! I'm delighted to meet you, Lieutenant Krurin. Please, have a seat."
Gnik Trac Gnippohs Eht 12-Nov-20 12:57 AM
Krurin pulled the chair out gently, before swiftly taking a seat. Her tail hung off the edge, swaying gently with anxious curiosity. So their new chief was a Cardassian, how intriguing. She had never met a Cardassian before. Her golden eyes remained locked on her new boss, but a toothy smirk began to creep onto her lips, the atmosphere had already lightened up for her with the simple interaction between them.
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 12-Nov-20 01:00 AM
"I appreciate you taking the time to come by. As a new transfer to the Phoenix, I was hoping I could get your insight on how the security department has functioned in the past. Can you tell me anything you think might be useful? Any areas that could use improvement?" He leaned forward in his chair, hands folded on the desk in front of him.
Gnik Trac Gnippohs Eht 12-Nov-20 01:17 AM
"You asking is an improvement in of itself," she answered honestly. Their last chief had barely reached out to his team at all. "I feel as though this department could use quite a bit of work." She straightened up in her seat, if he was asking she might as well report her observations. "Most of us barely know each other, for one. I know the names of my fellow officers from the files available on my PADD, but that’s about all I know. We come in, we work, we discuss things occasionally — but really we don’t have the first idea of how each other really is. We're lacking in the team aspect." Her body shifted forward, her hands resting on the table, her fingers drumming. She was thinking about what else she had observed in her short time aboard. "Communication, teamwork, there’s new members aboard right? I’ve heard the tactical department does training in the holodeck. We're less offensive, but it could still be useful." Her tail flicked eagerly to her side. "I think that’s about it, I hope that wasn’t too much for you." She laughed, her laugh sounding more like a purr than an actual laugh.
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 12-Nov-20 02:06 AM
Parlac jotted a few notes down as she spoke. "Good to know, and thank you for your honesty. I must confess, I'm a bit of an anti-social old grump, but I do believe in a good, strong team. I'll see what I can do about getting us a little more coordinated. I'll be organizing a team meeting to start with, I think. But then maybe some holodeck outings for team morale and so on. Any suggestions you have in that department are most welcome. If you can think of anything else, feel free to drop by my office or send me a note at any time. Your candor and your opinions are both appreciated." He smiled at her, trying to convey the same sense of authority mixed with familiarity that his old CO was able to do so well. "Do you have any questions for me?"
Gnik Trac Gnippohs Eht 12-Nov-20 03:00 AM
Questions, questionssss... Krurin tried to think of any questions but really she didn’t have any. This new officer had already proven himself worthy of Krurin's respect and she had just met him. Hopefully her hunch was right and he’d turn out to be as amazing as she’d thought. "I’m racking my brain, sir. I’m excited to start working with you." She smiled toothily, her eyes squinted.
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 12-Nov-20 03:22 AM
"As do I," he said, returning her smile. "One last thing, then, before you go. What are your preferred pronouns and how do you prefer to be called?"
Gnik Trac Gnippohs Eht 12-Nov-20 03:27 AM
"I’d prefer she/her pronouns," she purred softly. "And if it’s easier, folk call me Kallie. It’s easier to pronounce in other species' vowel range. It’s entirely up to comfort though." She nodded politely at him. "Might I ask you the same for personal reference?"
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 12-Nov-20 04:01 AM
"Certainly! He/him, Lieutenant Parlac while on duty, just Parlac otherwise. Cardassians don't use given names except between family or very close friends."
Gnik Trac Gnippohs Eht 12-Nov-20 04:53 AM
"I understand," she nodded firmly. "Thank you for letting me know." She sat back in her chair, attentively in case she needed to offer anything else.
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 12-Nov-20 05:00 AM
"That will be all for now, I think. Thank you again for stopping by, Lieutenant." He stood up, nodded politely, and smiled. "I'm sure I'll be seeing you again soon. Have a lovely evening."
Finley Harrison 12-Nov-20 05:05 AM
[Krurin] Krurin stood up, "Thank you, it was a pleasure meeting you. I wish you well throughout the rest of the day." With that, Krurin spun on her heel with a smile and exited the office, leaving Parlac in blissful silence once more.
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 12-Nov-20 05:05 PM
Parlac stood and stretched, slipping his PADD into his pocket and making his way out of his office.

[D] Ding! A message has arrived!
Good morning Lieutenant Parlac! I wanted to say thank you again for your kind words and company last night at the party. I know you've said you're not exceptional at associating and mingling, but from a social butterfly's standpoint, I'm proud to say that I definitely think you're improving. On another note, I've finally had the chance to read over Sutal's paper and it was extraordinary! While the initial meeting reason might have not gone off as planned, I'm eager to meet him even so due to the fascinating depth of research he's gone through and I have so many questions! I hope you have a lovely day, and thank you again for introducing me to another possibly very good friend.
>
All the best, Lt. Sara A, Bjørge, CSO

Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 17-Nov-20 12:36 AM
He sat back down behind his desk.
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 17-Nov-20 01:46 AM
He chimed the doorbell.
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 17-Nov-20 01:46 AM
"Enter!"
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 17-Nov-20 01:50 AM
The Kelpien wasted no time in walking through the door, slipping his PADD into his pocket while he did. "Lieutenant Parlac. Have you a few minutes to talk?"
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 17-Nov-20 01:53 AM
"Certainly, Commander. What can I do for you?" Parlac stood behind his desk at attention.
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 17-Nov-20 01:55 AM
"Firstly, sit down, please, before you sprain something," He replied. "Second, I am merely here to check on you and your department and to hear your concerns and needs should there be any you wish to voice."
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 17-Nov-20 02:06 AM
He sat down, but remained stiff-backed. "No concerns so far. I've met with a few of my officers, but would like to arrange something more formal. I've been working," he gestured at a few scattered PADDs on his desk, "on some plans for the department, emergency preparedness drills and the like. I plan to speak to the captain about whether she intends to institute an ACOS, as I'm not sure whether we need one for this compliment size, but other than that I have no major questions. I appreciate you taking the time to drop by, however."
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 17-Nov-20 02:09 AM
"It is what is expected of me, lieutenant, nothing less." He sat down across from the man with his fingers steepled together in front of him. "Perhaps a collective briefing when it is convenient. Have there been any pressing security issues of late? Of any kind?"
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 17-Nov-20 02:15 AM
"Nothing I would deem particularly pressing, but then, I've only just come aboard. Lieutenant Commander T'Svai is experiencing emotional distress but from what I witnessed, and based on Lieutenant R'Mor's analysis, I don't believe it will be an issue. Vulcans can be... temperamental when they aren't able to properly suppress emotions, but unless she is deemed an immediate threat, I didn't see fit to send a security detail to watch her."
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 17-Nov-20 02:17 AM
"I met with her earlier, actually. What you've just told me does correlate with what I experienced. She seemed somewhat more irritable when we spoke. Has the cause been determined?"
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 17-Nov-20 02:30 AM
"I believe Lieutenant R'Mor determined it was a result of a, I believe he called it a 'cocktail' of pheromones and pollens? He said it would be out of her system within a week, roughly. I assume if anything changes, I'll be alerted if I'm needed." He paused, then relaxed his shoulders slightly. "If I may, do you have anything pertinent you can tell me about how this department was run prior? I haven't met my predecessor, and I'm interested to know what you thought or if you have any advice."
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 17-Nov-20 02:32 AM
Pheromones and pollens. He made a mental note to send Sara another note later on the matter. "As I recall things were slightly relaxed if anything. Commander ch'Evhalen liked things that way." (edited)
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 17-Nov-20 02:41 AM
"Good to know. I tend to run on the stricter side of things, but only when necessary. A good security team means discipline and order, but so far I haven't encountered any crewmates who don't fit that description anyway, so I don't see that any major changes are needed. I'll have a more comprehensive idea of the team once we have a few meetings under our belts." Parlac leaned back in his chair and smiled.
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 17-Nov-20 02:45 AM
"Good. The people who work under and with you are the backbone of this department, lieutenant, and I trust you to remember that well." He told him. "I should be off, now. Thank you for notifying me about the incident. I will bear that in mind going forward."
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 17-Nov-20 02:47 AM
"I would hardly be qualified for this position if I forgot that," he said, leaning forward and placing his hands on the desk in front of him as he stood, "Thank you again for your time, Commander. Let me know if there's anything you need from me."
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 17-Nov-20 02:48 AM
"Indeed I shall." Nodding, he stood and left for the doorway.
Commander Yllescas Itesh 18-Nov-20 12:47 AM
[D] Mail call, for Lieuteant Parlac.
Lieutenant Parlac. My name is Oskar König, a Lieutenant Junior Grade in the Intelligence department. The Captain has appointed me to be your ACoS. At your earliest convenience, I would like to arrange a meeting so we can discuss future plans. Thank you, Oskar König.
Commander Yllescas Itesh 18-Nov-20 04:44 PM
[D] The doot chimed.
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 18-Nov-20 04:44 PM
"Enter!" Parlac called.
Commander Yllescas Itesh 18-Nov-20 04:46 PM
Oskar stepped into the office, placing his hands behind his back. Upon seeing Parlac, he extended his right hand for a handshake. "Lieutenant Parlac. Lieutenant König, reporting as ordered."
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 18-Nov-20 04:46 PM
Parlac shook his hand briefly. "Good to meet you. Please, take a seat."
Commander Yllescas Itesh 18-Nov-20 04:49 PM
Oskar nodded and took a seat, straightening his uniform jacket. "So, where should we begin, sir?" He asked, running a hand through his hair.
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 18-Nov-20 04:51 PM
"To start, I'd like you to tell me a little about yourself and how you got this position-- I've noticed you're not wearing security colors, and I'm more than a little curious," he said, smiling. "And, before we get too far, your preferred pronouns and how you like to be called would be helpful." He pulled a PADD over and tapped a few buttons, then looked back up at the young lieutenant.
Commander Yllescas Itesh 18-Nov-20 04:56 PM
"Uh, I'm a male, sir. I prefer to be called by male pronouns." Oskar said, admittedly he wasn't ready for that question. Oh well, time to move on. "Admittedly sir, the Intelligence and Security departments don't always get along. The Captain was looking for someone to help strengthen relations with Security, and she chose me. Captain Kunzo, the previous Captain, was working on something similar before his departure. I can show you my Intelligence personnel file if you need it."
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 18-Nov-20 05:01 PM
"I would like that, yes." Parlac nodded, jotting notes down as he listened. "I'm happy to facilitate better working relationships between Security and Intelligence, and I trust the captain's judgement in appointing you. Let's get started then, shall we? I'm working on organizing a team meeting as well as planning emergency preparedness drills. I'd like your assistance with the latter-- come up with a few ideas we can run on the holodeck. Prioritize something that balances actual emergency preparedness with solid teamwork."
Commander Yllescas Itesh 18-Nov-20 05:04 PM
"Aye, sir." Oskar quickly pulled out his PADD and typed on it for a second. After he put it back in his pocket, a file appeared on Parlac's PADD, Oskar's personnel file. "Any emergency in particular you're looking to strengthen?"
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 18-Nov-20 05:12 PM
Parlac smiled, clearly pleased with the question. "Yes, in fact. Environmental hazards and involuntary boarding."
Commander Yllescas Itesh 18-Nov-20 05:15 PM
"Aye, sir. Do you want a specific set of boarders or just whoever I can think of? Also what kind of hazards are you looking for? Debris, forcefields, something like that?"
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 18-Nov-20 05:17 PM
"Use your best judgement for enemy boarders, whatever you think would be good practice. As for hazards, I'd say focus on something airborne-- gives us an excuse to run the drill in hazmat suits, which don't get used nearly often enough. I'll be including a timed section on that one to make sure we can get into suits and deployed as quickly as possible."
Commander Yllescas Itesh 18-Nov-20 05:21 PM
"Aye, sir. I can have a beta test ready by..." He checked his PADD. "Sixteen hundred hours, if that's alright with you. I'll make the test challenging enough for real life."
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 18-Nov-20 05:24 PM
The smile expanded into a grin. "Perfect. Exactly what I like to hear." He leaned forward in his chair, placing his elbows on the desk and steepling his fingers. "I also want to make it clear that I am open to discuss your thoughts at any time. I welcome discourse and disagreements equally, so if there is anything you'd like to tell me or ask me or suggest I implement, feel free to bring it up. The offer stands indefinitely-- I believe the best thing a good Chief of Security can have is a good relationship with his ACOS."
Commander Yllescas Itesh 18-Nov-20 05:28 PM
Oskar gave a slight nod. "Of course, sir. I would ask the same of you. If you feel I may have overstepped my bounds or faltered, don't hesitate to tell me. Chances are it was my fault anyway." Oskar stood up, adjusting his uniform. "Beta will be ready by sixteen hundred, you're welcome to see it for yourself. I'm no holoprogrammer, so it may still be a bit rough when deadline comes." (edited)
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 18-Nov-20 05:42 PM
Parlac stood as well, folding his arms and giving a polite nod. "Good. Alert me if you need anything, otherwise I'll see you then. Dismissed."
Commander Yllescas Itesh 18-Nov-20 05:45 PM
Oskar nodded as well. "Sir." He said and placed his hands behind his back. He turned heel and walked out of the office.
Captain Syrezeaju 18-Nov-20 09:51 PM
[D] The door chimed.
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 18-Nov-20 09:53 PM
"Enter!" Parlac sat behind his desk, engrossed in a collection of PADDs, furiously taking notes.
Captain Syrezeaju 18-Nov-20 09:58 PM
Short strides, slowed to ensure that she did not give the impression of barging into an office that did not belong to her, brought the Rigellian into the room. Rank pips were likely indistinguishable from a distance but the white division stripes upon the uniform (unfortunately) gave away exactly who she was. It seemed customary for her to scan over a room upon first entering - a trait from her own time as a security officer and one that could not be shaken, perhaps. A semi-conscious effort was made to take in the layout and how the place had been decorated. Scarcely, it seemed, almost as bare as the ready room up upon the bridge. It seemed that neither the Rigellian nor the Cardassian before her had a penchant for interior design. Stopping short of the other side of the desk, she was cautious that she did not interrupt what seemed to be one intense studying session. "I hope I'm not interrupting at all, Lieutenant. ...You seem content to wear that stylus down to nothing with the speed of that writing."
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 18-Nov-20 10:04 PM
The Cardassian looked up, assessed the officer standing in front of him, and was standing at attention in two seconds flat. "Captain! I wasn't expecting you. I uh," he pushed a few of the PADDs into an attempt at a neat stack, "was just working on some plans for the security team. Nothing that can't wait a few moments, of course. What can I do for you?"
Captain Syrezeaju 18-Nov-20 10:09 PM
You never really understood how swift an officer could move until they were caught off guard by a senior officer and snapping to attention to make up for that. Syrezeaju did not know any species to be able to move with a speed that could rival that of warp but yet it seemed that officers seemed to suddenly obtain the skill during those sorts of situations. Part of her appreciated it, having always been a stickler for formalities when first getting to know a person. The other part found it rather amusing - and this was conveyed in the half-smile she gave, Rigellian facial ridges seeming to tug up at the corners of her lips instead of dragging them down into the unimpressed look that seemed natural to her species. "Please, Lieutenant, don't fret - at ease. I don't want to get in the way of your work, and I wouldn't want all of those PADDs of yours ending up out of order either. But if you do have the time, I thought I ought to stop by. You've been here a short while now and I still haven't made introductions yet, so I ought to apologise."
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 18-Nov-20 10:11 PM
"No apologies necessary, sir. I understand commanding a ship can be a bit busy," he smiled in return, relaxing a bit though he remained standing, "Lieutenant Rekat Parlac, a pleasure to meet you Captain."
Captain Syrezeaju 18-Nov-20 10:30 PM
'No apologies necessary' was a good sign, at least, and it was quite the relief to see that the security officer was entirely understanding - and not to mention polite. Getting along with officers was something crucial to keeping a ship running smoothly and it was made far easier by officers having a good personality. The understanding shown to her would be shown amongst Parlac's officers within his own division, hopefully, and while she had not had a chance to read over his file in detail she was certain that such a thing would have already been noted. Opting for that traditional human gesture she took a step closer to the desk so she could extend a hand. "A pleasure as well, Lieutenant. I won't bother giving you my own name, considering how you'll already know it. ...Might I ask what sort of thing you're working on here? You certainly have a lot of information noted down."
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 18-Nov-20 10:36 PM
He shook her hand briefly, a flash of surprise on his face at the human gesture. He always tried to keep handshakes brief, they were not how he was used to introducing himself, but they were close enough to the traditional Cardassian palm-press to not be uncomfortable. He simply hadn't expected it of the Rigellian captain. "Certainly, sir. I've met a few of my security team thus far, but not all of them, so I've been planning a team meeting. I met with my new ACOS earlier and assigned him to create a few emergency preparedness drills on the holodeck for team building-- and for actual emergency preparedness, of course. I've been jotting down ideas for general team efficiency improvements I think could be made, and of course I'll be putting together a report for you on my first week with any thoughts that are relevant." He glanced over the desk and winced, realizing he hadn't been back to his own quarters in... well, he'd been here all night. His self-made promises to stop being a workaholic floated to the forefront of his mind. (edited)
Captain Syrezeaju 18-Nov-20 10:49 PM
It took all of the restraint - learned over the past years of serving as a commanding officer - to stop herself from breaking into a grin that she knew was rather snake-like and distinctly unsettling to begin with until a person got to know her. Emergency preparedness, though, thank the stars. It was all she could hope for considering how much they required a dedicated team. It had been much to her displeasure that she had noted that emergency teams were not already in place, and the lack of available kit had only been highlighted by the incident with the Usaniir and their fire down upon the surface of Gramen. Fixing such an issue was crucial, considering how they all knew the proclivity of a ship's fire suppressant systems to stop working or some sort of further hazardous terrain situation to arise. "All of those plans sound perfect. Becoming more prepared for an emergency response is something that I've been meaning to flag up with both security and operations so it does make me glad to hear you've taken that under your belt. How have you been finding things so far?" She enquired as she folded both hands over the edge of the chair she had ended up stood behind. "I'll admit that I haven't met many of the officers from this division yet."
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 18-Nov-20 10:58 PM
"I did notice there was a lack of coherent planning for the department, so I'm hoping to rectify that. We should be prepared for anything, and it's important that we work well together as a team. I'm hopeful a few drills and some slight rearranging will get us headed in the right direction with that. Thus far, I've found each member of the security team I've had the pleasure of meeting to be solid officers and I look forward immensely to actually working with them. In particular, Lieutenant König seems like good choice for ACOS and he's already making himself quite useful." Parlac seemed visibly more relaxed now. "I'm sorry, pardon my manners, can I get you anything? Something to drink? I was about to refresh my cup of red leaf tea."
Captain Syrezeaju 18-Nov-20 11:12 PM
"Oh, no, but thank you - I won't take up that much of your time, don't worry." The quip was coupled with a bit of a laugh from the Rigellian, a slightly scratchy sound that matched a voice equally worn from the effects of continually breathing air that wasn't the exact concentration of that of her homeworld. "From what I know of the previous department head, Lieutenant Commander Ch'evhalen? Is that he was very much the sort of person to... Focus on the here and now, I believe. I had spotted on his file that his forte seemed to be attending calls for security within the ship or heading out on away teams. And that's a commendable trait, of course - but I like my crew to be prepared for any sort of eventuality. You can't serve in the here and now if you aren't prepared for it in advance. And I'm glad that you approve of the choice to appoint Lieutenant König to the position. I know it might seem untoward, but what's the point in having such a department aboard a ship if you never utilise them?"
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 18-Nov-20 11:33 PM
"Agreed on all counts, Captain. I must admit, I was surprised to see someone not wearing Security yellow when he walked into my office, but I'm a strong supporter of interdepartmental cooperation-- there is no use in having too much pride in one's own department to not accept help from another, which sadly seems to be one of the greater failings of Starfleet. I hope you'll find I'm happy to work with just about anyone as long as they are a good officer." He smiled again, enjoying the casual conversation. His greatest source of nerves surrounding his posting to the Phoenix was whether or not he'd get along with her captain, but the Rigellian had put him immediately at ease. Any trace of concern was erased as he considered that he already felt the beginnings of loyalty taking root.
Captain Syrezeaju 18-Nov-20 11:45 PM
"Then I had better hope that all of the officers are good," she mused in response, but internally the statement had been reassuring if anything. Parlac seemed like a legitimately good person who had the best interests of his officers, department, and ship as a whole at heart. It only served to make her hope that she would do the same. Having been caught up in administration since Gramen, today had made her acutely aware of just how distanced she already was from the rest of the crew. It was becoming clear that she ought to take a leaf out of the Cardassian's book - why did Humans say that, considering how books didn't have leaves - and find the pleasure in working with others instead of becoming enveloped in the negative. It was her job to handle the negative, of course; but there was a whole ship here full of people who she was certain were legitimately good. "There have been a couple issues here and there that I've had to handle but nothing within your own department, thankfully. As far as I'm aware your officers are all good folk - just a little bored, perhaps. I know it can be dull when there's not much to do, but I think that enacting these plans of yours will get them back on track again. I'm glad to hear that you have it all under control, Lieutenant. It's good to have somebody taking the initiative."
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 18-Nov-20 11:59 PM
"That is good to hear-- although boredom in any department is never a good idea. Boredom leads to wild ideas and creative accidents." He laughed, as though speaking from fond experience. "I am pleased to take the initiative where I can; it's good to have someone trust me to do so. I hope I can be a reliable Chief of Security for you, and please know that if there is anything you need from me, anything I can do to help, I am more than happy to assist." His back straightened as a note of pride entered his voice-- it was easy to see that prided himself on being someone to rely on.
Captain Syrezeaju 19-Nov-20 12:06 AM
"From what I've heard the strange ideas seem to come from tactical aboard this ship," she stated and resisted the urge to grimace upon recalling reading over a report about a tactical officer creating some sort of weaponry which ended up resulting in a section of the tactical department's armoury being blown up. Syrezeaju was certain that there was more detail involved but in truth she didn't want to know it. "Thank you, Lieutenant - and the same goes for you. Should you or your department ever need anything then please remember that I'm just a comms call away. I may not be one of security's number any more but I will more than willingly do what I can to assist if you ever need it." A smile was offered before she unlatched her hands from the grasp she had upon the back of the chair. "Now - I shouldn't hold you up for any longer. I wouldn't want to get in the way of your planning with all of those meticulous notes."
3
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 19-Nov-20 12:16 AM
A hearty laugh escaped the lieutenant. "Well I hope I can keep this department on a tighter run ship than that! We'll try not to blow any holes in your ship, Captain. Thank you for taking the time to see me, it's been a pleasure speaking with you. I look forward to serving you as best I can." He inclined his torso in a semi-formal half bow.
Captain Syrezeaju 19-Nov-20 01:02 AM
The Lieutenant's laugh was met by her own scratchy chuckle, finding equal amusement (and perhaps a little bit of nervous horror) at the possibility of holes literally being blown into the hull of the ship. With any luck - which was something the Phoenix did not seem to have much of, unfortunately - no further major tragedy would befall them. That was wishful thinking, though... And she could place bets on how that wishful thinking had likely just cursed them all. Unwilling to dwell on the possibility any longer, an appreciative incline of her head was given followed by a short wave. Then, with a precision and posture to match that of a military march but the formal approach hindered by the fact she placed her hands into the pockets of her trousers, she turned on her heel and headed out. Best to leave the poor Cardassian alone before she ended up continuing their conversation on indefinitely!
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 20-Nov-20 04:51 PM
Parlac stood, stretched, and placed his PADDS back in some semblance of order before heading out of his office.
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 23-Nov-20 11:06 PM
He slipped inside and dropped heavily into his chair. It was still not as comfortable as he would have liked, but he was getting used to it.
Commander Yllescas Itesh 24-Nov-20 04:50 PM
[D] Mail call.
Lieutenant Parlac, Beta test is operational. Come to Holodeck 3 for a demonstration. Lt. JG. König
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 24-Nov-20 04:58 PM
Parlac sighed and set the PADD down. He'd hoped to get a little more work done this morning, but he was also anxious to see what König had cooked up. He grabbed his extra large mug of gelat and headed out the door, slipping one of his PADDs into his pocket as he went.
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 24-Nov-20 07:35 PM
He stepped into his office and sat down before tapping his comm badge.
𝑨𝒏𝒈𝒖𝒊𝒍𝒍𝒊𝒇𝒐𝒓𝒎 24-Nov-20 07:58 PM
The telepath stepped up to the sliding doors, pressing whatever button needed for a ding to sound within the office. Assuming he hadn’t beaten Rekat to the room, he would soon be entering.
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 24-Nov-20 07:59 PM
"Enter!" Parlac called, pushing a few stray PADDs out of the way.
𝑨𝒏𝒈𝒖𝒊𝒍𝒍𝒊𝒇𝒐𝒓𝒎 24-Nov-20 08:08 PM
Upon the enter sounding through the intercom of the office, the doors slid open and the chief tactical officer stepped in. As invited. “Lieutenant Parlac, it’s nice to meet another department head.”* He spoke as he made quick work of the distance between the two officers, his hand out stretching for a respectful shake.
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 24-Nov-20 08:15 PM
Parlac looked up and nearly choked. Oh. He wasn't expecting... that. The Cardassian stood and took the outstretched hand for a quick, firm shake. "Lieutenant Commander. Good to meet you. Have a seat, if you like. Can I get you anything? I'm on my second gelat of the morning, myself." He gestured to a mug on the desk.
𝑨𝒏𝒈𝒖𝒊𝒍𝒍𝒊𝒇𝒐𝒓𝒎 24-Nov-20 09:32 PM
He nodded with a gentle smile on his fsce, sitting down at the seat he was gestured to. His hands interlocked in front of him before he looked towards the cardassian officer. “Oh, I would do well with <Insert Betazed Coffeee>, if it’s in the system.”
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 24-Nov-20 09:36 PM
"Certainly! I'll, uh. One moment," He seemed flustered as he stepped away to retrieve a drink from the replicator. Returning a few moments later, he placed the coffee in front of Arosio, then sat down in his own chair. "I appreciate you taking the time to stop by, Lieutenant Commander. I was hoping to discuss joint training drills with you. My ACOS has just finished working up quite a nice emergency preparedness simulation in the holodecks that I intend to run my own team through, but I thought it might be useful for us to run some simulations together-- our teams, I mean. Tactical and Security should work smoothly together, in my opinion, and I'm a firm believer in breaking down barriers, uh, between departments." The Cardassian tugged at his uniform and fiddled with a PADD as he spoke.
𝑨𝒏𝒈𝒖𝒊𝒍𝒍𝒊𝒇𝒐𝒓𝒎 24-Nov-20 09:45 PM
The frustration was clear to the empath, he wasn’t sure of the source and neither would he ask. Though empathy was an innate ability, the Betazoid generally saw it as rude to question an unusual emotion when a source is not clear. Deciding to continue on, “Thank you and it’s no hassle, I’ve been meaning to converse with other department heads as well.” He spoke before listening to the words of the cardassian chief security officer, nodding before citing a response. “While I haven’t yet had the chance to truly meet those within my department, I definitely agree with running simulations together. The more smoothly our departments learn to work together, the better their work in the field turns out to be. After all, the barrier between security and tactical is already quite thin.” Taking a sip from the coffee right after, quick enough that it did not impair a response he’d need to make. (edited)
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 24-Nov-20 10:07 PM
"Good, I'm glad you agree!" Parlac said. He slid a PADD across the desk to Arosio and accidentally knocked over his own gelat mug in the process. "Ah, slet, I'm so sorry. Let me just, I'm sorry, one moment." He bustled off to the replicator and came back with a towel. "My apologies, Lieutenant Commander." A dark blue flush tinged his forehead chufa and the ridges on his neck, embarrassment evident.
𝑨𝒏𝒈𝒖𝒊𝒍𝒍𝒊𝒇𝒐𝒓𝒎 24-Nov-20 10:10 PM
He was about to speak in response before the interruption of the gelat dotting him off, causing him to shoot up in response and back away slightly. “No, no- , it’s fine. Accidents happen.” He spoke as he pulled out a blue handkerchief from his uniforms pocket, aiding the Cardassian in the wiping of the liquids mess. Embarrassment was radiating from the officer but he didn’t need empathy to tell that one.
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 24-Nov-20 10:18 PM
Disposing of the soaked towel, Parlac sighed and returned to his seat. "I'm so sorry, sir. The PADD has all the details of our biohazard drill, if you'd like to go over it with your team and let me know if you'll be joining us. If it's too short of notice, we can simply expect you for the next drill instead. I'm hoping to make them part of our routine around here, so there will be plenty of opportunities." He coughed, and glanced down at the desk. "I assure you, I'm not normally quite so... clumsy."
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 25-Nov-20 12:53 AM
Parlac paused his conversation at the ship-wide communication. "Sounds like we should pick this up another time. Let's head up to the bridge."
𝑨𝒏𝒈𝒖𝒊𝒍𝒍𝒊𝒇𝒐𝒓𝒎 25-Nov-20 04:02 PM
Late reply but a reply no less. The Betazoid nodded, proceeding out of the office as well.
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 02-Dec-20 02:13 AM
He stepped in and sat down at his desk.
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 05-Dec-20 03:03 AM
He headed to the security armoury to get kitted out.
