He walked in. and said "Ensign Robert A. Ashwood reporting for duty Sir". (edited)
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 09-Dec-20 11:38 PM
"Hello, ensign. Take a seat, if you like." The Cardassian sat back in his chair.
Ensign Robert Ashwood 09-Dec-20 11:39 PM
"Thank you Sir". He accepted the offer and sat down.
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 09-Dec-20 11:41 PM
"I'm assuming you're familiar with standard Starfleet security protocols, so I won't bore you with details. We run bi-weekly training sessions and weapons drills here on the Phoenix, nothing out of the norm. I'm also working on some emergency preparedness drills, environmental hazards, unauthorized access to secure locations, that sort of thing, so be ready for updates on that to come." He slid a PADD across the desk. "This is your standard issue security PADD, it should have all pertinent information on it, including where to report for duty and so on. Any questions?"
Ensign Robert Ashwood 09-Dec-20 11:45 PM
"Aye Lieutenant Parlac." He took then PADD. and said "anything I should know important that have effect the ship before my arrival". "What shifts will I be on aswell". (edited)
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 09-Dec-20 11:49 PM
"Shift information will be on your PADD. As to important things that have affected the Phoenix, I'm sure there have been many, but nothing springs to mind that you would need to know immediately."

Ensign Robert Ashwood 09-Dec-20 11:50 PM
"Ok Lieutenant permission to carry on Sir"
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 09-Dec-20 11:52 PM
"Granted," he said, leaning forward slightly. "Let me know if you have any other questions or need any help settling in, otherwise, dismissed."
Ensign Robert Ashwood 09-Dec-20 11:53 PM

Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 09-Dec-20 11:56 PM
"Good day, Ensign," He gave a polite nod as the young man exited.
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 11-Dec-20 03:45 PM
Parlac stretched and cracked his neck, still not quite used to his desk chair. He decided it was time for a walk, and perhaps some food.
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 29-Dec-20 06:59 PM
He slid in through the door as it opened and immediately started looking around for where best to place Mikat. He tried setting her on the desk, but she was much too large for that. The corner by the door worked, but then he would be the only person to really enjoy the view, since everyone else would walk right past her and sit down facing away from her at his desk. If he put her on the floor in front of his desk, others could appreciate her but he would only see her when entering his office. Finally, he elected to place her right next to his desk, then he sat down in his chair and surveyed the office. Just adding one plant already brightened up the drab room and he felt just a little bit more at home than he did before. He grabbed a stack of PADDs and got to work, a smile still lingering on his face.
RemiReverie 31-Dec-20 02:48 AM
[D] The door bell chimed.
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 31-Dec-20 02:48 AM
"Enter!" Parlac called, setting down the PADD he'd been working on.
RemiReverie 31-Dec-20 02:54 AM
In walked a woman with the trademark pointed ears and long black hair. Her hands were neatly folded behind her back as her eyes scanned the room on her short trek to his desk before focusing on him. Her expression held all the typical stoicness of a Vulcan. "Lieutenant Junior Grade Lyras T'Khael reporting for duty, Sir."
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 31-Dec-20 02:55 AM
He stood up to great her and nodded politely. "Good to meet you, T'Khael. Please, have a seat."
RemiReverie 31-Dec-20 02:59 AM
She quickly took her seat, looking at her new commanding officer expectantly. She herself was disappointed about this new assignment but she wasn't about to let it show.
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 31-Dec-20 03:03 AM
He sat back down as well, leaning back in his desk chair and steepling his fingers together. "I can only assume you are already familiar with all the standard basic procedures and information about security, so I'll spare you the long version. Welcome to the Phoenix. We run bi-weekly training sessions and weapons drills here, nothing out of the norm. We had been gearing up to run emergency preparedness drills for environmental hazards and the like, but given recent events we'll be transitioning to Iconian boarding parties and bioweapon attacks. It is imperative that our department is ready and able to handle anything this conflict has to throw at us, and to that end my office is always open for any questions or suggestions. I'm not about to pull rank and pretend that as department head I am the be all and end all of security, so please do not hesitate to contact me." He leaned forward and slid a PADD across the desk to her. "This is your standard issue security PADD, it should have all pertinent information on it, including where to report for duty and so on. Any questions?"
RemiReverie 31-Dec-20 03:22 AM
She had heard snippets on her trip over about the new Iconian threat. It was only logical for them to gear themself towards that. At least her parents could rest easy, knowing she wouldn't be on the frontlines if there was a war. She found her new commanding officer to be quite friendly and open minded so far. Perhaps, this would be a nice assignment after all. She picked up the PADD and looked it over a moment before returning her gaze to the man before her. "Thank you, Sir. I will not disappoint you. I do not have any questions at this time, but I will certainly come to you if I think of any. As long as that is okay, of course." (edited)
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 31-Dec-20 03:24 AM
"Absolutely, Lieutenant." He shifted in his seat, shoulders relaxing as he transitioned to a more casual tone. "If you don't mind, I would like to know your preferred pronouns and how you like to be called."
RemiReverie 31-Dec-20 03:30 AM
"Certainly. I use feminine pronouns for myself. As for what to call me, either T'Khael or Lyras will be sufficient. I don't have a major preference."
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 31-Dec-20 03:33 AM
"Good to know," he said as he made a note on a PADD. It appeared to contain a list of security personal and their preferred pronouns on it. "Thank you, Lieutenant. Keep an eye on your PADD, I'll be sending out a note soon for team drills. If there is nothing else, you are dismissed."
RemiReverie 31-Dec-20 03:35 AM
"Thank you, Sir. I promise I will be present and accounted for. I am looking forward to working with you." She nodded and gave a small smile before walking out the door.
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 31-Dec-20 11:22 PM
Upon receiving the comm from Captain Syrezeaju, Parlac stood, stretched, and excited his office.
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 16-Jan-21 09:12 PM
[D] Parlac had been stubbornly sat behind his desk since the promotion and subsequent declaration of war. He had too much work to do to consider anything else right now, and tried not to think about the messages he'd received on his personal PADD congratulating him and wanting to celebrate. There would be time for celebrations later.
Otomo 16-Jan-21 09:14 PM
Freshly arrived on the Phoenix, Dominic made his way to the chief's office soon after slinging down his small duffle-bag of personal possessions at his quarters. The tall human rang the chime to the office and waited.
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 16-Jan-21 09:15 PM
"Enter!" Parlac called, keeping his tone even. He didn't welcome the interruption, but truth be told he hadn't stood up for... longer than he cared to admit.

Dom entered the office, giving a quick glance around to note the details of the room before standing at at tention in front of Parlac. "Ensign Dominic Styles, reporting for duty, sir."
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 16-Jan-21 09:18 PM
"At ease, Ensign. Take a seat," He stood himself, stretching for a moment and heading for the replicator. "Anything to drink?"
Otomo 16-Jan-21 09:20 PM
He moved to what appeared to be an appropriate guest chair and seated himself. "Sure. Wouldn't mind a cola. Thanks."
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 16-Jan-21 09:22 PM
He looked back over his shoulder and quirked a single brow in question. "A... cola? Alright. I assume that's a human drink I'm not familiar with." He turned back to the replicator and moments later turned around with a glass of dark, carbonated liquid in one hand and a piping hot cup of red leaf tea in the other. The chief stepped back over to his desk and sat down, sliding the cola across the desk to the ensign. "Welcome aboard, Ensign Styles."
Otomo 16-Jan-21 09:26 PM
"Yes. Sugary and with caffeine. Makes for a perfect pick me up for duty shifts." He took the drink into his hand and a sip. "Thank you, sir. I gotta admit I don't know much about the Phoenix. I take the assignment I'm given and I don't really have any pull with the brass."
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 16-Jan-21 09:28 PM
"That's fairly standard for ensigns," Parlac chuckled and handed him a PADD, "This is your standard issue security PADD, it should have all pertinent information on it, including where to report for duty and so on. I'm assuming you're familiar with standard Starfleet security protocols, so I won't bore you with details. We run bi-weekly training sessions and weapons drills here on the Phoenix, nothing out of the norm. I'm also working on some emergency preparedness drills, environmental hazards, unauthorized access to secure locations, that sort of thing, so be ready for updates on that to come. Any questions?"
Otomo 16-Jan-21 09:33 PM
Another quick chug of his drink and he set it down to take the PADD. "Shooting drills sounds fun. Ever need someone to do some long-ranged sniping with a phaser rifle, I'm your guy. Used to toy around with enhancing scopes and shoot at tribbles from two klicks out." He paused to consider questions. "Any idea where we're headed? Just so I can get an idea and prepare for what we might be doing?"
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 16-Jan-21 09:38 PM
"I appreciate the eagerness, but as we haven't left ESD yet, we don't have a heading. I might be senior staff, but I'm not precognizant," Parlac laughed again, "Now, if you don't mind, I'd like to know your preferred pronouns and how you like to be called." He was holding a PADD and looked prepared to type on it.
Otomo 16-Jan-21 09:41 PM
Dom grinned. "I'm as man as you can get. As far as what to call me, that's your prerogative, sir. Drill instructor called me 'shithead' at the academy, not my favorite of all time. My friends call me 'Dom'." (edited)
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 16-Jan-21 09:44 PM
Another brow quirk, though the chief's expression was pretty unreadable. "I assume that's... he/him then," he said, noting it down on his PADD, "Alright, that about covers it. If you don't have any other questions, dismissed."
Otomo 16-Jan-21 09:45 PM
Dom stood, placing his pad under his arm. "Thank you, sir." He gave a small nod as he made his way to the door.
RemiReverie 17-Jan-21 02:43 AM
To: Lieutenant Commander Rekat Parlac From: Lieutenant Junior Grade Lyras T'Khael Commander, I regret that I have to inform you of the unprofessional attitude of Ensign Dominic Stylas. As you have over heard, he made a slight but concerning remark about your race. I proceeded to advise him on considering how his words affect others. He then proceeded to tell me that you would 'get over it'. As I continued to address this concerning behavior, he implied that his views were fine because he was a talented officer. His continuation of reafirming that his comments were no big deal and this comment cause me to scold him vigorously. His comments upset me as I have been self conscious of how others view me because of my heritage. His blantent disregard for his actions infuriated me. After scolding him I proceeded to remove myself from the situation as I was rather heated and I could not act with clarity being so enraged. As I was walking away, the Ensign felt it was appropriate to tell the other Ensigns that he 'thinks that I like him'. If I were to describe how infuriating that comment made me I would be writting this report for days. As such a consumption of time on this topic is illogical considering how much more work we will have in the upcoming days, I will not include it in this report. I would appreciate that his vulgar attitude is addressed promptly. I leave this matter in your capable hands. Sincerely, Lieutenant Junior Grade Lyras T'Khael

Lt. Cmdr. Amanda Higgins 18-Jan-21 05:30 PM
To: Lt. Cmdr. Parlac From: Lt. Cmdr. Higgins, CEO
>
Hello Commander,
>
I apologize that I need to send this message to you, but I felt it necessary after having an interesting interaction with one of your new Ensigns. Ensign Dominic Styles and I were in the gym and he said several things that brought into question his behavior and his desire to be in Starfleet as a whole. He expressed to me that the reason he chose to go to Starfleet Academy was for protection from his former crew who were out to kill him. He essentially alluded to me that he was a thief in his former life and his crew turned on him, so he thought Starfleet would offer him the ability to "not be killed." While that in it of itself is not terribly concerning, misguided as it is, what he said before this was my biggest issue. He stated to me that all he was here for was to "point and shoot" things. I and you both know that this is not what Security is about, and I don't think Mr. Styles seems to grasp that. If you want me to be frank, I am unsure how he made it through the Academy with such an attitude. Obviously it's not my intention to make more work for you, but I felt it necessary to mention this as it seems he has already ruffled a few feathers in just the short amount of time he has been here. If you have any further questions, feel free to message me and I'd be happy to elaborate further.
>
Sincerely,
>
Lt. Cmdr. Amanda Higging, CEO
5
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 18-Jan-21 05:39 PM
[D] Neither the report filed by Lieutenant T'Khael nor the note dropped by Higgins boded well for the new ensign, and Parlac sighed and pinched the bridge of his nose, fighting back a mounting headache. He would need to put both in Dom's file, and they'd likely be brought up at his next review. Headstrong ensigns were unfortunately a dime a dozen and he was well-prepared to deal with Styles-- he just didn't particularly want to deal with it right now, at the crux of a promotion, a war, and what looked to be a fairly dangerous mission with Intel. It was time for something stronger than tea: he moved to the replicator and retrieved a large mug of steaming hot gelat, then sat back down with a PADD and got back to work.

Lieutenant Jayne Walsh 18-Jan-21 06:49 PM

Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 18-Jan-21 07:07 PM
"Nothing particularly exciting for our current situation, just standard weapons drills and emergency preparedness, that sort of thing. Generally our officers are doing well, although I doubt I'm the first person they'd come to if they had an issue, given our expert counselors aboard. I plan to implement some check in and review meetings to ensure peak mental health as we enter into a declared war," He raised an eyebrow at the string of questions, but continued to answer them. "I can't think of anything you'd need to know before getting started that isn't on that PADD, and I don't make a habit of requesting specialized work from officers under my command until I've gotten to know them well enough to determine their strengths and weaknesses. For now, I'd recommend getting back into a routine on the Phoenix, meet up with other members of security, and focus on being prepared."

Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 18-Jan-21 08:39 PM

Lieutenant Jayne Walsh 18-Jan-21 08:44 PM

Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 18-Jan-21 08:46 PM

Lieutenant Jayne Walsh 18-Jan-21 08:58 PM
She nodded and headed off for the brig.
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 19-Jan-21 01:09 AM
[D] The chief had been at his desk for far too long. His gelat had long since gone cold and the caffeine wasn't doing as much to keep him energized as he had hoped. It was time, he thought, for bed. After giving Mikat some water per the care instructions provided by Sara, he exited his office.
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 19-Jan-21 09:57 PM
He stepped into his office and sat down at his desk. A series of PADDs was strewn across the surface and he made an attempt at organizing them. Each PADD contained the Starfleet file for different security officers. Arranged by rank, the chief had been working through the roster to determine which would be best to take with Intel on their tracking mission. The thought of what awaited them at the end of the journey sent a cold shiver down his spine and put a knot in his belly-- there were so many young ensigns in Security right now, and Noi... Well, he was fairly certain it wouldn't be pretty. The Cardassian mulled over different PADDs as he sipped his gelat. Oskar was both Intel and ACOS, that worked out quite nicely. In addition, perhaps... Three more officers? Plus himself, of course. That would be a total of three Intelligence officers and four Security officers, with Oskar counting for both. It was a small enough team to fly under the radar, but still enough to be effective when they reached their target-- he hoped. What little information had been provided during the staff meeting hadn't been encouraging, and the dossier on Noi was disturbing to say the least. He had never been one to shy away from danger, but he wasn't foolhardy either. The entire team was going to have to run smoothly and work well together to pull this off. In his estimation, that meant he couldn't afford to bring along any hot-headed officers. One of the files that really stood out to him, Jaime Devereux, looked quite promising. They'd been on the Phoenix long enough to not be "new" and they seemed quite cool-headed under pressure. That was undoubtedly going to be an essential skill, the upcoming mission looked to be nothing but pressure. He considered, briefly, selecting the security team ahead of time, but for a mission of this caliber it seemed only fair to allow volunteers. He hoped Ensign Devereux would be among them.
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 19-Jan-21 11:11 PM
Parlac's ears perked up at the sound of Klingon cussing in the hall. His legs needed a stretch anyway, so he stood and went to investigate.
3
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 20-Jan-21 02:31 AM
He entered his office and indicated the chairs near his desk to the officers. "Have a seat! Kanar, then? And I'll see if I have any blood wine down here, though the bottles I keep in my office aren't as nice as the ones I keep in my quarters, they're still better than synthetic stuff."
SuvwI' wa'DIch Talom RragoH BOT 20-Jan-21 02:32 AM
She sat down heavily in one of the chairs and looked around. 'Do you Federation senior officers live in your offices?" She asked, noticing the sheer quantity of PADDs.
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 20-Jan-21 02:34 AM
Parlac laughed. He was currently digging through a cabinet at the back of his office and held a recognizable twisted kanar bottle in one hand, but he called over his shoulder in answer: "Not all, no, but I do spend more time here than my own quarters. Which is why it's so dark and warm-- Cardassian preferences being what they are."
Sogh Nishi Kholl BOT 20-Jan-21 02:36 AM
She took the other seat, also surveying the room and watching as Parlac brought out the bottle. "Oh, I understand. I did notice your ship is quite... bright."
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 20-Jan-21 02:39 AM
"In all my years serving, that has consistently been my top complaint about Starfleet. Everything is too bright and too cold. My office and my quarters are both set to much darker lights, warmer temperatures, and higher humidity-- I do apologize, Talom, if it's at all uncomfortable for you." The chief joined them, now carrying a motley assortment of glasses in one hand, and the kanar in the other. "Additional apologies given that I neglected to bring any bloodwine down to my office, I only have a few bottles down here and it's mostly kanar and some spring wines."
SuvwI' wa'DIch Talom RragoH BOT 20-Jan-21 02:43 AM
"It takes more than a bit of hot air to make a Klingon uncomfortable." Talom dismissed, as she was indeed relatively comfortable. "Qo'noS has extreme weather of all kinds, and I would not begrudge a host their right to adjust their own space to their comfort." She explained, eyeing the so-called spring wine.
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 20-Jan-21 02:45 AM
Parlac set about pouring kanar into three glasses and passing them around. "2341, a good vintage. Not the best, but full-bodied and delightfully viscous-- well, delightful if you like kanar, I suppose."
Sogh Nishi Kholl BOT 20-Jan-21 02:49 AM
She took the offered drink. "I'm sure it's wonderful. And better than anything synthetic." Before drinking, she raised the glass. "[Whatever cheers is in Cardassian] and 'IwlIj jachjaj to you both."
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 20-Jan-21 02:51 AM
He raised his in response and knocked the kanar back in one gulp. It burned in a pleasant and familiar way that Parlac was quite fond of, and he was pleased to share it with another Cardassian who would appreciate it. Granted, Talom would also probably appreciate it, given what she thought of synthahol.
SuvwI' wa'DIch Talom RragoH BOT 20-Jan-21 02:52 AM
"'IwlIj jachjaj!" She'd also knocked her kanar back in one gulp, and while the taste and texture were horrifying, it did pack quite a punch, and that was all that mattered. "Ah. That's better. Now. Did you really want to hear the so-called eyepatch story?"
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 20-Jan-21 02:53 AM
"I would be delighted!" He spoke honestly, leaning forward in his seat and clearly prepared for an epic.
Sogh Nishi Kholl BOT 20-Jan-21 02:54 AM
She simply tipped back her drink, settling deeper into the seat and preparing for the story she had heard many times before.
SuvwI' wa'DIch Talom RragoH BOT 20-Jan-21 02:57 AM
Kholl had indeed heard the story many times before, and likely knew it didn't end the way most expected for something called the eyepatch story. She grinned broadly and leaned forward. "The year was 2448. I was visiting Vulcan to attend a conference on Interplanetary Martial Arts - don’t laugh until you’ve had one of those peace-lovers challenge you to a friendly fight and come out the other side with half the nerves in your body unresponsive. They’ve made non-lethal battle into an art form." She began in a low voice, miming a couple of suus mahna moves. "I and my be'nal [wife] went to the so-called Forge, where Vulcans are known to test themselves against the elements, so that we could see what they call strength, and during our visit I caught the attention of a le-matya. When it ran at me, what do you believe I did?"
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 20-Jan-21 02:59 AM
"I'm going to guess you didn't run," he laughed. "I wouldn't want to face one of those, they're nasty!"
SuvwI' wa'DIch Talom RragoH BOT 20-Jan-21 03:05 AM
She banged on the desk and nodded simultaneously. "Indeed I did not run! Though I carried no weapons, I met it in battle! It was a fearsome fight indeed. That creature had the strength of ten targs, and poison claws! Many times its jaws closed inches from my throat, but I held my ground, and was able to snap its neck!" She leaned back again. "And so I emerged victorious - but then, in its death-throes, the creature struck me!" She mimed a slash over the scars on the left side of her face, and paused for dramatic effect. "Fortunately it just...missed... my eye. The mark on my visage that you now see, which I had to then convince the Vulcans I wanted to keep, serves as a reminder - there is no training that can overcome the power of nature itself." She shrugged. "And that's the eyepatch story." She said, which bore no relevance to anything.
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 20-Jan-21 03:10 AM
"So, wait-- you're telling me that you did battle with a le-matya and won but it struck you in its death-throes? And on top of that, it missed your eye? What is the eyepatch for, if you retain a working eye?" He was incredulous, but clearly vastly entertained by the story, and refilled her glass with more kanar as he spoke.
SuvwI' wa'DIch Talom RragoH BOT 20-Jan-21 03:11 AM
She chuckled sagely. "bIQapqu'meHtarDaSop 'e' DatIvnIS! [To really succeed, you must enjoy eating poison.]" She said, which clarified absolutely fucking nothing, before sipping at the kanar. Vile stuff, even when gifted. "You see?"
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 20-Jan-21 03:16 AM
"I'm afraid I don't, but it was a hell of a story nonetheless," He turned to refill Nishi's glass as well. "And what about you? Any good stories from your time in the KDF?"
SuvwI' wa'DIch Talom RragoH BOT 20-Jan-21 03:22 AM
"I don't see what needs clarifying." She said, and also lied, making a mental note to switch what side the eyepatch was on sometime in the future.
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 20-Jan-21 03:24 AM
[D] Parlac's commbadge crackled to life with the voice of Commander Dunamis. "Oh! I'm afraid it looks like we'll have to cut this short-- sounds like there's trouble in the bar," He looked at Nishi, "Didn't you mention someone in the bar you had concerns about?"
Sogh Nishi Kholl BOT 20-Jan-21 03:26 AM
A loud sigh. "That would be SuvwI' cha'DIch Nemo." She replied. "I wouldn't bet against this having something to do with her and her damned knives."

Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 20-Jan-21 03:27 AM
"Well, it sounds like a pretty safe bet to me. Feel free to accompany me, if you like." He stood and headed for the door.
SuvwI' wa'DIch Talom RragoH BOT 20-Jan-21 03:27 AM
Talom stood. "If all else fails, I shall carry her back to the transporter room myself." She offered casually, following Rekat.
Sogh Nishi Kholl BOT 20-Jan-21 03:27 AM

Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 28-Jan-21 04:15 PM
He stepped in and surveyed the room. There had been no time to speak to someone about care for Mikat in his absence, but the massive pink blooms indicated she had flourished in spite of him. He set about watering the orchid, then retrieved a large, steaming hot mug of gelat from the replicator. The Cardassian heaved himself into his chair and surveyed the pile of PADDs littering his desk. That would need to be organized and cleaned up, but he didn't particularly care to at the moment. Instead, he leaned back and sipped his gelat. Reports would be written later.
JDonovan2000 28-Jan-21 04:28 PM
Jacob found himself outside his new CO's office, ready to report for duty and officially begin his time on the USS Phoenix. He knocked on the sliding door.
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 28-Jan-21 04:33 PM
"Enter!" Parlac called out, shuffling a few PADDS around into a stack.
JDonovan2000 28-Jan-21 04:36 PM
The door slides open and Jacob steps through into the office. "Ensign Jacob Holmes reporting for duty, Commander." He was not sure what his next moves should be so just stood there.
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 28-Jan-21 04:38 PM
"Ensign Holmes, good to meet you. Please, have a seat." He gestured to one of the chairs in front of his desk.
JDonovan2000 28-Jan-21 04:40 PM
"Yes sir." Jacob approached and sat down at one of the chairs in front of Rekat's desk. He looked around, taking in the sight of the office.
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 28-Jan-21 04:43 PM
"I can only assume you are already familiar with all the standard basic procedures and information about security, so I'll spare you the long version. Welcome to the Phoenix. We run bi-weekly training sessions and weapons drills here, nothing out of the norm," The chief steepled his fingers together and observed the young ensign. "We had been gearing up to run emergency preparedness drills for environmental hazards and the like, but given recent events we'll be transitioning to Iconian boarding parties and bioweapon attacks. It is imperative that our department is ready and able to handle anything this conflict has to throw at us, and to that end my office is always open for any questions or suggestions." A PADD was slid across the desk to Jacob. "This is your standard issue security PADD, it should have all pertinent information on it, including where to report for duty and so on. Any questions so far?"
JDonovan2000 28-Jan-21 04:45 PM
"No sir, all seems good so far." Jacob looked at the PADD and placed it on his lap, deciding to delve into it while he was in his quarters, some alone time and reading to catch up on.
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 28-Jan-21 04:47 PM
Parlac leaned back in his seat and transitioned to a more casual, friendly tone. "Good. If you don't mind, I would like to know your preferred pronouns and how you like to be called."
JDonovan2000 28-Jan-21 04:50 PM
Jacob smiled and felt a bit more relaxed as well. "Please, call me Jacob or Jake. It doesn't matter. And last time I checked it was most definitely a he and a him." Jacob jokingly patted his body and looked down at it, before looking up again. (edited)
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 28-Jan-21 04:53 PM
"What you look like doesn't determine preferred pronouns, Ensign," he said, a hint of reproach in his voice, "Rigelians have five genders, I simply can't afford to assume." Notes were added to a PADD as he spoke before he looked back up. "Well, that covers everything. If you have no questions, you're free to get started with your shift."
JDonovan2000 28-Jan-21 04:58 PM
Jacob was wondering what he was writing on his PADD, but dismissed the idea that it could have been anything bad for that small joke. It did sound like he was being reproached though. "Sorry, Commander. And no, that's all." Jacob got out the seat feeling like that could have gone better. "Thank you."
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 28-Jan-21 05:01 PM
It wasn't hard to miss the expression on the ensign's face. He turned the PADD around to display a list of security personnel with pronouns next to their names. "It helps me keep track, that's all." He offered a smile. "I'm here if you need anything. Otherwise, dismissed."
JDonovan2000 28-Jan-21 05:03 PM
Jacob left the office feeling more at ease, and decided to make his way to the Security hub to better his whereabouts of where he was and where all of the equipment werem

Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 28-Jan-21 05:36 PM

"Unfortunately, what happens with Noi is now completely out of my hands. Technically, the mission was entirely under Starfleet Intelligence; security was just along for support. I was the commanding officer on the away team, but now that we're back on the Phoenix, things return to the normal chain of command. I'll be writing up my report later today to submit to the captain." He paused to take a sip of the steaming liquid before continuing. "I'm glad to hear you're taking your physical health seriously, but I do want to strongly recommend taking some time to meet with a counsellor. Especially if you haven't spoken with one since coming aboard-- taking care of your mental health is just as important."

One hand rubbed the back of his neck ruefully as he smiled. "I am feeling much better, and most of my hearing has returned."

He tipped back the rest of his gelat and set the empty mug aside. "Unfortunately, I'm going to need to get to work on this report. Is there anything else I can do for you, Ensign?"

Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 28-Jan-21 06:27 PM
"Have a good day, Ensign," Parlac called after his retreating back. Well, there was no putting it off any longer: he began to work on his report.
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 03-Feb-21 06:06 PM
[D] Parlac stood and stretched. He'd been seated at his desk for far too long-- in fact, he had slept here the previous night, buried in PADDs and compiling his report on recent events. He wondered if the captain was going to ask to speak about the mission again, given the state of mind he'd been in when she'd visited in sickbay. It wasn't out of the question, so he grabbed the PADD with his finalized report and slipped it into his pocket before heading out the door.
Ensign Alyx Morgan 06-Feb-21 01:44 PM
[D] Ding! A message appeared on Parlac's console and probably also his PADD.
To: Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac From: Ens. Alyx Morgan
>
Dear Commander Parlac,
>
Please message me back letting me know when it would be convenient for me to install signage on your office's replicator so I don't accidentally disturb your work.
>
Sincerely,
>
Ensign Alyx Morgan, Quartermaster, USS Phoenix.
Ensign Alyx Morgan 09-Feb-21 03:13 PM
They entered and looked around briefly to see if anyone was home, before going straight over to the replicator. They pulled a sheet of two decals out of their satchel, before peeling off the first and applying it to one side of the replicator while using a small paddle to remove any air bubbles. After applying the first they repeated the process for the second. After completing the installation they stepped back to make sure the decals were level, before heading back out into the hallway, having not left a single trace of their visit apart from the shiny new informational signage. (edited)
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 09-Feb-21 05:07 PM
Parlac stepped in, attended to Mikat, and then sat down at his desk to begin work for the day.
Lieutenant Oskar König 09-Feb-21 05:10 PM

Commander, Do you have a few minutes to talk? I realize I left in a hurry and wish to clarify a few things. Lieutenant König, USS Phoenix

Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 09-Feb-21 05:17 PM

[Comms] “I’ll be down shortly, sir. König out.”
[D] Door chime noises.
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 09-Feb-21 05:24 PM
"Enter!"
Lieutenant Oskar König 09-Feb-21 07:16 PM
Oskar entered the office, looking a bit more rested, the bags under his eyes weren’t so dark. He even stood straighter. “Sir. Thank you for seeing me.” He rubbed the back of his head. “I’m sorry about not saying much about my departure. I wanted to speak with you about that.”
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 09-Feb-21 07:20 PM
"Good to see you, Lieutenant! Please, have a seat. Can I get you anything to eat or drink?" The chief was half-way out of his chair already, clearly on his way to the replicator whether Oskar wanted anything or not.
Lieutenant Oskar König 09-Feb-21 07:24 PM
“Tea, please. I’ve been trying to cut back on the thousands of cups of coffee I drink in any given week during this war.”
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 09-Feb-21 07:30 PM
"Good choice," Parlac spoke over his shoulder, replicated two mugs of red leaf and bringing them back over to the desk. "Here you are. One of my favorites. Now, you said you wanted to discuss your departure from the ACOS seat?"
Lieutenant Oskar König 09-Feb-21 07:35 PM
“Thank you.” He said and took the tea from Parlac, taking a long sip and giving a soft sigh when he finished. “Well. Let me start by saying that it wasn’t exactly a voluntary decision. I took your advice and called a counselor, after the mission. The topic of work load came up. I think that poor counselor changed color when I told her what I did here.”
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 09-Feb-21 07:37 PM
"I'm glad you took the time to speak with someone," he said, tone serious, "Although I can guess what's coming now, I don't regret suggesting you speak to a counsellor. Your mental and physical health should always be priority. I hope you don't think you've disappointed me or let me down. I'm proud of everything you've done for me so far, and I'm far more proud that you are willing to be open and honest with yourself about your limits." He smiled kindly over the rim of his mug.
Lieutenant Oskar König 09-Feb-21 07:41 PM
“I wasn’t exactly happy with the decision. It took that counselor two hours of talking to convince me to hand in the towel. And to be honest? I thought I had disappointed you. For a while, at least.”
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 09-Feb-21 07:45 PM
"Understandable. I think it would take an awful lot of talking to convince me to step down for my own health as well, so I can only imagine," Blue eyes filled with concern regarded the much younger man thoughtfully. "I hope that nothing I've said or done fed into you feeling that you'd disappointed me. If it did, I apologize. You've been an excellent ACOS, König, I couldn't be happier with your performance, but it is my duty to place the well-being of my officers first, and I would be remiss if I forgot that." (edited)
Lieutenant Oskar König 09-Feb-21 08:01 PM
“It was nothing you said, sir. More like it was me. I told myself that I wouldn’t quit on this job. I didn’t allow myself to slack, trying to balance the duties of being your ACOS and my own Intelligence duties...it was challenging but rewarding. Even though I’m not the ACOS anymore, I had intentions for us to speak to Lieutenant t’Tumisa about the events of the station. But I’ve not seen her anywhere, have you?”
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 09-Feb-21 08:04 PM
"I believe the captain is planning to speak with her, actually. She seems to have made herself scarce around here since we've returned, presumably in anticipation of whatever comes of the captain's meeting." The change of subject was unanticipated, but Parlac assumed that if there was anything else König wanted to add regarding his departure, he would say so.
Lieutenant Oskar König 09-Feb-21 08:10 PM
“Not a wise move. It would only worsen the Captain’s ire on the subject.” He sipped his tea again. “How have you been? Since your recovery from the mission, sir? You got hit harder than most of us.”
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 09-Feb-21 08:22 PM
"Agreed, but if she wants to make things worse for herself I'm not going to stop her," he commented, mirroring König's action with his own sip. "I've been much improved, however. My hearing is almost fully back to normal, and I am going to start speaking to one our ship's counsellors on a weekly or semi-weekly basis. The Chimera assignments have me acting as CO during deployments of the vessel, so I'll likely need to start spending some time getting familiarized with that process."
Lieutenant Oskar König 09-Feb-21 08:35 PM
“The Chimera is a good ship. It’s easy to command. Since I spent most of my time of the Bridge I learned a bit more about commanding. Though I wouldn’t want to try it while being shot at. I’m still learning and I’m not experienced enough yet.”
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 09-Feb-21 08:42 PM
"You'll get there one day, if that's the path you want. I have full confidence in you, König. You're good at what you do, reliable, prompt, organized, efficient, and a hard worker. I expect to see you in a captain's chair one day-- or heading Starfleet Intelligence, I suppose." He grinned broadly at Oskar and tipped back the last of his tea.
Lieutenant Oskar König 09-Feb-21 08:50 PM
Oskar tipped back the last of his tea as well. “I’d like to get in the chair of one of the Eclipse class cruisers. Sleek, yet stylish. One of the best cruisers Intelligence has in stock right now, and I imagine the crews are working overtime with the war.”
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 09-Feb-21 08:59 PM
"I'm sure you'd do a phenomenal job, though we'd miss your presence here, I can guarantee," The mug was placed down on the table next to stack of PADDS and the chief steepled his fingers together. "Ah well, the orchid always blooms, as they say. I can only assure you I am eager to watch you succeed, whether that be as my ACOS or as a brilliant Intelligence officer makes no difference to me."
Lieutenant Oskar König 09-Feb-21 09:12 PM
Oskar set his mug down as well, a soft smile on his face as Parlac spoke. “You honor me with your words, sir. I just do my job and hope I do it well. That’s all I really can do. I’ve actually been trying to develop a computer virus designed for Iconian computer systems, but with the little we do know it’s way more complicated than the computation theory I work in.”
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 09-Feb-21 09:24 PM
"Given the performance of Hornet and Scalpel, I've no doubt you'll be able to succeed eventually. Anything that can give us an edge over the Iconians is welcome, I'd say." He leaned forward in his seat. "I have to ask, how are things with Lieutenant Bjørge? Going well, I hope?"
1
Lieutenant Oskar König 09-Feb-21 09:37 PM
Oskar raised his eyebrow slightly at this. “Just fine, sir. After she found out I lied to her about the mission we went on, we made up and smoothed it over. Why do you ask?”
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 09-Feb-21 09:59 PM
"Good to hear, I'm glad you've moved forward. Couples that are able to discuss their problems are stronger for it, I should think. Communication and all that." He nodded sagely, as though he had experience in relationships from which to dole out advice. He did not, but that didn't stop him. "I presume the lie regarding the mission had to do with danger levels?"
Lieutenant Oskar König 09-Feb-21 10:03 PM
Oskar had to do his best to hold back a laugh. He did admittedly blush a light pink. “Sir? You think- You think that Sara and I are dating?” He asked, smiling. “We’re just friends, sir. But yes, I lied because of the danger. Also because of what we saw there.”
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 09-Feb-21 10:20 PM
"You're... You're not dating?" His brow furrowed in confusion. "But, you were alone together, in night clothes, when I stopped by with Yule gifts. And the way she speaks about you-- I apologize, it just seemed-- Well, clearly Terrans are more confusing than I initially thought."
1
Lieutenant Oskar König 09-Feb-21 10:25 PM
“We’re best friends, sir. We don’t always get into uniform when we hang out.” Oskar paused for a second as he thought about what Parlac said. “How...does she speak of me, exactly?”
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 09-Feb-21 10:44 PM
"I may not be versed on all the intricacies of Terran culture, but I know what a bathrobe is and also what one typically wears under it. Granted, I only know because I wore my gifted red bathrobe over my uniform and down to the mess hall and I was politely informed, but I still know." He grunted and shifted his weight until he felt more comfortable. "However, if you are merely... friends, I should think the manner in which she speaks of you would come as no surprise to you, hm?"
Lieutenant Oskar König 09-Feb-21 10:59 PM
“I wouldn’t know, sir. I don’t have ears all throughout the ship.” Oskar said with a soft laugh. “I assume you two met after your recovery in sickbay. I consider her my best friend onboard. She’s one of my only friends, but still.”
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 09-Feb-21 11:09 PM
"She speaks highly of you. In fact, so highly that I assumed, apparently incorrectly, that she must have feelings for you." He chuckled then, remembering some of his own past misunderstandings on the subject. "I am no expert in these matters, so I suppose it makes sense that I would misconstrue this sort of thing. Who is she dating, then? She definitely mentioned a partner to me, I'm sure of that."
Lieutenant Oskar König 10-Feb-21 01:50 AM
Oskar blinked a couple times. If what Parlac said was true, even slightly. No, no she didn’t. They were friends, no matter his own feelings. Parlac even said that he could be wrong. “She was dating Lieutenant Voran in Engineering, but they broke up before the war started. I’ve not seen much of him, either.”
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 10-Feb-21 01:52 AM
"I see. How did you feel about Lieutenant Voran and Lieutenant Bjørge's relationship? Curiosity, you understand, I've just so little knowledge of Terran customs." The expression on his face did not betray his ulterior motives, but the chief had a hunch and he was going to poke at it.
Lieutenant Oskar König 10-Feb-21 02:12 AM
“They were a good pair for each other. But she told me that they didn’t communicate enough, and that is one of the things that led to them separating.” Oskar leaned back in his chair. He hadn’t seen Parlac take an interest in personal relationships before, but Oskar had come down here for a personal call.
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 10-Feb-21 02:23 AM
"So you thought they worked well together? Unfortunate it didn't turn out well, I suppose. Poor communication, hm?" He nodded thoughtfully. "Ah well, that means I can introduce her to my friend Sutal. He's a Vulcan microbiologist, she expressed interest in meeting him when I first came aboard. More tea?"
Lieutenant Oskar König 10-Feb-21 02:37 AM
“Oh, yes please.” Oskar said and cleared his throat. “She does like Vulcans, I’ll have to admit. She used to hang around uh...what’s his name? The Vulcan that was in Tactical for a while. I can’t remember his name for some reason. He used to be here a while.”
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 10-Feb-21 03:08 AM
"She mentioned, yes! I showed her a picture, she quite liked him." Parlac stood and strode to the replicator, mugs in hand, only to return a few moments later with more tea. He handed a mug to Oskar and sat back down in his chair. "Careful, it's hot. What about you, hm? If not Miss Sara, is there someone else? Isn't that... Earth holiday about chocolate hearts coming up?" (edited)
Lieutenant Oskar König 10-Feb-21 03:23 AM
Oskar took his mug and looked down into the liquid. He blew on it lightly before taking a sip. “Valentines Day? I believe so, yes. But uh...wait. Are you asking me if I’m interested in Sara, Commander? I’ve never taken you for one to play matchmaker before.”
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 10-Feb-21 03:33 AM
"Well, it sounds like you're not interested in her, so I was asking if you were seeing anyone else. But, since you've brought it up-- are you? Interested in Sara?" He gave the younger man a pointed glance over the top of his mug.
Lieutenant Oskar König 10-Feb-21 03:51 AM
Oskar took a sip of his tea and sighed softly. “I won’t lie to you, sir. I can’t say I don’t. She’s been there for me for...since I’ve been here. She helped me after Momo, after I split ties with my father, everything. I can’t really help it. She’s been my friend forever. But I’m much too embarrassed to say anything. I don’t want to ruin what we have.”
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 10-Feb-21 04:01 AM
"I see. So, presumably, you'd rather I don't introduce her to my very attractive Vulcan friend?" Tea was stirred and sipped as the Cardassian regarded Oskar, studying his face for any cracks in the proverbial mask.
Lieutenant Oskar König 10-Feb-21 04:18 AM
Oskar looked at Parlac from behind his mug as he took a sip. “Take it as you will, sir. But yes, I’d much prefer it if you were to leave him out of future conversation with Sara.” Oskar ran a hand through his hair as he finished off his tea.
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 10-Feb-21 04:24 AM
"Indeed. Might it also be safe to assume that she is unaware of your feelings?" Evidently, Parlac didn't intend to hold any punches with his former ACSO. The chief sipped his tea and smiled, enjoying the conversation far more than he probably ought to.
Lieutenant Oskar König 10-Feb-21 04:35 AM
“Yes. She is unaware of my feelings and I’d like for it to stay that way. But you have that look in your eye that spells no good.” Oskar said, setting the mug on the table. “I sure hope you aren’t planning on telling her, right?”
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 10-Feb-21 04:40 AM
"I wouldn't dream of it. But I am going to encourage you to speak to her yourself. Be honest with her. I have a feeling you'll be pleased you did." He gazed at the orchid Sara had given him and sighed wistfully. "Not all of us are given to be able to pursue what we want. Don't waste the opportunities that present themselves to you so plainly."
Lieutenant Oskar König 10-Feb-21 04:54 AM
Oskar nodded, perhaps a bit defeatedly. He had been holding it off for so long, trying to reconcile his feelings about himself in another relationship with a person he cares deeply about. But then again. Isn’t that what relationships are for? “Perhaps I will, sir. I’ve held off saying it for a log. While. I care too deeply about it.”
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 10-Feb-21 04:13 PM
"That is all the more reason to say something. Don't let yourself fall into the trap of saying nothing because you care too much-- say something. Of course, I can't give you much information on what to say or how to say it, given my... personal lack of expertise in the area. But I can tell you that you'll regret it if you don't." Parlac finished off his second mug of red leaf and was now rolling the mug between his hands, savoring the residual warmth. While it was not, by any stretch, an area he had much experience with, he felt still some gut pull that he ought to say something to Oskar while he could. "I suppose I've probably pushed your boundaries enough for one day, hm? I appreciate your willingness to listen to advice from a grumpy old bachelor." He smiled and chuckled.
Lieutenant Oskar König 10-Feb-21 10:23 PM
Oskar smiled and chuckled as well. “I probably needed to hear that more than I’d like to admit. I’ve been hesitant, but I think I need to now. Plus, there’s a war on. Any moment could be my last in a ship fight.” Oskar sighed with a slight melancholy before standing and fixing his uniform. “Thank you, sir. For listening and not just nodding and agreeing with me the whole time. I needed that.” Oskar rubbed the back of his head. “Obviously I’m no expert, but should you need to talk at any time, I’ll always open the hub door for you.”
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 10-Feb-21 10:30 PM
"I appreciate that, Lieutenant. In fact, I might even take you up on it." Blue eyes crinkled at the corners as the chief smiled, standing as well and offering his hand-- a gesture he did not regularly perform, as a Cardassian, but one that he felt was appropriate under the circumstances. "The same goes for you. I wish you the best of luck in your endeavors, but I expect you not to be a stranger."
Lieutenant Oskar König 10-Feb-21 10:47 PM
Oskar shook the Commanders hand. “I’d never think of it sir. I’ll uh...see you around.” Oskar gave a slight bow to Parlac as he left the office and disappeared into the hallway.
Lieutenant Rineva Sh'zhyvin 11-Feb-21 05:32 PM
[D] Ding! The doorbell chimed.
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 11-Feb-21 05:33 PM
"Enter!" The door was going to be revolving today, it appeared.
Lieutenant Rineva Sh'zhyvin 11-Feb-21 05:34 PM
Nev did so, regarding Parlac with a nod. “Lieutenant Rineva Sh’zhyvin reporting for duty, sir.”
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 11-Feb-21 05:36 PM
Parlac stood as Rineva entered and offered a polite smile. "Come in, have a seat. Anything to drink?" He carried a pair of mugs to reclimator, then paused, awaiting an answer.
Lieutenant Rineva Sh'zhyvin 11-Feb-21 05:51 PM
"Ah, well- just some water would be nice, thank you." They said, taking a seat and grinning slightly at their next statement. "I've just come from the bar, and Commander T'Svai seemed to rather enjoy her glass of it."
4
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 11-Feb-21 05:53 PM
"Water it is!" he chuckled, and directed the replicator to produce a glass, "That sounds accurate for Commander T'Svai. How are you finding the Phoenix so far?" The water was placed on the desk in front of Rineva and Parlac took his seat again.
Lieutenant Rineva Sh'zhyvin 11-Feb-21 06:01 PM
Nev picked up the glass, but neglected to drink from it just yet. "It's been very nice so far, though I can't say I've done all that much exploring. My experience is limited to sickbay, my quarters, and the bar, though that isn't to say they don't all receive high marks in my book. I'm glad to be onboard."
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 11-Feb-21 06:05 PM
"We're glad to have you-- or at least I can confidently say that I am," He smiled warmly. "I've looked over your record, and I'm thrilled you'll be joining us as my new ACOS. Before get too far into this, how do you prefer to be called and what are your pronouns?" He held a PADD in one hand, prepared to jot down notes.
Lieutenant Rineva Sh'zhyvin 11-Feb-21 06:17 PM
"Oh, well thank you. I appreciate it." Nev replied, taking a sip of their drink. "As for your question, you can call me Nev- though Rineva is fine too, of course, if that's what you'd like to call me. I use they/them pronouns for myself."
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 11-Feb-21 06:21 PM
"Noted." Quite literally, as the chief jotted it down on his PADD. "Now then, as I said I've read through your record, but I'd like to know in your own words what made you choose to pursue ACOS, if you don't mind."
Lieutenant Rineva Sh'zhyvin 11-Feb-21 06:37 PM
Nev hummed. "Good question. Well, I suppose I've always been rather... 'assertive' to put it bluntly, 'confident' if you're looking for something more nice. I found myself in a leadership position on more than one occasion on more than one posting, and on my last posting- the Parris Island- one of our more recent away missions tipped my CO off to that, hence the promotion offer." They explained. "To be honest with you, sir, I wasn't fully expecting it, but I'm glad it happened."
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 11-Feb-21 06:42 PM
More notes went down onto the PADD, and a single, scaled brow was raised at the self-description of assertiveness, but the chief said nothing until they'd finished speaking. "I daresay we're glad it happened as well. I can only assume you are already familiar with all the standard basic procedures and information about security, so I'll spare you the long version, but we run bi-weekly training sessions and weapons drills here. As ACOS, I'm going to request your assistance in writing and running those programs. We had been gearing up to run emergency preparedness drills for environmental hazards and the like, but given recent events I'd like to transition to Iconian boarding parties and bioweapon attacks. It is imperative that our department is ready and able to handle anything this conflict has to throw at us, and to that end my office is always open for any questions or suggestions-- please feel free to drop me a note or come by my office at any time. Especially in your role, I will always make time to hear your thoughts. Questions so far?"
Lieutenant Rineva Sh'zhyvin 11-Feb-21 06:54 PM
Whew- there it was. The Iconian... situation. “You’ve answered most of them, actually. I was curious about what the department was doing to prepare for the Iconians, so I’m glad to hear about the programs- and of course, I’m happy to assist with them.” They replied. “I do have one question- how coordinated are the departments onboard? And to add on, how coordinated are we with our KDF escort? I gather there’s been quite a bit of shifting of command and crew recently, so I’m curious how smoothly communication is running- especially in the event of an attack.”
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 11-Feb-21 07:12 PM
"I'd say we're reasonably coordinated, but it could definitely be better. There's always room for improvement, and I think we, as most ships, struggle with a bit of a divide on the uniform colors, you know how it is. Mostly it's all in good fun, of course." The chief steepled his fingers and observed Nev over them. "As for the KDF escort, well-- we've not run any drills with them, if that's what you're asking. So far, they've just been flying next to us and several of their crew have beamed over to partake of our facilities."
Lieutenant Rineva Sh'zhyvin 11-Feb-21 08:08 PM
Nev nodded in acknowledgement. "I see. I'm glad they're mingling with the crew, regardless of whether it's through fun or drills- good relations are necessary for any kind of operation, though I'm sure you know that." They commented. "Hopefully the drills over here will have the same effect between our divisions."
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 11-Feb-21 08:11 PM
"I should hope so. We have recently brought on a new CTO, I think it would be beneficial for us to work with him directly on some drills with tactical and security working in tandem." A PADD was slid across the desk to Nev. "This is your standard issue security PADD, it should have all pertinent information on it, including where to report for duty and so on."
Lieutenant Rineva Sh'zhyvin 11-Feb-21 08:35 PM
They took the PADD. "Oh, thank you." They turned it over a few times in their hands, before directing another glance to Parlac. "I haven't met the new CTO yet, but I'm sure I'll run into him eventually- perhaps discuss some of what we've talked about. I don't have any other questions at the moment, but I should thank you though, sir- I've felt very warmly welcomed here, yourself included. I have a feeling this is going to be a good posting."
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 11-Feb-21 08:51 PM
The comment elicited another broad grin from the Cardassian, scales crinkling at the corners of his eyes and mouth. "You are most welcome. I look forward to working with you, Lieutenant." He stood and offered a semi-formal inclining of the head, respectfully. "Dismissed."
Lieutenant Rineva Sh'zhyvin 11-Feb-21 08:54 PM
Nev offered a warm smile in return as they stood. "Thank you. I look forward to working with you as well." And with that, they exited the office into the hallway.
Ensign Herne 11-Feb-21 09:19 PM
Herne made his way towards the office before beeping the button, waiting to be let in.
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 11-Feb-21 09:20 PM
"Enter!" Parlac called out. No sooner had one security officer left than another arrived, it seemed.
Ensign Herne 11-Feb-21 09:23 PM
Herne would bite his lip before opening the door and stepping in, his hands behind his back in a towering presence at 6.4 ft. “Sir”. (edited)
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 11-Feb-21 09:27 PM
"Ensign! Come in, have a seat," He regarded the much taller Hirogen, noting immediately that this must be Ensign Herne. "Herne, is it?"
Ensign Herne 11-Feb-21 09:31 PM
Herne nodded his head as he moved over to towards the nearby seat and sat down. “Yes sir...that is my name”.
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 11-Feb-21 09:33 PM
"Good to meet you, Ensign. Anything to drink?" A glass of water, mostly untouched, was being cleared away as he spoke, taken to the reclimator.
Ensign Herne 11-Feb-21 09:39 PM
“If it’s possible sir could I get some coffee please” Herne spoke honestly toward his CO whilst also doing his very best not to show that he was still nervous.
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 11-Feb-21 09:43 PM
"Of course," Parlac said warmly, replicating a mug of the Terran beverage and a mug of gelat for himself before returning to the desk. "This is your standard issue security PADD, it should have all pertinent information on it, including where to report for duty and so on. I'm assuming you're familiar with standard Starfleet security protocols, so I won't bore you with details." He pushed a PADD across to Herne.
Ensign Herne 11-Feb-21 09:48 PM
“No sir....I’m more than familiar with security protocols. “ Herne would proceed to drink of some of his coffee before chuckling. Herne would also then grab the PADD and scan over it as he drank. “Sir if I may ask have you seen my record”.
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 11-Feb-21 09:52 PM
"I have, yes. Is there something in particular you wanted to discuss?"
Ensign Herne 11-Feb-21 09:54 PM
“No sir I was just curious if you have seen it but now you bring it up I’m curious about what you think of it”.
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 11-Feb-21 09:58 PM
"It looks like you've had a fairly standard service record so far, though you've been reassigned several times for such a short career, but that's not too out of the ordinary. Good marks at the Academy, good recommendations on your record." The Cardassian leaned back in his seat and regarded the young ensign. "You don't need to be nervous, Ensign. You're just here to report for duty."
Ensign Herne 11-Feb-21 10:01 PM
“I know sir....sorry. If you want to know why I was moved around several times, first time was a space station. I cannot stand them, it’s just not got the same feeling as a ship and as for the other ships I was on. The reasons behind them that is a little more personal”. The Hirogen rubbed the back of his neck before finishing off the coffee.
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 11-Feb-21 10:10 PM
"I did a stint on a station as well, I understand," he said, smiling warmly, "I won't press for personal details, Ensign, it's not my way. Moving on, we had been gearing up to run emergency preparedness drills for environmental hazards and the like, but given recent events we'll be transitioning to Iconian boarding parties and bioweapon attacks. It is imperative that our department is ready and able to handle anything this conflict has to throw at us. Any questions so far?"
Ensign Herne 11-Feb-21 10:16 PM
“None sir and I am familiar with eviromental hazards already...growing up on a ship does that to you and other things....” The Hirogen would say before chuckling more before he put the empty mug of coffee down “If you wish sir...I know it’s now my place but if you want I could show the others Tetryon based weapons just encase”.
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 11-Feb-21 10:26 PM
"Being familiar with environmental hazards wouldn't excuse you from the drills, but as a I said we are transition to Iconian boarding parties and bioweapon attacks for now, in preparedness for the war." He paused and considered the ensign's question for a moment before continuing. "If you'd like to write up a proposal on what you know, I'd be happy to review it and see about a demonstration of sorts."
Ensign Herne 11-Feb-21 10:28 PM
Herne nodded his head in understanding “I know sir and I wasn’t going to use it as an excuse from the drills. I was only saying I was familiar with environmental hazards...as for the boarding parties and bio weapons this should be some good experience”.
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 11-Feb-21 10:37 PM
"Good. Alright, that covers everything you need to get started. As I said, any questions or suggestions you have, my office is always open and if I'm not here, you can drop me a note. If you have no further questions, then you are dismissed." Parlac smiled again, hoping the ensign felt less nervous now than he had seemed when he first walked in.
Ensign Herne 11-Feb-21 10:40 PM
Herne would nod his head, offering a warm smile. “Yes sir and thank you sir...I’ll see if I can draft you my suggestion to you....and see if I can get a working weapon to show the others possibly”. With that Herne would make his way out to the hallway. (edited)
Commander T'Svai 12-Feb-21 07:28 PM
[D] Ding!
To: Senior Staff, USS Phoenix From: Commander T'Svai Live long and prosper. First, it is a privilege to be working with all of you under the present circumstances. Second, I am told it is customary for first officers to establish a rapport with the other senior staff. While for the most part we are already acquainted, I believe it would be appropriate to gather once in a while in an informal setting to bolster said acquaintanceship and exchange ideas in a more casual setting. Simply put, you are all invited to dinner in my quarters in two days' time at 1830 hours. Attendance is of course optional. Please inform me if you have any dietary restrictions and be advised the occasion will be postponed in the event of a yellow alert or higher. Sincerely, Commander T'Svai
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 12-Feb-21 10:18 PM
[D] Parlac exited his office at the announcement of a yellow alert.
Commander T'Svai 10-Mar-21 01:45 AM
[D] Ding!
To: Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac From: Cmdr. T'Svai CC: Captain Syrezeaju
>
One of your officers, Ensign Jaime Devereux, was recently observed attempting to convince Medical to use an unidentified, untested compound, which they claimed was a classified antitoxin, on a dying Ensign from Tactical. For reasons I trust I do not need to explain, I suggest you speak to them about this incident when possible.
>
Sincerely, Commander T'Svai
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 10-Mar-21 07:35 PM
Narrowing his eyes at the incoming transmission, Parlac tapped his comm badge.
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 12-Mar-21 07:44 PM
[D] Exhausted after a long day of working through civilian evacuation plans, Parlac opted to head out and get some rest.
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 25-Mar-21 07:04 PM
The chief entered his office and took a few moments to tend to Mikat before settling down at his desk with a stack of PADDs and a fresh mug of gelat.
Lieutenant Rineva Sh'zhyvin 26-Mar-21 06:12 PM
[D] The door chimed.
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 26-Mar-21 06:13 PM
"Enter!" Parlac called, setting aside the PADD he'd been reading.
Lieutenant Rineva Sh'zhyvin 26-Mar-21 06:16 PM
Nev did so, stepping into the office with arms loosely crossed over their chest. "So." They began, "I'll cut right to the chase. Recent events have certainly... happened."
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 26-Mar-21 06:17 PM
Not normally one to let his emotions show quite as easily, Parlac sighed and pinched the bridge of his nose. "Good afternoon, Lieutenant. Please, have a seat. Can I get you anything to eat? Drink? I assume this isn't going to be a short conversation." He stood, grabbing his own empty mug and heading for the replicator-- even if they weren't going to have anything, he was going to have more gelat.
Lieutenant Rineva Sh'zhyvin 26-Mar-21 06:25 PM
"Coffee, please. I think we're of the same opinion there." They said, taking a seat as indicated. "This will probably be a very long conversation. I certainly didn't see any of this coming, but then again- I didn't know the Ensign."
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 26-Mar-21 06:27 PM
Parlac replicated the gelat and requested coffee, then made his way back over to the desk and passed one steaming hot mug to Nev. "I didn't know them as well as I would have liked-- although now I count that as a blessing. It was painful enough to learn of their betrayal, I can only imagine how much worse it could have been." It was clear by Parlac's expression that this topic was still fairly fresh and raw, but he knew he needed to have this conversation with his ACOS, and it was better to get it over with.
2
2
2
1
Lieutenant Rineva Sh'zhyvin 26-Mar-21 06:38 PM
They frowned sympathetically, very much picking up on Parlac's emotions. They held the mug of coffee in their hands for a moment, before deciding against a sip for now. "Have you seen many of the details from their trial? I got the basic information, of course, but I'm curious if they provided any kind of rationalization behind their joining." They asked.
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 26-Mar-21 06:41 PM
"From the transcript, it sounds like they felt forced into it-- coerced or threatened, it seems." He shook his head, sympathetic to the nature of Jaime's plight but clearly not swayed entirely to their side. "I can't help but question it, of course. Section 31 isn't an organization joined lightly, and the training one receives... I can only imagine they're an expert at deception. I question the decision that has been made in keeping them in Starfleet, especially keeping them onboard the Phoenix, in light of everything. But it was not my place to make the call."
Lieutenant Rineva Sh'zhyvin 26-Mar-21 07:07 PM
They let out a long sigh. "Coercion seems to be Section 31's- what's the term... modus operandi? Regardless, I can't say I'm surprised. I'd be interested to hear it straight from Ensign Devereux." They remarked. "I do agree with you on the Starfleet decision, but I believe Intel is the best place for them since they're going to stay. If I learned anything during my time there, it'll definitely keep them in check."
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 26-Mar-21 07:10 PM
"It's certainly a series of decisions that I don't agree with and not a single, outstanding one. I don't think I've ever been so at odds with a decision of the admiralty, but-- Allowing a Section 31 agent to remain in Starfleet, and then further allowing them to maintain their rank and their position on the same ship." Parlac took a long sip of his gelat, opting to choke on the bitter beverage rather than the outpouring of anger he was treading carefully around. Nev didn't deserve to hear him vent about this, and he refused to lose his temper. "I can't believe I was ready to recommend them for a promotion."
3
1
1
1
1
1
2
Lieutenant Rineva Sh'zhyvin 26-Mar-21 08:04 PM
"I..." They paused, thinking for a moment, before continuing. "This is a very heavy issue, indeed. I'm sorry I didn't come to discuss it with you sooner. You mentioned a promotion, which I wholeheartedly assume is off the table now, but aside from that- Ensign Devereux is still the assigned security officer for the Chimera. Do you think that should continue to be the case or should we recommend a change to the Captain?"
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 26-Mar-21 08:06 PM
"Considering they're no longer a security officer at all, we are absolutely going to need to change that. Of course, you'll need to remain on board the Phoenix as acting chief of security while I'm on the Chimera, so we'll need to consider the other officers available for that position. Do you have any thoughts on the matter? Ultimately, it's down to the captain but I welcome your insight." Grateful for the shift in topics, Parlac happily accepted the lifeline extended in the form of discussing Chimera crew postings.
Lieutenant Rineva Sh'zhyvin 26-Mar-21 08:31 PM
"Right." Right indeed- Nev of course knew deep down that Parlac's deployment on the Chimera would result in them having to act as chief of security, but it was still some sort of strange to hear. "I don't have the kind of knowledge of the department that I'm sure you have, though I trust there's several capable officers who could step up. Based on what I know from the roster, I would recommend... perhaps Lieutenant Walsh or Lieutenant t'Tumisa. They both have exceptional records, as far as I can tell."
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 26-Mar-21 08:37 PM
Parlac winced at Lieutenant t'Tumisa's name. "Ah, it seems t'Tumisa's record hasn't been updated then. She... had an altercation with an unsanctioned Starfleet weapon on her last away mission. Not that that prevents her from capably serving on the Chimera, should the need arise, but I would hardly call her record flawless anymore. Walsh isn't a bad idea, I could see her doing well in that position." He nodded as he spoke, jotting down a few notes on a PADD and then taking another sip of gelat. "How are you finding the Phoenix so far? Are you comfortable in your new role?"
Lieutenant Rineva Sh'zhyvin 26-Mar-21 08:50 PM
"Goodness." They took down a few notes on their PADD as well- namely, 'actually get up to date with what's going on in the department'. "Well, I'm glad one of my suggestions holds some water. I'll be interested to see who ends up assigned." They remarked, before taking a drink of coffee. "As for myself, I've been getting along well- I don't have any issues with my role at all. Maybe hurting a bit on the social side of things, but that's probably my own fault-" A small laugh followed that. "The people I have met so far have been good company, within the department or otherwise."
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 26-Mar-21 08:54 PM
"That's good to hear, Lieutenant. I'm grateful to have you around, even if we haven't gotten to spend much time getting to know each other yet. We should rectify that, at some point. I'd like to make sure I'm on good terms with my ACOS." He allowed himself a small smile, leaning back in his chair and becoming visibly more relaxed. "What do you like to do outside of work? Any exercise programs you run on the holodeck?"
Lieutenant Rineva Sh'zhyvin 26-Mar-21 09:29 PM
"Oh-! I'm glad you asked, actually, reminds me I need to get around to checking out the holodecks myself. As for exercise, I enjoy sparring or archery. The first more-so developed as a reaction to having older brothers, but I picked up archery at the Academy. I brought my bow aboard, actually- only for recreational purposes, of course." They replied. "How about yourself?"
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 26-Mar-21 10:41 PM
"I picked up wrestling at the academy, as it happens. But sparring-- I had four older brothers growing up, so I am intimately familiar with that concept," he chuckled, smiling fondly at the memories, "Perhaps we should arrange something at some point, some friendly sparring to get to know each other and get some exercise in, hm? I must admit, I've never tried archery but it certainly looks interesting. What drew you to such an archaic sport, if you don't mind my asking?"
Lieutenant Rineva Sh'zhyvin 26-Mar-21 10:58 PM
“Oo, wrestling? I’d rather enjoy that- the sparring offer, that is. Holographic partners can get a bit boring after a while.” They said with a grin. “And you’d actually not be the first to ask that. When I first got to the Academy, I was a bit of a... lone wolf, but my roommate encouraged me to join a history club with them. Parts of it were a bit boring, but then we started getting into old-age weapons. My roommate bet I couldn’t get good at using one of them by the end of the year. Needless to say I proved them wrong.”
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 26-Mar-21 11:00 PM
"Are you a particularly challenge-motivated individual?" Parlac asked with a grin. One hand absently scrolled the display on his PADD-- and then he sat up and leaned forward. "Oh, it appears... It appears the captain is having a drink at Aelor's and has put out an open invitation to the crew to join her. Would you be interested?"
Lieutenant Rineva Sh'zhyvin 26-Mar-21 11:03 PM
“Perhaps you could say that... of course it depends on the challenge.” Their grin changed into a look of interest at the bar invite, however, and they set their mug on Parlac’s desk. “I would. I’ve met quite a few good people in the bar already, so why not extend that, hmm?”
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 26-Mar-21 11:09 PM
"Delightful," he said, standing. "Shall we?" He headed for the door, opened it, and stepped through, waiting for them to follow.
Lieutenant Rineva Sh'zhyvin 26-Mar-21 11:09 PM
They tucked away their PADD and followed.
